analyzed: blun zhing mi mkhas la sdig pa'i grogs po la brten pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnyis pa'o ;
translated: Relying on a foolish, unskilled, and sinful friend is the second secondary affliction.

original: ; bla ma dang / rje bo dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / phyir rgol ba la sogs pas nan gyis mnan te /
analyzed: ; bla ma dang / rje bo dang / rgyal po dang / chom rkun dang / phyir rgol ba la sogs pas nan gyis mnan te /
translated: Being forced by a guru, master, king, thief, or opponent,

original: bdag la dbang med pa dang / sems kyi 'khrul pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la dbang med pa dang / sems kyi 'khrul pa 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: and being powerless and confused in mind is the third secondary affliction.

original: yo byad med cing 'tsho ba la lta ba 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad med cing 'tsho ba la lta ba 'di ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: Lacking resources and having a livelihood that is looked down upon is the fourth secondary affliction.

original: @7a * // byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa yang rgyu bzhis na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: @7a * // byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang ldan pa yang rgyu bzhis na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar mi nus so //
translated: One who possesses the bodhisattva potential is unable to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood due to four causes.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi lam phyin ci ma log par ston pa dang ma phrad pa 'di ni rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dang po nyid nas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas sam byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi lam phyin ci ma log par ston pa dang ma phrad pa 'di ni rgyu dang po'o //
translated: Here, the first cause is that the bodhisattva, from the very beginning, does not meet with a spiritual teacher, a Buddha or a bodhisattva, who can show the path to enlightenment without error.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu 'dzin cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu 'dzin cing /
translated: Moreover, even if the bodhisattva does meet with a spiritual teacher, he has a distorted understanding of the bodhisattva trainings.

original: phyin ci log tu slob pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //üîΩgzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu slob pa 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o // gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la /
translated: The second cause is that he trains in a distorted way.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu mi slob tu zin kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la phyin ci log tu mi slob tu zin kyang /
translated: Moreover, even if the bodhisattva does meet with a spiritual teacher and does not train in a distorted way in the bodhisattva trainings,

original: sbyor ba de la sbyong ba g-yel zhing le lo byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba de la sbyong ba g-yel zhing le lo byed pa yin te /
translated: he is negligent and lazy in his practice of them.

original: shas cher rgyun du brtson pa dang mi ldan pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: shas cher rgyun du brtson pa dang mi ldan pa 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: The third cause is that he is not generally diligent and persistent.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la yang phyin ci ma log par slob cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang phrad la byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dag la yang phyin ci ma log par slob cing /
translated: Furthermore, a bodhisattva may have met with a spiritual teacher and may be training without error in the bodhisattva trainings.

original: sbyor ba de la brtson 'grus brtsams su zin kyang /
analyzed: sbyor ba de la brtson 'grus brtsams su zin kyang /
translated: And he may have begun to apply himself with perseverance to those practices.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yun ring du nyams 'og tu chud par ma byas pas dbang po yongs su ma smin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yun ring du nyams 'og tu chud par ma byas pas dbang po yongs su ma smin pa dang byang chub kyi phyogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa ste /
translated: But if he has not for a long time brought the factors of enlightenment to mind, his faculties are not fully ripened and he has not completed the factors of enlightenment. This is the fourth cause.

original: rigs yod du zin kyang rgyu 'di dag dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub mi thob la /
analyzed: rigs yod du zin kyang rgyu 'di dag dang ldan pa'i phyir byang chub mi thob la /
translated: Even if he has the potential, he will not attain enlightenment if he has these causes.

original: mi ldan na ni thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi ldan na ni thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he does not have them, he will attain it.

original: rigs med na ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad du byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ba kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs med na ni thams cad kyi thams cad rnam pa thams cad du byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ba kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: But if he does not have the potential, it should be understood that he will not attain enlightenment in any way at all.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the potential, the first chapter in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: rigs kyi le'u ste dang po'o /
analyzed: rigs kyi le'u ste dang po'o /
translated: Chapter I

original: // /'di la byang chub sems dpa'i dang po'i sems bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dge ba'i smon lam thams cad kyi nang na yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi dang po yin te /
analyzed: // /'di la byang chub sems dpa'i dang po'i sems bskyed pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dge ba'i smon lam thams cad kyi nang na yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi dang po yin te /
translated: The first generation of the thought of enlightenment of the bodhisattva is the first true prayer of all the true prayers of the bodhisattva,

original: de las gzhan pa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i yang dag pa'i smon lam rnams sdud pa yin no //
translated: and it includes all the other true prayers.

original: de lta bas na de ni yang dag pa'i smon lam dang po'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni yang dag pa'i smon lam dang po'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the essence of the first true prayer.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub tu sems kyis smon lam 'debs pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub tu sems kyis smon lam 'debs pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattva formulates the prayer for enlightenment with the thought of enlightenment,

original: 'di ltar sems mngon par 'du @7b byed cing /üîΩtshig 'di skad ces kyang smras te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mngon par 'du @7b byed cing /üîΩtshig 'di skad ces kyang smras te /
translated: he does so with the following thought:üîΩMay I become a Buddha for the welfare of the world.

original: kye ma bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyi don yang byed cing shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'god par gyur cig ces de de ltar bdag gi byang chub dang sems can gyi don sgrub pa na /
analyzed: kye ma bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gyur cig / sems can thams cad kyi don yang byed cing shin tu mthar thug pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'god par gyur cig ces de de ltar bdag gi byang chub dang sems can gyi don sgrub pa na /
translated: Thus, when he is accomplishing his own enlightenment and the welfare of sentient beings,

original: sems skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sems skyed par byed do //
translated: he generates the thought.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the generation of the thought is the aspect of accomplishment.

original: sems bskyed pa de yang byang chub de dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs nas sgrub par byed kyi /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de yang byang chub de dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs nas sgrub par byed kyi /
translated: Moreover, that generation of the thought is accomplished by focusing on enlightenment and on the welfare of sentient beings,

original: dmigs pa med par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par ni ma yin te /
translated: not without a focus.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni byang chub la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni byang chub la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the generation of the thought is focused on enlightenment and on the welfare of sentient beings.

original: sems bskyed pa de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sdud pa'i thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad sdud pa'i thog mar 'gro ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, this generation of the Thought is endowed with the qualities of virtue, of supreme virtue, of goodness, of supreme goodness, of excellence, of supreme excellence, because it is the first step in gathering all the roots of virtue which are the elements leading to enlightenment.

original: dge ba dang / mchog tu dge ba dang / bzang ba dang / mchog tu bzang ba dang / legs pa dang / mchog tu legs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / sems can thams cad la brten pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa spyod pa dang mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mchog tu dge ba dang / bzang ba dang / mchog tu bzang ba dang / legs pa dang / mchog tu legs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / sems can thams cad la brten pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes pa spyod pa dang mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: It is not in accord with the evil conduct of body, speech, and mind which is based on all sentient beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dang po sems bskyed pa de ni de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dag la yang dag pa'i smon lam dge ba de dag thams cad kyi nang na yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi mchog bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dang po sems bskyed pa de ni de las gzhan pa 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i don dag la yang dag pa'i smon lam dge ba de dag thams cad kyi nang na yang dag pa'i smon lam gyi mchog bla na med pa yin no //
translated: This first generation of the Thought of the Bodhisattva is the supreme, unsurpassed right aspiration among all the right aspirations of virtue for the sake of the mundane and supramundane aims, other than that.

original: de ltar na dang po sems bskyed pa de ni ngo bo nyid las kyang rig par bya /
analyzed: de ltar na dang po sems bskyed pa de ni ngo bo nyid las kyang rig par bya /
translated: Thus, this first generation of the Thought is to be known from its own-nature,

original: rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / yon tan dang / khyad par du 'phags pa las kyang mtshan nyid lngar rig par bya'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ni sems de bskyed ma thag tu bla na med pa'i byang chub theg pa chen po la zhugs pa dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / yon tan dang / khyad par du 'phags pa las kyang mtshan nyid lngar rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' ni sems de bskyed ma thag tu bla na med pa'i byang chub theg pa chen po la zhugs pa dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: It should be understood that the generation of the Thought of Enlightenment has five characteristics:

original: brda dang / tha snyad kyi tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yang yin te /
analyzed: brda dang / tha snyad kyi tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba yang yin te /
translated: As soon as the Bodhisattva has generated that Thought, he enters the Great Vehicle to unsurpassed enlightenment, and he is called a Bodhisattva, in the sense of a conventional designation.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni 'jug par bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni 'jug par bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that generation of the Thought is included in the entrance.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems de bskyed nas rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems de bskyed nas rim gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The Bodhisattva, having generated that Thought, gradually becomes fully enlightened in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: ma bskyed par ni ma @8a * //
analyzed: ma bskyed par ni ma @8a * //
translated: but not without having generated it.

original: yin te ; de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: yin te ; de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that generation of the Thought is the root of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams la snying rje dang ldan zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva, who is compassionate toward suffering sentient beings,

original: yongs su bskyab par sems pa yang sems de skyed par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su bskyab par sems pa yang sems de skyed par byed de /
translated: and who wishes to protect them, generates that thought.

original: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems bskyed pa de ni snying rje'i rgyu mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that generation of the thought is the natural outcome of compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems bskyed pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems bskyed pa de la brten cing gnas nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, relying on and grounded in that generation of the thought,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sems can gyi don bya ba dag la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / sems can gyi don bya ba dag la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: applies himself to the bodhisattva trainings, the factors of awakening, and the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de lta bas /
analyzed: de lta bas /
translated: Thus,

original: na sems bskyed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams kyi rten yin te /
analyzed: na sems bskyed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa rnams kyi rten yin te /
translated: that generation of the thought is the basis of the bodhisattva trainings.

original: de ltar dang po sems bskyed pa de ni bsdu ba dang / rtsa ba dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rten du gyur pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dang po sems bskyed pa de ni bsdu ba dang / rtsa ba dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rten du gyur pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, the first generation of the thought should be understood as the collection, the root, the natural outcome, and the basis.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dang po sems bskyed pa de yang mdor na rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dang po sems bskyed pa de yang mdor na rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva‚Äôs first generation of the thought is twofold:

original: nges par 'byin pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa dang / nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: the definite and the indefinite.

original: de la nges par 'byin pa ni gang skyes nas gtan du 'jug la phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la nges par 'byin pa ni gang skyes nas gtan du 'jug la phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The definite is that which, once arisen, is always present and does not turn back.

original: nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa de ni gang skyes nas gtan du mi 'jug la phyir ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa de ni gang skyes nas gtan du mi 'jug la phyir ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The indefinite is that which, once arisen, is not always present and does turn back.

original: sems bskyed pa de'i ldog pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de'i ldog pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The turning back of that generation of the mind is also of two kinds:

original: gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: the definite and the indefinite.

original: de la gtan du ba ni 'di ltar sems lan cig log nas phyis byang chub kyi phyir mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la gtan du ba ni 'di ltar sems lan cig log nas phyis byang chub kyi phyir mi skye ba'o //
translated: The definite is that which, having turned back once, does not arise again for the sake of enlightenment.

original: gtan du ba ma yin pa ni 'di ltar sems log kyang byang chub kyi phyir yang dang yang skye bar 'gyur ba'o /
analyzed: gtan du ba ma yin pa ni 'di ltar sems log kyang byang chub kyi phyir yang dang yang skye bar 'gyur ba'o /
translated: The indefinite is that which, having turned back, arises again and again for the sake of enlightenment.

original: sems skye ba de yang rkyen bzhi dang / rgyu bzhi dang / stobs bzhis skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems skye ba de yang rkyen bzhi dang / rgyu bzhi dang / stobs bzhis skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: That generation of the mind should be understood as arising from four conditions, four causes, and four powers.

original: de la rkyen bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rkyen bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four conditions?

original: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'di la rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Here, a son or daughter of noble family

original: rigs kyi bu mos de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble son or daughter, have you seen orüîΩheard of the inconceivable, marvelous miracles and powers of the TathƒÅgata or

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul dang / mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rmad du byung ba mthong ngam / yid brtan pa las thos kyang rung ste /
translated: of the bodhisattvas?‚Äù

analyzed: des mthong ngam thos nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: If they have not seen or heard of them, they should be told about them by

analyzed: kye ma gang la gnas par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: someone else.üîΩHaving seen or heard of them, they should think, ‚ÄúOh! The power andüîΩthe miracles that are seen or heard of in this way are great. The enlightenmentüîΩthat is seen or heard of is also powerful.‚Äù

original: zhugs par gyur pa'i mthu 'di lta bu de dang / cho 'phrul de lta bu de mthong ba dang / thos pa'i byang chub de ni mthu che ba yin no snyam @8b nas de mthu mthong ba dang thos pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: zhugs par gyur pa'i mthu 'di lta bu de dang / cho 'phrul de lta bu de mthong ba dang / thos pa'i byang chub de ni mthu che ba yin no snyam @8b nas de mthu mthong ba dang thos pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Having seen or heard of that power, they should think, ‚ÄúI will attainüîΩenlightenment.‚Äù This is the first condition for the arising of the thought of

original: byang chub chen por mos shing byang chub chen por sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen dang po'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen por mos shing byang chub chen por sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen dang po'o //
translated: enlightenment.üîΩEven if they have not seen or heard of that power, they should think, ‚ÄúI

original: des mthu mthong ba'am thos pa med du zin kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las brtsams te ;
analyzed: des mthu mthong ba'am thos pa med du zin kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las brtsams te ;
translated: will attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi sde snod ston pa na dam pa'i chos nyan par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sde snod ston pa na dam pa'i chos nyan par byed do //
translated: When the bodhisattva is teaching the canon of enlightenment, he listens to the holy Dharma.

original: mnyan nas kyang mngon par dad par byed do //
analyzed: mnyan nas kyang mngon par dad par byed do //
translated: Having listened, he has faith in it.

original: mngon par dad nas kyang dam pa'i chos thos pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mngon par dad nas kyang dam pa'i chos thos pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Having faith, he is inspired by the holy Dharma he has heard.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la mos shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la mos shing /
translated: He aspires to the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He arouses his mind to attain the wisdom of the Tathagata.

original: sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second condition for the arising of the mind.

analyzed: des chos ma thos su zin kyang byang chub sems dpa'i dam pa'i chos nub tu cha bar nye bar gyur pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: Even if he has not heard the Dharma, he sees that the holy Dharma of the bodhisattvas is about to disappear.

original: mthong nas kyang yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: mthong nas kyang yang de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Having seen that, he thinks this:

original: kye ma byang chub sems dpa'i dam pa'i chos gnas pa ni sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa yin gyis /
analyzed: kye ma byang chub sems dpa'i dam pa'i chos gnas pa ni sems can dpag tu med pa dag gi sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa yin gyis /
translated: ‚ÄúAlas! The holy Dharma of the bodhisattvas, which removes the suffering of countless beings, is disappearing.

original: bdag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: I must do whatever I can to preserve

original: sems can 'di dag nyid kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag nyid kyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove the suffering of these very sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i don du sems bskyed par bya gor ma chag snyam nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i don du sems bskyed par bya gor ma chag snyam nas /
translated: I will certainly arouse the mind of awakening in order to make the sublime Dharma of the bodhisattvas endure for a long time.üîΩWith this in mind,

original: de dam pa'i chos gzung ba nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de dam pa'i chos gzung ba nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: with regard to upholding the sublime Dharma,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la mos shing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la mos shing /
translated: he aspires to the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: and in order to attain the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas

original: sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen gsum pa'o //
translated: he arouses the mind of awakening. This is the third condition for arousing the mind of awakening.

original: des dam pa'i chos nub tu nye bar gyur pa ma mthong du zin kyang /
analyzed: des dam pa'i chos nub tu nye bar gyur pa ma mthong du zin kyang /
translated: Even though he has not seen the sublime Dharma about to disappear,üîΩat the time when the end of the eon has arrived

original: dus kyi tha ma dus kyi mjug tu bab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dus kyi tha ma dus kyi mjug tu bab pa'i tshe /
translated: and the end of the age has come,

original: dus ngan pa'i sems can rnams kyi lus 'di ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus ngan pa'i sems can rnams kyi lus 'di ltar nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bcu po 'di lta ste /
translated: the bodies of sentient beings in this degenerate age are afflicted by these ten secondary afflictions:

original: gti mug shas che ba dang / ngo tsha med cing khrel med pa shas che ba dang / phrag dog dang ser sna shas che ba dang / sdug bsngal shas che ba dang / gnas ngan len shas che ba dang / nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang /üîΩnyes par spyod pa shas che ba dang / bag med pa shas che ba dang / le lo shas che ba dang / ma dad pa shas che ba rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: gti mug shas che ba dang / ngo tsha med cing khrel med pa shas che ba dang / phrag dog dang ser sna shas che ba dang / sdug bsngal shas che ba dang / gnas ngan len shas che ba dang / nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang / nyes par spyod pa shas che ba dang / bag med pa shas che ba dang / le lo shas che ba dang / ma dad pa shas che ba rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs pa mthong ngo //
translated: He sees that beings are dominated by delusion, shamelessness, lack of conscience, envy, stinginess, suffering, bad tendencies, afflictions,

original: mthong @9a * //
analyzed: mthong @9a * //
translated: misconduct, carelessness, laziness, and lack of faith.

original: nas kyang yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: nas kyang yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Seeing this, he thinks,

original: kye ma snyigs ma'i dus chen po de ni byung gis med do //
analyzed: kye ma snyigs ma'i dus chen po de ni byung gis med do //
translated: ‚ÄúAlas! This is the great age of degeneration.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi dus 'di'i skabs su ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dman pa la sems bskyed pa yang rnyed par sla ba ma yin na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi dus 'di'i skabs su ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dman pa la sems bskyed pa yang rnyed par sla ba ma yin na /
translated: In this age of affliction, it is difficult to find even the arousal of the aspiration for the lesser enlightenment of the ≈õrƒÅvaka or the pratyekabuddha.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lta ci smos te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lta ci smos te /
translated: how much more so for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment!

original: re zhig bdag gis sems bskyed pa dang / de dag kyang 'di ltar bdag gi rjes su slob cing /
analyzed: re zhig bdag gis sems bskyed pa dang / de dag kyang 'di ltar bdag gi rjes su slob cing /
translated: I have given rise to the thought of awakening, and they are training in accordance with me.

original: gzhan dag gis kyang sems bskyed par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kyang sems bskyed par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: Others will also give rise to the thought of awakening.

original: de dus kyi tha ma'i tshe /
analyzed: de dus kyi tha ma'i tshe /
translated: At the end of time,

original: sems bskyed pa rnyed par dka' ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rnyed par dka' ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: it is difficult to find the thought of awakening.

original: byang chub chen po la mos shing byang chub chen por sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub chen po la mos shing byang chub chen por sems skyed par byed pa 'di ni sems skye ba'i rkyen bzhi pa'o //
translated: With this in mind, they aspire to great awakening and give rise to the thought of awakening. This is the fourth condition for the arising of the thought of awakening.

original: de la rgyu bzhi gang zhe na /üîΩrigs phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu bzhi gang zhe na / rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu dang po'o //
translated: What are the four causes?üîΩThe first cause for the arising of the thought of awakening in a bodhisattva is the perfection of the spiritual gene.

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second cause for the arising of the thought of awakening in a bodhisattva is being sustained by the buddhas, bodhisattvas, and spiritual teachers.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: Compassion for sentient beings is the third cause for the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / dka' ba spyad pa'i sdug bsngal yun ring po rnam pa sna tshogs pa drag pa bar chad med pas kyang mi 'jigs pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu bzhi pa'o //üîΩde la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / dka' ba spyad pa'i sdug bsngal yun ring po rnam pa sna tshogs pa drag pa bar chad med pas kyang mi 'jigs pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu bzhi pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni /
translated: Fearlessness in the face of the sufferings of cyclic existence and the sufferings of the difficult practices, even though they are long-lasting, manifold, intense, and uninterrupted, is the fourth cause for the generation of the thought of enlightenment.

original: chos nyid kyis thob pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis thob pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among these, the perfection of the bodhisattva‚Äôs spiritual gene should be understood as something naturally attained.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of the bodhisattva‚Äôs spiritual friend should be understood as fourfold:

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen ni thog ma nas kyang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i bshes gnyen ni thog ma nas kyang /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva‚Äôs spiritual friend is not a fool

original: blun po ma yin zhing /üîΩyid rtul ba'i rang bzhin can ma yin te /
analyzed: blun po ma yin zhing /üîΩyid rtul ba'i rang bzhin can ma yin te /
translated: and is not of a dull nature.

original: mkhas shing mdzangs la lta ba ngan pa la zhugs pa yang ma yin pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //üîΩbag med pa la yang de 'jug par mi byed la /
analyzed: mkhas shing mdzangs la lta ba ngan pa la zhugs pa yang ma yin pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o // bag med pa la yang de 'jug par mi byed la /
translated: The first is a spiritual teacher who is not learned and wise, but has a bad view.üîΩThe second is a spiritual teacher who does not cause one to engage in heedlessness,

original: bag med pa'i gnas kyang de la sgrub par mi byed pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas kyang de la sgrub par mi byed pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: but who does establish one in the basis of heedlessness.üîΩThe third is a spiritual teacher who does not cause one to engage in bad practices,

original: nyes par spyod pa la yang de 'jug par mi byed la nyes par spyod pa'i gnas kyang de la sgrub par @9b mi byed pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la yang de 'jug par mi byed la nyes par spyod pa'i gnas kyang de la sgrub par @9b mi byed pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: but who does establish one in the basis of bad practices.

original: de dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / yang dag par blang ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi yon tan ches khyad par du 'phags pa dag las 'dun pa bzlog la /
analyzed: de dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / yang dag par blang ba dang / brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi yon tan ches khyad par du 'phags pa dag las 'dun pa bzlog la /
translated: The fourth is a spiritual teacher who causes one to turn away from the excellence of faith, will, proper aspiration, effort, and skillful means,

original: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / yang dag par blang ba dang ; brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi yon tan ches dman pa dag la 'jug par mi byed de /
analyzed: dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / yang dag par blang ba dang ; brtson 'grus dang / thabs kyi yon tan ches dman pa dag la 'jug par mi byed de /
translated: They do not engage in inferior qualities of faith, aspiration, correct adoption, effort, and skillful means.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩtheg pa chen po las 'dun pa bzlog la /üîΩnyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / theg pa chen po las 'dun pa bzlog la / nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la 'jug par mi byed pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la /üîΩbsams pa las byung ba la 'jug pa'am /üîΩbsams pa las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la 'jug par mi byed pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la / bsams pa las byung ba la 'jug pa'am / bsams pa las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la /
translated: They do not turn away from the aspiration for the Great Vehicle and engage in the Vehicle of the Hearers or the Vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas.

original: thos pa las byung ba la 'jug pa 'am /üîΩthos pa las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la /üîΩzhal ta byed pa la 'jug par mi byed pa dang / tshul khrims las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba la 'jug pa 'am / thos pa las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la / zhal ta byed pa la 'jug par mi byed pa dang / tshul khrims las byung ba las 'dun pa bzlog la /
translated: They do not turn away from the aspiration for what arises from meditation and engage in what arises from reflection or turn away from the aspiration for what arises from reflection and engage in what arises from listening or turn away from the aspiration for what arises from listening and engage in service.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba la 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba la 'jug pa'am /
translated: They do not turn away from the aspiration for what arises from moral discipline and engage in what arises from generosity or turn away from the aspiration for what arises from patience and engage in what arises from effort.

original: de ltar 'di lta bu dang mthun pa'i yon tan ches khyad par du 'phags pa dag las 'dun pa bzlog la /
analyzed: de ltar 'di lta bu dang mthun pa'i yon tan ches khyad par du 'phags pa dag las 'dun pa bzlog la /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva turns away from the aspiration for such qualities that are far superior,

original: 'di lta bu dang mthun pa'i yon tan ches dman pa dag 'dzin du 'jug par mi byed pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa bzhi pa'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis na /
analyzed: 'di lta bu dang mthun pa'i yon tan ches dman pa dag 'dzin du 'jug par mi byed pa 'di ni bshes gnyen phun sum tshogs pa bzhi pa'o // byang chub sems dpa' ni rgyu rnam pa bzhis na /
translated: and does not cause others to adopt such qualities that are far inferior. This is the fourth excellence of a spiritual teacher.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i shas che ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje ba'i shas che ba yin te /
translated: For four reasons, the bodhisattva has a great deal of compassion for sentient beings.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sdug bsngal med pa de lta bu dag kyang yod na /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' de ni gang na sdug bsngal yod cing /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sdug bsngal med pa de lta bu dag kyang yod na / byang chub sems dpa' de ni gang na sdug bsngal yod cing /
translated: There are world systems in the limitless and boundless universes of the ten directions that are devoid of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i khams su skye bar byed kyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i khams su skye bar byed kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva is born in a realm that has suffering

original: sdug bsngal med par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med par ni ma yin te /
translated: and not in a realm that is devoid of suffering.üîΩWhatever suffering there is,

original: gzhan sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas thebs shing gnod par gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas thebs shing gnod par gyur te /
translated: he is affected by it and harmed by it.

original: non pa mthong ba dang / bdag kyang sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas thebs shing gnod par gyur te non pa mthong ba dang / gzhan nam bdag gam gnyis ka yang rung ste /üîΩsdug bsngal yun ring ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa drag po bar chad med pas thebs shing gnod par gyur te non pa mthong na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de ni rang gi rigs @10a * //
analyzed: non pa mthong ba dang / bdag kyang sdug bsngal ci yang rung bas thebs shing gnod par gyur te non pa mthong ba dang / gzhan nam bdag gam gnyis ka yang rung ste / sdug bsngal yun ring ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa drag po bar chad med pas thebs shing gnod par gyur te non pa mthong na 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' de ni rang gi rigs @10a * //
translated: When he sees himself or another or both afflicted and oppressed by any kind of suffering,üîΩor when he sees them afflicted and oppressed by long-lasting, manifold, violent, and uninterrupted suffering,

original: la brten cing /
analyzed: la brten cing /
translated: then the bodhisattva, who is of good disposition and who is supported by his own family,

original: rang bzhin gyis dge bas na goms pa med par yang dmigs pa rten bzhi po 'di dag gis snying rje chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dge bas na goms pa med par yang dmigs pa rten bzhi po 'di dag gis snying rje chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: generates a small, middling, or great compassion, even without practice, through these four objects of meditation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la snying rje yang dag par sngon du btang nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can rnams la snying rje yang dag par sngon du btang nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having compassion for sentient beings,

original: rgyu bzhi po 'di dag gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yun ring ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa drag po bar chad med pas kyang mi 'jigs shing mi skrag na chung ngus lta ci smos te /
analyzed: rgyu bzhi po 'di dag gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yun ring ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa drag po bar chad med pas kyang mi 'jigs shing mi skrag na chung ngus lta ci smos te /
translated: If they are not afraid or terrified by the long, manifold, and intense sufferings of cyclic existence, what need is there to mention minor sufferings?

original: rang bzhin gyis snying stobs che zhing brtan pa dang ldan stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis snying stobs che zhing brtan pa dang ldan stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: They are naturally courageous and steadfast, and they are strong.

original: 'di ni rgyu dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu dang po'o //
translated: This is the first cause.

original: mkhas pa dang / yang dag par sems pa'i ngang tshul can dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa dang / yang dag par sems pa'i ngang tshul can dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: They are wise, they have a nature that reflects carefully, and they have the power of discernment.

original: 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second cause.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mos pa chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la mos pa chen po dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: They have great interest in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third cause.

original: sems can rnams la yang cher snying rje ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang cher snying rje ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: They have great compassion for sentient beings.

original: 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth cause.

original: stobs bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: stobs bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four powers?

original: nang gi stobs dang / gzhan gyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / sbyor ba'i stobs so //
analyzed: nang gi stobs dang / gzhan gyi stobs dang / rgyu'i stobs dang / sbyor ba'i stobs so //
translated: the inner power, the other power, the power of cause, and the power of application.

original: de la rang gi mthus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub tu sems skye ba'i nang gi stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mthus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub tu sems skye ba'i nang gi stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The inner power of the bodhisattva is the desire for unexcelled, perfect enlightenment that arises from one's own strength.

original: gzhan gyi mthus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i gzhan gyi stobs zhes bya'o //üîΩsngon theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos la goms pas da ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba tsam mam /üîΩde dag gi bsngags pa thos pa tsam gyis kyang myur du sems skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi mthus bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dod pa skyed pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i gzhan gyi stobs zhes bya'o // sngon theg pa chen po dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i chos la goms pas da ltar sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba tsam mam / de dag gi bsngags pa thos pa tsam gyis kyang myur du sems skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: The other power of the bodhisattva is the desire for unexcelled, perfect enlightenment that arises from the strength of others.

original: dam pa'i chos thos pa'am /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos thos pa'am /
translated: The power of cause of the bodhisattva is the quick arising of the thought of enlightenment through the mere sight of a buddha or bodhisattva or through the mere hearing of their praise, due to habituation in the past to wholesome dharmas associated with the Great Vehicle.üîΩThe power of application of the bodhisattva is the quick arising of the thought of enlightenment through the mere hearing of the true Dharma,

original: mthu mthong bas lta ci smos te /
analyzed: mthu mthong bas lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to speak of seeing the power of the bodhisattvas?

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i rgyu'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the power of the cause of the arising of the thought of enlightenment.

original: tshe 'di nyid la skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos yun ring du goms par byas pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / sems pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos yun ring du goms par byas pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems skye ba'i sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of application to the arising of the thought of enlightenment is the long-term cultivation of virtuous qualities such as reliance on holy persons, listening to the holy Dharma, and reflection.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rkyen bzhi dang / rgyu bzhi po dag tshogs @10b pa'am ;
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i rkyen bzhi dang / rgyu bzhi po dag tshogs @10b pa'am ;
translated: The four conditions and the four causes of the thought of enlightenment are either combined or

analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o zhes ston pa /
translated: It should be understood as threefold.

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob pa dang / ji ltar slob pa dang / gang dag slob pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o//
translated: In brief, the bodhisattva conduct is the combination of all the trainings of the bodhisattvas, of how they should train, and of what they should train in.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob ce na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams gang la slob ce na /
translated: What do the bodhisattvas train in?

original: gnas bdun la slob ste /
analyzed: gnas bdun la slob ste /
translated: One trains in seven stations.

original: gnas bdun po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas bdun po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven stations?

original: bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gnas bdun pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: bdag gi don dang / gzhan gyi don dang / de kho na'i don dang / mthu dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gnas bdun pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: One's own aim, the aim of another, the aim of reality, power, the evolutionary development of living beings, the evolutionary development of one's own qualities leading to Buddhahood, and supreme enlightenment.

original: sdom ni / bdag dang gzhan don de nyid don //
analyzed: sdom ni / bdag dang gzhan don de nyid don //
translated: The summary: One's own aim, the aim of another, the aim of reality,

original: mthu dang sems can smin byed dang // rang gi sangs rgyas chos rnams smin //
analyzed: mthu dang sems can smin byed dang // rang gi sangs rgyas chos rnams smin //
translated: Power, the evolutionary development of living beings, the evolutionary development of one's own qualities leading to Buddhahood,

original: byang chub mchog ni bdun pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub mchog ni bdun pa yin //
translated: And supreme enlightenment is the seventh.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is one's own aim, what is the aim of another?

original: mdor bsdu na @12b bdag dang gzhan gyi don ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na @12b bdag dang gzhan gyi don ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, one's own aim and the aim of another should be understood as tenfold.

original: 'ba' zhig dang gzhan dang 'brel pa dang / phan pa'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i rgyu dang / rgyur bsdus pa dang / 'bras bur bsdus pa dang / tshe 'di pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig dang gzhan dang 'brel pa dang / phan pa'i rgyu dang / bde ba'i rgyu dang / rgyur bsdus pa dang / 'bras bur bsdus pa dang / tshe 'di pa dang / tshe rabs gzhan pa dang / gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is exclusively for one's own benefit, it is exclusively for the benefit of others, it is both for one's own benefit and for the benefit of others, it is a cause of benefit, it is a cause of happiness, it is included in the cause, it is included in the result, it is for this life, it is for other lives, it is permanent, and it is impermanent.

original: de la bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las thal zhing 'tsham pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don 'ba' zhig pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las thal zhing 'tsham pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Among these, that which is exclusively for one's own benefit and exclusively for the benefit of others is not the task of a bodhisattva, because it is beyond and inappropriate for a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par byas la spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas yongs su shes par byas la spang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva should understand and abandon it.

original: lhag ma rnams ni bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni bslab par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be cultivated.

original: de la des yongs su shes nas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bdag gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la des yongs su shes nas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bdag gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Among these, the bodhisattva's benefit for oneself that should be understood and abandoned is as follows:

original: bdag nyid bde bar 'dod pa longs spyod pa dang / nye bar spyad pa rnams yongs su tshol ba dang / chos la ser sna byed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas bshad pa rnams yongs su tshol zhing 'dzin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid bde bar 'dod pa longs spyod pa dang / nye bar spyad pa rnams yongs su tshol ba dang / chos la ser sna byed pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpas bshad pa rnams yongs su tshol zhing 'dzin par byed pa dang /
translated: It is to seek out enjoyments and personal comfort, to be miserly with the Dharma, and to seek out and retain the teachings of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: mtho ris 'dod pa mtho ris kyi don du tshul khrims dang / brtson 'grus rtsom zhing /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pa mtho ris kyi don du tshul khrims dang / brtson 'grus rtsom zhing /
translated: It is to observe discipline and to be diligent for the sake of the higher realms,

original: bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi zang zing gi 'bras bu 'dod pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / shes rab yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi zang zing gi 'bras bu 'dod pa /
translated: to practice concentration and insight while seeking the results of worldly material things,

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing 'thob pa'i rgyur de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa dang rnyed pa 'dod pa rnyed pa'i rgyu dang / rnyed pa 'grub pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan sna tshogs don med pa gzhan dag gi spro ba skyed pa dag ston pa dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing 'thob pa'i rgyur de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la mchod pa byed pa dang rnyed pa 'dod pa rnyed pa'i rgyu dang / rnyed pa 'grub pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan sna tshogs don med pa gzhan dag gi spro ba skyed pa dag ston pa dang /
translated: to make offerings to the st≈´pas of the thus-gone ones for the sake of worldly material things, to seek out gain for the sake of gain, and to display various false and pointless qualities in order to please others.

original: bdag la bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod pas bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya ba'i don du chos ma yin pas tshogs sdud par byed kyi /
analyzed: bdag la bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya bar 'dod pas bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir bya ba'i don du chos ma yin pas tshogs sdud par byed kyi /
translated: They gather a following through unrighteous means, wishing to make those who honor them their own.üîΩThey free those who are slaves of others, just for the sake of making them their own slaves.üîΩThey free those who are bound by fetters, just for the sake of their own use.

original: chos kyis ma yin pa dang / gzhan gyi bran du gyur pa'i sems can rnams bdag gi bran du bya ba'i ched ka tsam gyi phyir bran byed pa las thar bar byed pa dang / sems can bcing bas bcings pa rnams bdag gi bya ba sgrub pa'i ched tsam gyi phyir bcings pa las thar bar byas te /
analyzed: chos kyis ma yin pa dang / gzhan gyi bran du gyur pa'i sems can rnams bdag gi bran du bya ba'i ched ka tsam gyi phyir bran byed pa las thar bar byed pa dang / sems can bcing bas bcings pa rnams bdag gi bya ba sgrub pa'i ched tsam gyi phyir bcings pa las thar bar byas te /

analyzed: gzhan gyi chad pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa las thar bar byed pa dang / tshe 'di'i bde ba la gnas shing /
translated: They free others from the fear of punishment, etc.,üîΩjust for the sake of their own fear.üîΩThey give to those who ask,

original: sems can gyi @13a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi @13a * //
translated: just for the sake of their own fame.

original: don la nges par sems pa dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: don la nges par sems pa dang bral ba ni /
translated: The bodhisattva should be known as one who is divorced from the ascertainment of the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bdag gi don 'ba' zhig yin par rig par bya ste /üîΩde ltar 'di lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' yongs su shes par byas nas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bdag gi don 'ba' zhig yin par rig par bya ste / de ltar 'di lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' yongs su shes par byas nas spang bar bya ba gang yin pa /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva should be known as one who is concerned only with his own aim.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bdag gi don 'ba' zhig yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'am /üîΩbyang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bdag gi don 'ba' zhig yin par rig par bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / snying rje sngon du 'gro ba'am / byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'am /
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva should be known as one who is concerned only with his own aim when he is engaged in the actions that are to be thoroughly known and abandoned.

analyzed: mtho ris kyi phyir bsngos pa ni dus thams cad du bdag gi don gzhan dang 'brel pa kho na yin par rig par bya'o /
translated: The bodhisattva's generosity, patience, and compassion, whether they are preceded by the thought of awakening, dedicated to awakening, or dedicated to rebirth in the heavens, should be known as always being related to the aims of others.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de dag la ma gtogs par de ma yin par de las bzlog pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag gi don thams cad ni gzhan gyi don dang 'brel pa yin par rig par bya'o //
