translated: What are the four kinds of correct acceptance of the Dharma?

original: chos yang dag par blang ba da ltar byung ba na bde la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
analyzed: chos yang dag par blang ba da ltar byung ba na bde la phyi ma la rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yang yod /
translated: There is also a correct adoption of virtue that is pleasant when it arises and has a painful karmic maturation.

original: chos yang dag par blang ba da ltar byung @14a * //üîΩpa na sdug bsngal la /üîΩphyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang yod /üîΩda ltar byung ba na yang bde la /
analyzed: chos yang dag par blang ba da ltar byung @14a * // pa na sdug bsngal la / phyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang yod / da ltar byung ba na yang bde la /
translated: There is also a correct adoption of virtue that is painful when it arisesüîΩand has a pleasant karmic maturation.üîΩThere is also a correct adoption of virtue that is pleasant when it arises

original: phyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang yod /üîΩda ltar byung ba na yang sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: phyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa bde ba yang yod / da ltar byung ba na yang sdug bsngal la /
translated: and has a pleasant karmic maturation.üîΩThere is also a correct adoption of virtue that is painful when it arises

original: phyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal pa yang yod de /
analyzed: phyi ma la yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal pa yang yod de /
translated: and has a painful karmic maturation.

original: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni mdo las ji skad 'byung ba kho na bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The classifications of these should be understood just as they are explained in the sutras.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par thob par byed pa dag dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag ni mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don phan pa'i rgyu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa yang dag par thob par byed pa dag dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos de dag ni mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don phan pa'i rgyu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Nirvana, the attainment of nirvana, and the mundane and supramundane factors that contribute to nirvana are, in brief, the causes of benefit and happiness for oneself and others, which are called ‚Äúthe pacification of the bodhisattva.‚Äù

original: thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa bla na med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa bla na med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are unsurpassed and superior to all others.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don bde ba'i rgyu gang zhe na /üîΩmdor bsdu na bde ba rnam pa lngar bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don bde ba'i rgyu gang zhe na / mdor bsdu na bde ba rnam pa lngar bsdu bar rig par bya ste /
translated: What are the causes of happiness for oneself and others that are cultivated by bodhisattvas?üîΩIn brief, they should be understood as being comprised within five forms of happiness.

original: de la bde ba rnam pa lnga po ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la bde ba rnam pa lnga po ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are five forms of happiness:

original: rgyu bde ba dang / tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba dang / tshor ba'i rgyun chad pa'i bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa'i bde ba dang lnga'o //
analyzed: rgyu bde ba dang / tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba dang / tshor ba'i rgyun chad pa'i bde ba dang / gnod pa med pa'i bde ba dang lnga'o //
translated: There are five kinds of causes of pleasure: (1) the cause of pleasure, (2) the feeling of pleasure, (3) the pleasure that is the antidote to suffering, (4) the pleasure that is the cessation of feeling, and (5) the pleasure that is the absence of harm.

original: de la bde ba'i phyogs kyi dbang po dang / yul gnyis dang / rgyu de las byung ba'i bde ba'i tshor bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa gang yin pa dang / tshe 'di'am tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i las gang yin pa ci yang rung /
analyzed: de la bde ba'i phyogs kyi dbang po dang / yul gnyis dang / rgyu de las byung ba'i bde ba'i tshor bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa gang yin pa dang / tshe 'di'am tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i las gang yin pa ci yang rung /
translated: The cause of pleasure is the two, the faculty of pleasure and its object, the contact that causes the feeling of pleasure to arise, and any karma that will produce a desirable result in this life or in another life.

original: de thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rgyu bde ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni rgyu bde ba zhes bya ste /
translated: All of these are included in the cause of pleasure.

original: 'di las gong na yang med /
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med /
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba la mi ltos par rgyu bde bar bsdus pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag nyid las byung ba lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i myong ba ni tshor ba bde ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rab tu zhi ba la mi ltos par rgyu bde bar bsdus pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag nyid las byung ba lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i myong ba ni tshor ba bde ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is the experience that benefits the body and mind and arises from these three causes that are included in the cause of pleasure, without depending on the pacification of suffering.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, contact is of two kinds:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: with-outflows and without-outflows.

original: de la zag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa ni khams gsum pa'i ste /
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa gang yin pa de ni slob pa dang / mi slob pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa ni khams gsum pa'i ste /
translated: That which is without-outflows is of learners and adepts. That which is with-outflows is of the three realms.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩde yang ci rigs par khams gsum pa thams cad kyi skye mched rnam pa drug gi bye brag las mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'o // de yang ci rigs par khams gsum pa thams cad kyi skye mched rnam pa drug gi bye brag las mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba nas /
translated: It is associated with the desire, form, and formless realms.üîΩMoreover, it is of the six sense bases of the three realms, according to the case.

original: yid @14b kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i bar dag go //
analyzed: yid @14b kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i bar dag go //
translated: It is contact arising from the union of eye, etc., up to contact arising from the union of mind.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: These six kinds of contact are of two kinds:

original: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang sems kyi'o //
translated: bodily and mental.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i lus kyi'o //
translated: Bodily contact is that associated with the five collections of consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sems kyi'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni sems kyi'o //
translated: Mental contact is that associated with mental consciousness.

original: grang ba dang tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma dang / sna tshogs pa mang po 'byung ngo cog la /
analyzed: grang ba dang tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma dang / sna tshogs pa mang po 'byung ngo cog la /
translated: There are many kinds of suffering, such as cold, heat, hunger, thirst, and so on.

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gnyen pos zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gnyen pos zhi bar byas te /
translated: When the antidotes to suffering, such as cold, heat, hunger, thirst, and so on, are applied,

original: sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa tsam po de nyid la bde ba'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa tsam po de nyid la bde ba'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: the mere pacification of suffering is what we call the pleasure of the antidote to suffering.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni tshor ba'i rgyun chad pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni tshor ba'i rgyun chad pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The pleasure of the cessation of feeling and discrimination is what we call the pleasure of the cessation of the continuum of feeling.

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The pleasure of non-harm should be understood as being, in brief, of four kinds:

original: mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i bde ba dang ; nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba'i bde ba dang / rab tu dben pa'i bde ba dang ; nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba dang / rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: the pleasure of renunciation, the pleasure of solitude, the pleasure of tranquility, and the pleasure of complete enlightenment.

original: de la dad pas khyim nas khyim med par legs pa kho nar rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: de la dad pas khyim nas khyim med par legs pa kho nar rab tu byung ste /
translated: Having faith in that, he goes forth from home to homelessness.

original: khyim so'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs las ngas par thar pa ni mngon par byung ba'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyim so'i sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs las ngas par thar pa ni mngon par byung ba'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The happiness of going forth is the happiness of being free from the various sufferings of householders.

original: 'dod pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spangs te dben pas bsam gtan dang po la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba ni rab tu dben pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spangs te dben pas bsam gtan dang po la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba ni rab tu dben pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The happiness of seclusion is the joy and bliss born of seclusion that arises from abandoning sense objects and nonvirtuous qualities in the first meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba ni nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa nye bar zhi ba ni nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The happiness of pacification is the pacification of investigation and analysis in the second meditative concentration and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang gtan bral ba dang / shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas bde ba gang yin pa de ni rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang gtan bral ba dang / shes bya'i dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pas bde ba gang yin pa de ni rdzogs par byang chub pa'i bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The happiness of complete enlightenment is the bliss that comes from being completely free from all afflictions and from fully and perfectly awakening to the nature of all objects of knowledge.

original: de la rgyu bde ba ni bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir bde ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la rgyu bde ba ni bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir bde ba yin gyi /
translated: The pleasure of cause is called pleasure because it is the cause of pleasure.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not pleasure by its intrinsic nature.

original: tshor ba'i bde ba ni rgyu'i dngos pos ni ma yin gyi ngo bo nyid kho nas so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bde ba ni rgyu'i dngos pos ni ma yin gyi ngo bo nyid kho nas so //
translated: The pleasure of sensation is not pleasure by the fact of being a cause, but by its intrinsic nature.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba ni rgyu'i dngos pos kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba ni rgyu'i dngos pos kyang ma yin la /
translated: The pleasure that is the remedy of suffering is not pleasure by the fact of being a cause,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: nor by its intrinsic nature.

original: sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa tsam dang / sdug bsngal ba bsal bas bde ba yin no //üîΩtshor ba'i rgyun chad med pa'i bde ba ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi bar gyur pa tsam dang / sdug bsngal ba bsal bas bde ba yin no // tshor ba'i rgyun chad med pa'i bde ba ni /
translated: It is pleasure by the mere appeasement of suffering and by the removal of suffering.

original: rgyu'i dngos pos kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos pos kyang ma yin /
translated: The pleasure of the continuity of sensation is not pleasure by the fact of being a cause,

original: @15a * // ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: @15a * // ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ma yin /
translated: nor by its intrinsic nature,

original: sdug bsngal bsal bas kyang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsal bas kyang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor by the removal of suffering.

original: 'di la tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di la tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni sdug bsngal ba yin la /
translated: Whatever sensation there is, that is suffering.

original: yang dag par sdug bsngal ba /
analyzed: yang dag par sdug bsngal ba /
translated: It is real suffering.

original: dus de tsam zhig gnas pas zhi bar gyur pa ni bde ba ste /
analyzed: dus de tsam zhig gnas pas zhi bar gyur pa ni bde ba ste /
translated: The mere duration of a moment of pleasure is called pleasure,

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde bar gtogs so ;
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde bar gtogs so ;
translated: because it is not harmful.

original: / tha ma rdzogs par byang chub kyi bde ba ni phyi ma la yang yang dag par sdug bsngal ba de ni gtan du zhi bar gyur la tshe 'di la yang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rten la yod pa thams cad gtan med par gyur
analyzed: / tha ma rdzogs par byang chub kyi bde ba ni phyi ma la yang yang dag par sdug bsngal ba de ni gtan du zhi bar gyur la tshe 'di la yang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rten la yod pa thams cad gtan med par gyur
translated: The bliss of perfect enlightenment, which is the final one, is the bliss of the complete pacification of suffering in the future and the complete elimination of all the negative tendencies related to the factors of defilement in this life.

original: pa'i phyir bde ba yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir bde ba yin no //
translated: The ultimate bliss of perfect enlightenment is bliss in this life because the suffering of sentient beings is completely pacified in the future, and because all the negative tendencies of the side of affliction that exist in the life-stream are completely eliminated.

original: gnod pa med pa de'i lhag ma rnams kyang tha ma de dang mthun pa dang / de'i phyogs yin pa dang / de 'dren pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa de'i lhag ma rnams kyang tha ma de dang mthun pa dang / de'i phyogs yin pa dang / de 'dren pa yin pa'i phyir gnod pa med pa'i bde ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining forms of non-violence are to be known as the bliss of non-violence because they are similar to the ultimate, because they are a part of it, and because they lead to it.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni phan pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams la sgrub par byed kyi /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni phan pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba gang yin pa de nyid sems can rnams la sgrub par byed kyi /
translated: The bodhisattva accomplishes for sentient beings that very bliss which is on the side of benefit,

original: gnod pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyogs ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that which is on the side of violence.

original: gnod pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su shes par byas shing /
analyzed: gnod pa'i phyogs kyi bde ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yongs su shes par byas shing /
translated: The bliss which is on the side of violence is to be fully understood by means of correct wisdom, just as it is.

original: yongs su shes par byas la /
analyzed: yongs su shes par byas la /
translated: Having understood this,

original: de la sems can rnams 'dun pa bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sems can rnams 'dun pa bzlog par bya ste /
translated: one should turn away the desire of sentient beings from that.

original: ci nus kyis de las bzlog cing bsal ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: ci nus kyis de las bzlog cing bsal ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should strive to the best of one‚Äôs ability to turn them away from that and to remove them from that.

original: phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal dang 'brel du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa la brten nas sdug bsngal dang bcas pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang bcas par sems can rnams la mi 'dod bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //üîΩmi phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba dang 'brel du zin kyang thabs mkhas pa la brten nas /
analyzed: phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal dang 'brel du zin kyang byang chub sems dpa' thabs mkhas pa la brten nas sdug bsngal dang bcas pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang bcas par sems can rnams la mi 'dod bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o // mi phan par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bde ba dang 'brel du zin kyang thabs mkhas pa la brten nas /
translated: Even if it is connected with suffering, a bodhisattva who is skilled in means, for the sake of sentient beings, will accomplish what is beneficial, even if it is connected with suffering and connected with displeasure, even if it is not desired.

original: bde ba dang bcas pa dang yid bde ba dang bcas par sems can rnams mi dga' bzhin du bzlog par bya zhing drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang bcas pa dang yid bde ba dang bcas par sems can rnams mi dga' bzhin du bzlog par bya zhing drang bar bya'o //
translated: Even if it is connected with pleasure, a bodhisattva who is skilled in means, for the sake of sentient beings, will turn away from and remove what is not beneficial, even if it is connected with pleasure and connected with satisfaction, even if it is not desired.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i bde ba sgrub pa gang yin pa de dang bde ba dang bcas pa'i mi phan pa las bzlog pa de ni sems can rnams la phyis bde ba kho na yin par nges par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bcas pa'i bde ba sgrub pa gang yin pa de dang bde ba dang bcas pa'i mi phan pa las bzlog pa de ni sems can rnams la phyis bde ba kho na yin par nges par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The latter is the happiness of sentient beings in the future, because it is known with certainty that the attainment of happiness accompanied by suffering is the prevention of harm accompanied by happiness.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis na bde ba 'dod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la phan par 'dod pa gang yin pa de ni don gyis na bde ba 'dod pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that whoever desires the benefit of sentient beings also desires their happiness.

original: phan pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba sbyin @15b pa yin par shes par bya ste /üîΩ'di ltar phan pa ni rgyu lta bu yin la /
analyzed: phan pa'i sbyin pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba sbyin @15b pa yin par shes par bya ste / 'di ltar phan pa ni rgyu lta bu yin la /
translated: It should be understood that the gift of benefit is the gift of happiness.

original: bde ba ni 'bras bu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'bras bu lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because benefit is like a cause and happiness is like a result.

original: de lta bas na gang la la sems can rnams la phan pa dang ldan pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang la la sems can rnams la phan pa dang ldan pa de ni bde ba dang ldan pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, whoever possesses benefit for sentient beings should be understood to possess happiness.

original: de la tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i las rgyu bde bar gtogs pa gang yin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba gang yin pa dang / tshor ba'i rgyun chad pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du 'dod pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i las rgyu bde bar gtogs pa gang yin pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po'i bde ba gang yin pa dang / tshor ba'i rgyun chad pa'i bde ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: The causes of happiness that are actions leading to the results of happiness in this life and in other lives, the happiness that is the remedy for suffering, the happiness that is the cessation of feeling,

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de dag ni phan 'dogs pa dang / kha na ma tho pa med pa yin pas de dag byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams la spyad pa'i phyir dgos par nges par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde ba gang yin pa de dag ni phan 'dogs pa dang / kha na ma tho pa med pa yin pas de dag byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams la spyad pa'i phyir dgos par nges par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and the happiness that is harmless are helpful and blameless. Therefore, the bodhisattva should definitely accomplish them for the sake of sentient beings.

original: tshor ba'i bde ba dang / rgyu bde ba dbang po dang / yul dang reg pas bsdus pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa mi phan pa dang mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa da ni bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i bde ba dang / rgyu bde ba dbang po dang / yul dang reg pas bsdus pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa mi phan pa dang mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa da ni bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: The happiness of feeling and the causes of happiness that are included in the faculties, objects, and contact, which are defiled, afflicted, and blameworthy, and which are harmful and unwholesome, should not be accomplished.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa phan pa dang / 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams la ci nus ci lcogs pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa phan pa dang / 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpas sems can rnams la ci nus ci lcogs pa bzhin du bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is beneficial and appropriate for sentient beings, which is not defiled and is not a cause of defilement, and which is irreproachable, that the bodhisattva should practice for sentient beings to the best of his ability and strength.

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang de bzhin du yang dag par spyad par bya'o //üîΩbslab par bya /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang de bzhin du yang dag par spyad par bya'o // bslab par bya /

original: nyams su myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar bya'o //

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyu yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don phan pa dang bde ba'i rgyu yin par rig par bya ste /

original: 'di las gong na yang med 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this, nothing greater than this.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don rgyu dang 'bras bur bsdus pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don rgyu dang 'bras bur bsdus pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva‚Äôs benefit and happiness for oneself and others, included in the cause and the result?

original: mdor bsdu na rgyu yang rnam pa gsum yod la /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rgyu yang rnam pa gsum yod la /

original: 'bras bu yang rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / bsod nams kyi 'bras bu dang / ye shes kyi rgyu dang / ye shes kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bsod nams kyi rgyu dang / bsod nams kyi 'bras bu dang / ye shes kyi rgyu dang / ye shes kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: the cause of evolutionary development, the result of evolutionary development, the cause of merit, the result of merit, the cause of pristine wisdom, and the result of pristine wisdom.

original: de la rnam par smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of evolutionary development?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam par smin pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam par smin pa ni brgyad de /
translated: In brief, the result of evolutionary development is eightfold:

original: tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig btsun pa @16a * //üîΩdang ; dbang che bar grags pa nyid dang / skyes bu nyid dang / brgyad pa stobs phun sum tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang / kha dog phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig btsun pa @16a * // dang ; dbang che bar grags pa nyid dang / skyes bu nyid dang / brgyad pa stobs phun sum tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: long life, a beautiful color, high birth, great power, a beautiful face, eloquence, the ability to be a man, and the ability to be a leader.

analyzed: de la byang chub pa'i tshe phun sum tshogs pa ni tshe ring zhing yun ring du gnas pa nyid do //

original: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni gzugs bzang zhing ba lta na sdug la mdzes pa nyid do //
analyzed: kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni gzugs bzang zhing ba lta na sdug la mdzes pa nyid do //
translated: The perfection of beauty is to have a beautiful, attractive, and pleasing body.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni rigs mthon po rnams su skye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa ni rigs mthon po rnams su skye ba'o //

analyzed: dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa ni longs spyod che ba dang / rtsa 'jing che ba dang / 'khor phal che ba yin no //

analyzed: tshig btsun pa ni yid brtan du rung zhing yid ches pa yin te /

original: sems can rnams kyi rtsod pa byung ngo cog du tshad mar gzhog par 'os la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rtsod pa byung ngo cog du tshad mar gzhog par 'os la /

original: gzhal glugs  la g-yo byed pa dang / 'jal ba la g-yo byed pa la sogs pa dang / g-yo sgyu dang nor gtams pa la g-yo mi byed cing slu bar mi byed de /

analyzed: gzhi des sems can rnams kyis tshig 'dzin par 'gyur ba de ni tshig btsun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One does not deceive or cheat sentient beings. Because of this, sentient beings accept one's words. This is called the perfection of speech.

analyzed: dbang che bar grags pa ni de'i grags pa chen po dang snyan pa 'di lta ste / dpa' ba'am / brtson pa'am /

original: brtan pa'am / mkhas pa'am /üîΩshes nyen che ba'am /
analyzed: brtan pa'am / mkhas pa'am / shes nyen che ba'am /

original: ngang tshul bzang ba'am /
analyzed: ngang tshul bzang ba'am /

analyzed: gzhi des skye bo'i tshogs chen po'i bla mar gyur zhing /
translated: Because of this, he becomes the guru of a great assembly of people andüîΩbecomes an object of respect, honor, reverence, and worship. This is called

analyzed: bkur stir bya ba dang / btsun par bya ba dang / ri mor bya ba dang / mchod par bya ba'i gnas su gyur pa de ni dbang che bar grags pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang zhe na /

translated: The cause of the perfection of the result is the perfection of the result.üîΩThe cause of the perfection of the result is the perfection of the result.üîΩThe cause of the perfection of the result is the perfection of the result.üîΩThe cause of the perfection of the result is the perfection of the result.üîΩThe cause of the perfection of the result is the perfection of the result.üîΩThe cause of the perfection of the result

analyzed: tshe phyi ma la bdag nyid la yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub par smon lam 'debs shing /

analyzed: lus kyis sems can rnams kyi bya ba byung ngo cog la chos dang mthun pa dang / gzu lums med par ci nus ci lcogs pa bzhin du zhal ta byed pa dang / grogs byed pa dang / 'bras chan dang / skyo ma dang / thug pa btung ba dang /
translated: By body, they serve sentient beings in all their activities, in a way that accords with the Dharma and without deceit, to the best of their ability and strength.üîΩThey provide food and drink that is wholesome and nourishing, and they give encouragement to those who are weary.

analyzed: de ltar de dag gi rnam par smin pa rnam pa brgyad kyi rgyu rnam pa brgyad yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these are the eight causes for the eight fruitional results.

original: rgyu de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyis rnam par smin pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / brtas pa dang / rgya che ba mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir rgyas par 'gyur te /

translated: In brief, these causes are increased by three causes, because they cause the perfection, the increase, and the greatness of the fruitions.

original: rgyu gsum po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gsum po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three causes?

original: sems rnam par dag pa dang / sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pa dang / sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / zhing rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the purity of mind, the purity of practice, and the purity of the field.

original: de la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngos pas bsam pa dag par gyur pa gang yin pa dang / snying thag pa nas lhag pa'i bsam pa rgya che zhing dang pas spyod pa'i phyir /üîΩbsam pa drag por gyur pa gang yin pa dang / de dang chos mthun par spyod pa mthong na /

translated: Therein, the purity of mind is the purity of intention due to the dedication of those wholesome roots to supreme enlightenment, and the purity of superior intention due to the vast and sincere intention from the very depths of the heart.

original: mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa dang / nyin gcig bzhin du skad cig re re la de dang mthun @17a * //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa dang / nyin gcig bzhin du skad cig re re la de dang mthun @17a * //
translated: The purity of practice is the joy in seeing those who practice in accordance with that, and the frequent consideration and investigation of only those dharmas that are in accordance with that, moment by moment, every day.

original: pa'i chos kho na la lan mang du rtog cing dpyod pa gang yin pa de ni sems rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i chos kho na la lan mang du rtog cing dpyod pa gang yin pa de ni sems rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the purity of mind.

original: zhing rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ripened result?

original: byang chub sems dpa' tshe phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' tshe phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
translated: When a bodhisattva has attained an excellent life,

translated: This is the result of the perfection of life, that one is engaged for a long time in the side of virtue, beginning with one's own aim and that of others, and that one accumulates many roots of virtue.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kha dog phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
translated: When a bodhisattva is endowed with perfection of complexion,

original: snying du sdug na drung du 'du bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: snying du sdug na drung du 'du bar 'gyur la /

analyzed: gzugs yid du 'ong ba dang / mngon du phrad par gyur pas skye bo'i tshogs chen po dag de'i tshig mnyan pa dang / bya bar sems te /
translated: And because of the beauty of his form and his accessibility, the great multitude thinks of listening to his words and of doing what he says.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i kha dog phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i kha dog phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the result of the perfection of complexion.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
translated: When a bodhisattva is endowed with perfection of family,

analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs chen pos bkur ba dang / mchod pa dang bsngags par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is honored, revered, and praised by a great multitude of people.

original: bkur zhing mchod la bsngags na /
analyzed: bkur zhing mchod la bsngags na /
translated: If he is honored, revered, and praised,

original: sems can rnams don gang dang gang la 'dzud pa de dang de la de dag gzi byin gyis non pas myur du 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams don gang dang gang la 'dzud pa de dang de la de dag gzi byin gyis non pas myur du 'jug par 'gyur te /

original: mi bya'o zhes zlog par mi byed /
analyzed: mi bya'o zhes zlog par mi byed /
translated: He does not say, ‚ÄúDo not do this!‚ÄùüîΩHe does not turn them away or cause them to turn away.

analyzed: log par mi byed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the result of a bodhisattva‚Äôs perfection of spiritual gene.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang phyug phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang phyug phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
translated: When a bodhisattva becomes perfect in power,

original: sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud cing yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: sbyin pas sems can rnams sdud cing yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: he attracts sentient beings through generosity and brings them to maturity.

original: de ni byang chub sems @17b dpa'i dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems @17b dpa'i dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the result of a bodhisattva‚Äôs perfection of power.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig btsun par gyur na snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sems can rnams sdud cing yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig btsun par gyur na snyan par smra ba dang / don spyod pa dang / don mthun pas sems can rnams sdud cing yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: When the bodhisattva becomes one whose word is authoritative, he attracts and develops living beings by means of agreeable speech, helpful activity, and by being one whose purpose is the same as the disciples.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshig bcun pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshig bcun pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the result of the bodhisattva‚Äôs authoritative word.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang che bar grags par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang che bar grags par gyur na /
translated: When the bodhisattva becomes one who is powerful and famous,

original: bya ba byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis sems can gyi grogs byed du 'gro zhing phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gis sems can gyi grogs byed du 'gro zhing phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: he goes to the aid of living beings with various kinds of activity and helps them.

original: phan btags pa des na /
analyzed: phan btags pa des na /
translated: By that help,

original: sems can rnams kyi sems dang 'brel par 'gyur bas de la gus pa dang / byas pa gzo bar gyur nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems dang 'brel par 'gyur bas de la gus pa dang / byas pa gzo bar gyur nas /
translated: the minds of living beings are bound to him, and they become respectful and grateful.

original: bkur sti dang / gus pa dang bcas pas myur ba myur bar bsgo ba bzhin du nyan par byed de /
analyzed: bkur sti dang / gus pa dang bcas pas myur ba myur bar bsgo ba bzhin du nyan par byed de /
translated: With respect and reverence, they quickly do what he tells them.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbang che bar grags pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i dbang che bar grags pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the result of the bodhisattva‚Äôs power and fame.

original: byang chub sems dpa' skyes pa nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skyes pa nyid du gyur na /
translated: When a bodhisattva has become a man,

original: pho'i dbang po dang ldan pas /
analyzed: pho'i dbang po dang ldan pas /
translated: he is endowed with the male faculty.

original: yon tan thams cad dang btsal ba thams cad dang / shes bya thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dag gi snod du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad dang btsal ba thams cad dang / shes bya thams cad rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dag gi snod du gyur pa yin te /
translated: He is a vessel for all good qualities, all searches, and all knowledge.

original: 'jigs pa med par gyur la /
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par gyur la /
translated: He is fearless.

original: dus thams cad du sems can thams cad dang 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: dus thams cad du sems can thams cad dang 'gro ba'am /
translated: At all times he is engaged with all sentient beings, whether in going,

original: smra ba'am / 'grogs pa'am /üîΩlongs spyod pa'am /
analyzed: smra ba'am / 'grogs pa'am / longs spyod pa'am /
translated: speaking, associating,üîΩenjoying,

original: dben pa dben par gnas pa rnams la 'jug pa /
analyzed: dben pa dben par gnas pa rnams la 'jug pa /
translated: or living in solitude.

original: sgrib pa med pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyes pa nyid kyi 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyes pa nyid kyi 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the result of a bodhisattva‚Äôs being a man.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stobs phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stobs phun sum tshogs par gyur na /
translated: When a bodhisattva is endowed with strength,

analyzed: dge ba'i chos sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang sems can la phan gdags pa'i sbyor bas mi skyo bar 'gyur la /
translated: he is not discouraged by the practice of virtuous qualities or by the practice of helping sentient beings.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur zhing /
translated: He is energetic.

original: brtson 'grus brtan pa dang / mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan pa dang / mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes one whose effort is firm and one whose superknowledges are swift.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i stobs phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i stobs phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the bodhisattva‚Äôs result of perfecting the powers.

analyzed: de ltar 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par smin pa rnam pa brgyad kyi 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad yin te /

original: de yod na sems can rnams la yang phan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skye ba la yang mthun cing 'phrod pa yin te /
analyzed: de yod na sems can rnams la yang phan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams skye ba la yang mthun cing 'phrod pa yin te /

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'di la gnas na /üîΩbdag nyid kyang sems @18a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'di la gnas na / bdag nyid kyang sems @18a * //
translated: When the bodhisattva is established in this result of maturation,

analyzed: can rnams kyi don sna tshogs mang po bya ba la nus shing lcogs par 'gyur la /

original: des gdul bar bya ba de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: des gdul bar bya ba de dag kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: And those who are to be converted by him

analyzed: rang gi don bya ba yan chad la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bya ba dag la bsgo ba bzhin du nyan par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will listen to orders to do what he wants, and so on, for his own benefit.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid kyis lcogs su zin kyang gdul byar bya ba des bsgo pa bzhin du mi nyan par gyur na /

analyzed: de lta na yang de'i gzhan gyi don bya ba las don che ba ma yin mthun pa ma yin te /

analyzed: des na des gzhan gyi don byed mi nus so //

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid kyis ni mi nus mi lcogs la /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid kyis ni mi nus mi lcogs la /
translated: Even if the bodhisattva is unable to do it himself,

original: des gdul bar bya ba rnams ni rang gi don bya ba yan chad la bsgo ba bzhin du nyan par gyur na /üîΩde lta na yang byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don bya ba las don che ba ma yin mthun pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des gdul bar bya ba rnams ni rang gi don bya ba yan chad la bsgo ba bzhin du nyan par gyur na / de lta na yang byang chub sems dpa'i gzhan gyi don bya ba las don che ba ma yin mthun pa ma yin te /
translated: if those who are to be disciplined listen to his orders to do what is beneficial for themselves and so on,üîΩthen it is not a great or suitable benefit for others for him to do it himself.

original: des na des gzhan gyi don byed mi nus so //
analyzed: des na des gzhan gyi don byed mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, he is unable to benefit others.

original: de lta bas na de gnyi ga tshogs la gnyi ga 'byor par gyur na /
analyzed: de lta bas na de gnyi ga tshogs la gnyi ga 'byor par gyur na /
translated: Therefore, when both of these are present in a bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don bya ba la las don che zhing mthun par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don bya ba la las don che zhing mthun par 'gyur te /
translated: his work for the welfare of sentient beings becomes great and effective.

original: des na gzhan gyi don byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he becomes able to work for the welfare of others.

original: de ltar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' des bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ; sems can rnams kyang theg pa gsum la myur ba nyid du yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na byang chub sems dpa' des bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang ; sems can rnams kyang theg pa gsum la myur ba nyid du yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: When this is the case, the bodhisattva quickly brings about his own perfection in the qualities of a buddha and the spiritual maturity of sentient beings in the three vehicles.

original: bdag nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: He himself awakens to highest genuine full Awakening,

original: sems can yongs su smin pa rnams kyang rnam par grol par byed do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin pa rnams kyang rnam par grol par byed do //
translated: and he liberates the spiritually mature sentient beings.

original: de bas na rnam grangs des gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad po dag sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i tshe 'bras bu med cing don med pa de yang de dag la 'bras bu yod pa dang don che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rnam grangs des gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa brgyad po dag sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i tshe 'bras bu med cing don med pa de yang de dag la 'bras bu yod pa dang don che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, by this enumeration, because the eight kinds of evolutionary effects of the bodhisattvas are for the benefit and happiness of beings, therefore, even the fruitless and purposeless life of beings in cyclic existence becomes fruitful and meaningful for them.

original: de la bsod nams ni gang yin /
analyzed: de la bsod nams ni gang yin /
translated: What is merit?

original: ye shes ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge?

original: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, merit is the three perfections:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of tolerance.

original: ye shes ni @18b pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pu ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni @18b pha rol tu phyin pa gcig pu ste /
translated: Knowledge is a single perfection:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsod nams kyi phyogs dang / ye shes kyi phyogs su rig par bya ste /üîΩbrtson 'grus la brten nas sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len cing bsrung ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnams bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsod nams kyi phyogs dang / ye shes kyi phyogs su rig par bya ste / brtson 'grus la brten nas sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len cing bsrung ba dang / byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnams bsgom pa'am /
translated: The perfection of effort and the perfection of meditative stabilization should be understood as the side of merit and the side of wisdom.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi phyogs kyi brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi phyogs kyi brtson 'grus so //
translated: The effort that is the side of merit is the effort that, in dependence on effort, gives gifts, takes up and protects ethics, and cultivates the immeasurables such as love.

original: brtson 'grus la brten nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab la sbyor bar byed cing phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la brten nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab la sbyor bar byed cing phung po la mkhas pa dang / khams la mkhas pa dang / skye mched la mkhas pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa dang /
translated: Effort that is the side of wisdom is the effort that, in dependence on effort, applies itself to the wisdom of hearing, contemplation, and meditation and is skilled in the aggregates, skilled in the constituents, skilled in the sources, and skilled in dependent origination.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la ni sdug bsngal bar /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal ba la ni sdug bsngal bar /
translated: It is the discernment of the specific and general characteristics of phenomena, the discernment of the meaning, the discernment of language, and the discernment of full confidence.

original: kun 'byung ba la ni kun 'byung bar ;
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la ni kun 'byung bar ;
translated: The discernment of the specific and general characteristics of phenomena is the discernment of the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres, as well as the characteristics of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: 'gog pa la ni 'gog bar /
analyzed: 'gog pa la ni 'gog bar /
translated: The discernment of the meaning is the discernment of the meaning of the words of the teachings.

original: lam la ni lam du so sor rtog pa'am /üîΩdge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bsten par bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba ma yin pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang /
analyzed: lam la ni lam du so sor rtog pa'am / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / bsten par bya ba dang / bsten par bya ba ma yin pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang /
translated: The discernment of language is the discernment of the languages of the various countries.üîΩThe discernment of full confidence is the discernment of the teachings, their meanings, their certain natures, and the full confidence in one's own eloquence.

original: nag po dang / dkar po'i chos rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rab tu rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed cing /
analyzed: nag po dang / dkar po'i chos rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rab tu rnam par dbye ba dang bcas pa'i chos rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu rnam par 'byed cing /
translated: The discernment of the specific and general characteristics of phenomena is the discernment of the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres, as well as the characteristics of the conditioned and the unconditioned.üîΩThe discernment of the meaning is the discernment of the meaning of the words of the teachings.

original: so sor rtog pa 'di ni ye shes kyi phyogs kyi brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa 'di ni ye shes kyi phyogs kyi brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: The discernment of language is the discernment of the languages of the various countries.üîΩThe discernment of full confidence is the discernment of the teachings, their meanings, their certain natures, and the full confidence in one's own eloquence.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len cing bsrung ba'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len cing bsrung ba'am /
translated: The concentration of merit is the concentration which, based on the trances, gives gifts, or takes up and guards morality.

original: byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnams bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnams bsgom pa'am /
translated: Or it is the cultivation of the immeasurables, such as friendliness, etc.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa de ni bsod nams kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan yin no //
translated: Whatever is similar to that is the concentration of the side of merit.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab la sbyor bar byed cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab la sbyor bar byed cing /
translated: The concentration of knowledge is the concentration which, based on the trances, applies itself to the wisdom of learning, reflection, and mental cultivation.

original: phung po la mkhas pa nas /
analyzed: phung po la mkhas pa nas /
translated: It is the skill in the aggregates,

original: sngar brtson 'grus kyi skabs su ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du thams cad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: sngar brtson 'grus kyi skabs su ji skad bstan pa de bzhin du thams cad brjod par bya ste /
translated: as it was explained in the chapter on vigor.

original: 'di ni ye shes kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes kyi phyogs kyi bsam gtan yin no //
translated: This is the concentration of the side of knowledge.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug yod do //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug yod do //
translated: That merit and knowledge are in brief of six kinds.

original: de re re'i @19a * //üîΩrnam par dbye ba ni /
analyzed: de re re'i @19a * // rnam par dbye ba ni /
translated: Each of them

original: tshad med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad med par rig par bya'o //
translated: is to be known as immeasurable.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of merit and knowledge?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi rgyu ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The causes of merit and knowledge should be understood as being of three kinds in brief:

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes thob pa dang / gnas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba la 'dun pa gang yin pa dang / mthun la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen dang / sngon yang bsod nams dang ye shes la goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes thob pa dang / gnas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba la 'dun pa gang yin pa dang / mthun la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen dang / sngon yang bsod nams dang ye shes la goms pa'o //
translated: the aspiration for the attainment and growth of merit and knowledge, the favorable conditions that are not adverse, and the prior habituation to merit and knowledge.

original: de la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen ni 'di yin te /
translated: The favorable conditions that are not adverse are as follows:

original: phyin ci log gi rkyen ni nye bar mi gnas shing /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi rkyen ni nye bar mi gnas shing /
translated: The conditions that are adverse do not occur

original: nye bar ma gyur la /
analyzed: nye bar ma gyur la /
translated: and are not present.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i rkyen ni nye bar gnas shing /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i rkyen ni nye bar gnas shing /
translated: The conditions that are not adverse occur

original: nye bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩde la sdig pa'i grogs po dang phrad nas bsod nams dang ye shes phyin ci log tu bstan pa'am /üîΩphyin ci log gi yid la byed pas /
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa gang yin pa'o // de la sdig pa'i grogs po dang phrad nas bsod nams dang ye shes phyin ci log tu bstan pa'am / phyin ci log gi yid la byed pas /
translated: and are present.

original: phyin ci log tu bzung ba de ni phyin ci log gi rkyen nye bar gyur pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu bzung ba de ni phyin ci log gi rkyen nye bar gyur pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one encounters evil friends and they teach merit and knowledge in a distorted way, or when one grasps them in a distorted way through mistaken attention, that is called the occurrence of the conditions that are adverse.

original: de las bzlog pa dkar po'i phyogs ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rkyen nye bar gyur pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dkar po'i phyogs ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rkyen nye bar gyur pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the bright side, which should be understood as the condition that is not the opposite of the non-erroneous condition.

original: bsod nams dang / ye shes 'thob pa dang / gnas pa dang 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba la bar du gcod pa gang yin pa de dag spong zhing mi skyed pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o //üîΩrgyu gsum po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang na yang bsod nams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes 'thob pa dang / gnas pa dang 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba la bar du gcod pa gang yin pa de dag spong zhing mi skyed pa 'di yang byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi mi mthun pa med pa'i rkyen zhes bya'o // rgyu gsum po 'di dag las gang yang rung ba cig ma tshang na yang bsod nams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The abandonment and non-production of the obstacles to the attainment, abiding, and increase of merit and knowledge is also called the bodhisattva‚Äôs condition that is not the obstacle to merit and knowledge.

original: ye shes kyang skye bar mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyang skye bar mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that if any one of these three causes is incomplete, then merit will not be produced, and knowledge will not be produced.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of merit and knowledge?

original: bsod nams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa med par 'khor ba na 'khor zhing sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa dang / ci dga' mgur sems can gyi don dang / sems can la phan 'dogs nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' gnod pa med par 'khor ba na 'khor zhing sdug bsngal dag gis shin tu gzir ba med pa dang / ci dga' mgur sems can gyi don dang / sems can la phan 'dogs nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the basis of merit, the bodhisattva transmigrates in cyclic existence without harm, and is not at all oppressed by suffering.

original: ye shes la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsod nams yongs su 'dzin par byed kyi /
analyzed: ye shes la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par bsod nams yongs su 'dzin par byed kyi /
translated: On the basis of wisdom, the bodhisattva acquires merit correctly,

original: log pas ma yin pa dang mkhas par bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log pas ma yin pa dang mkhas par bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs dpag tu med pa dag gis kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: and up to the time of fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, he is skilled in the various immeasurable ways.

original: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na ci @19b rigs par rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu ni mdor bsdu na ci @19b rigs par rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the results of merit and wisdom should be understood as fourfold, as is appropriate.

original: de dag gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni tshad med do //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni tshad med do //
translated: Their varieties are immeasurable.

original: de la rnam par smin pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni bsod nams la brten cing /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni bsod nams la brten cing /
translated: Whatever is the ripening, whatever is the cause of ripening, and whatever is the result of ripening, all of these are based on merit.üîΩ

original: bsod nams las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams las byung ba yin no //
translated: In this regard, all that is the result of karmic maturation, the cause of karmic maturation, and the result of karmic maturation are based on merit and arise from merit.

original: bsod nams kyang ye shes la brten cing ye shes las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyang ye shes la brten cing ye shes las byung ba yin no //

original: de bas na 'di gnyi ga yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di gnyi ga yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba'i gtso bo yin te /

original: bsod nams ni gtso bo yin la ye shes ni bla na med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams ni gtso bo yin la ye shes ni bla na med pa yin no //

original: bsod nams dang ye shes las gang yang rung ba cig med na byang chub sems dpa' de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes las gang yang rung ba cig med na byang chub sems dpa' de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mi 'thob ste /

original: de ltar na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don rgyu dang 'bras bur bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don rgyu dang 'bras bur bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the benefit of self and other of the bodhisattva should be understood as consisting of cause and effect.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshe 'di'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don ni gang yin /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i tshe 'di'i bdag dang gzhan gyi don ni gang yin /

analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don ni gang yin zhe na /

original: skyes bu'i byed pa rig pa'i bzo'i gnas dang / las kyi gnas kyis longs spyod bsgrub pa gang yin pa dang / bsgrubs pa de dag kyang tshod zin par longs spyod pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu tshe 'di la longs spyod par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang /

translated: The acquisition of resources through the knowledge of the arts and crafts and through the means of livelihood, and the enjoyment of those resources in moderation, and the enjoyment in this life of the results of evolution of former actions that are the results of evolution of former actions that are the results of desirable actions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan sgyur ba la mkhas pas tshe 'di nyid la bde ba'i don du bya ba dang / de la brten nas tshe 'di nyid la gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan sgyur ba la mkhas pas tshe 'di nyid la bde ba'i don du bya ba dang / de la brten nas tshe 'di nyid la gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir /

analyzed: bsam gtan la brten pa dang / tshe 'di nyid la de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa dang / tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i chos 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas 'jig rten pa dang /

analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshe 'di nyid la bdag gi don du 'gyur ba zhes bya ste /

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: And just as it is for the bodhisattva,

analyzed: sems can gzhan gang dag byang chub sems dpas btul ba rnams kyi gzhan gyi don yang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that it is also the aim of others, namely, those other sentient beings who are disciplined by the bodhisattva.

original: de la phyi ma la 'dod @20a * //
analyzed: de la phyi ma la 'dod @20a * //
translated: In this regard, the aim in future lives

translated: The bodhisattva‚Äôs own perfect enjoyment of the elements in the next life, the perfection of body in the next life, rebirth in the absorptions and the formless realms in the next life, and in this life, the cause of the perfection of body and enjoyment in the next life, rebirth in the absorptions and the formless realms in the next life, and the perfection of body and enjoyment in this life, and the cause of that, should be understood as the bodhisattva‚Äôs benefit of self and others in other lives.

original: so sor brtags shing phyi ma la longs spyod dang / lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med par skye ba de'i rgyu la brten pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshe rabs gzhan gyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags shing phyi ma la longs spyod dang / lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med par skye ba de'i rgyu la brten pa gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshe rabs gzhan gyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don kho na yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In this life, the bodhisattva‚Äôs own perfect enjoyment of the elements, the perfection of body in this life, rebirth in the absorptions and the formless realms in this life, and the cause of that, should be understood as the bodhisattva‚Äôs benefit of self and others in this life.

original: tshe 'di la bde ba dang bcas pa dang / yid bde ba dang bcas pas longs spyod dang / lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la brten pa gang yin pa dang / tshe 'dir nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde ba dang bcas pa dang / yid bde ba dang bcas pas longs spyod dang / lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu la brten pa gang yin pa dang / tshe 'dir nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha dang mthun pa ma yin pa'i bsam gtan dang /
translated: The cause of the perfection of wealth and body in this life, together with happiness and mental pleasure, and the cause of the perfection of wealth and body in other lives, together with happiness and mental pleasure, is the concentration and formless absorptions that are conducive to the happiness of this life and conducive to the happiness of other lives.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di nyid dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di nyid dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The concentration and formless absorptions that are conducive to the happiness of this life and conducive to the happiness of other lives should be understood as the benefit for oneself and others in this life and in other lives.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gtan du ba ni gang /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gtan du ba ni gang /

original: gtan du ba ma yin pa de ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: gtan du ba ma yin pa de ni gang zhe na /

original: 'dod pa'i khams su longs spyod dang / lus phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi 'jig rten pa'i dag pa rgyu dang 'bras bur bcas pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gtan du ba ma yin no //

translated: The perfection of wealth and body in the desire realm, together with its cause and result, and the mundane purity of ordinary beings, together with its cause and result, are not the permanent benefit for oneself and others.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / de la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams thob pa gang yin pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gtan du ba yin no //üîΩde la ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / 'bras bu longs spyod pas yongs su zad pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad gtan spangs pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / de la brten nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams thob pa gang yin pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gtan du ba yin no // de la ngo bo nyid dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / 'bras bu longs spyod pas yongs su zad pa /
translated: The abandonment of all the defilements, the eightfold noble path, and the acquisition of the supramundane good qualities on the basis of that path, are the eternal benefit for oneself and others.

original: rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis na gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis na gtan du ba dang / gtan du ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The eternal and the non-eternal should be understood by three causes: by nature, by regression, and by the exhaustion of the enjoyment of the fruit.

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis gtan du ba yin no //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis gtan du ba yin no //

original: 'dus byas ni thams cad kyang gtan du ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni thams cad kyang gtan du ba ma yin no //

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni yongs su nyams pa ma yin pa dang / 'bras bu longs spyod pas yongs su zad par @20b mi 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan du ba yin no //

translated: The eightfold noble path is eternal because it does not regress and because it does not exhaust the enjoyment of the fruit.

original: de las gzhan pa dge ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams ni yongs su nyams pa dang / 'bras bu longs spyad nas yongs su zad par 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan du ba ma yin te /

translated: Other than that, virtuous contaminated phenomena are not permanent because they are completely lost and completely exhausted after the enjoyment of their result.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ci nus ci lcogs kyis gang la bslab par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ci nus ci lcogs kyis gang la bslab par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, these ten aspects of the bodhisattvas' summary of their own and others' aims are what bodhisattvas should train in according to their ability and their strength.

original: 'di las gong na yang med /
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med /

translated: Whatever training there has been in the past and whatever there will be in the future in one's own and others' aims, all of it is training in just these ten aspects of one's own and others' aims.üîΩThere is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing superior to this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u ste gsum pa'o /

analyzed: // / de kho na'i don gang zhe na /
