translated: The thing that was the previous entity and this non-entity, both of which are free from existence and non-existence, are subsumed within the characteristic of the dharmas, which is non-duality.

original: gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de ni dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis spangs pa /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa gang yin pa de ni dbu ma'i lam mtha' gnyis spangs pa /
translated: That which is non-dual is the middle path, which is free from the two extremes.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the unsurpassed.

original: de kho na de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes ni shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na de la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes ni shin tu rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, should be known as being completely pure in regard to that suchness.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa ni slob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba yin par rig par byas te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes pa ni slob pa'i lam gyis rab tu phye ba yin par rig par byas te /
translated: In this regard, the knowledge of the bodhisattvas should be known as being distinguished by the path of learning.

original: shes rab de yang byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs chen po @22b yin no //
analyzed: shes rab de yang byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs chen po @22b yin no //
translated: And that wisdom is the great means for the bodhisattvas to attain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid la mos pa des na /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni stong pa nyid la mos pa des na /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, by his faith in emptiness,

original: skye ba de dang de dag tu sbyor ba na sems can dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba na 'khor te /
analyzed: skye ba de dang de dag tu sbyor ba na sems can dang / rang gi sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba na 'khor te /
translated: in those births and in those practices, turns in cyclic existence in order to bring sentient beings and his own qualities of a buddha to maturity.

original: 'khor ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la ;
analyzed: 'khor ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la ;
translated: And he knows that cyclic existence as it really is.

original: 'khor ba de las kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yid skyo bar mi byed do //
analyzed: 'khor ba de las kyang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis yid skyo bar mi byed do //
translated: And he does not become weary of cyclic existence through the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: gal te 'khor ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs sum shes na ni //
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs sum shes na ni //
translated: If he did not know cyclic existence as it really is,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad la sems lhag par btang snyoms su 'jog par mi nus so //
translated: he would not be able to set his mind in a state of equanimity toward all the afflictions, such as passion, hatred, and delusion.

original: lhag par btang snyoms su ma byas na ni /üîΩsems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur la /
analyzed: lhag par btang snyoms su ma byas na ni / sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur la /
translated: If he did not set his mind in a state of equanimity,üîΩhis mind would become afflicted.

original: 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And he would turn in cyclic existence.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'khor ba ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'khor ba ni /
translated: The mind that is afflictedüîΩ

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par mi nus so //
translated: A mind that is afflicted does not have the ability to purify the Buddha qualities and to bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'khor ba las sems skyo bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis 'khor ba las sems skyo bar gyur na /
translated: If the mind becomes weary of cyclic existence through the aspects of impermanence, etc.,

original: de lta na ni byang chub sems dpa' myur ba myur bar yongs su mya nan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni byang chub sems dpa' myur ba myur bar yongs su mya nan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the bodhisattva would quickly pass into Nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' myur ba myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'das na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' myur ba myur bar yongs su mya ngan las 'das na /
translated: If the bodhisattva quickly passes into Nirvana,

original: de lta na yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed mi nus na /
analyzed: de lta na yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed mi nus na /
translated: then he would not have the ability to purify the Buddha qualities and to bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gur /üîΩ// / bam po gsum pa //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar lta ga la 'gur / // / bam po gsum pa //
translated: How much less would he be able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, true, and complete enlightenment!

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid du mos pa des sbyor ba na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid du mos pa des sbyor ba na /
translated: The bodhisattva who is devoted to emptiness, when he is engaged in the perfections,

original: mya ngan las 'das pas skrag par yang mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pas skrag par yang mi 'gyur la //
translated: He is not afraid of nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyen bar yang mi byed do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyen bar yang mi byed do //
translated: and he does not strive for nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pas skrag par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pas skrag par gyur na ni /
translated: If a bodhisattva were afraid of nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: 'di ltar yid skrag pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon ma mthong ba dang / de la yod pa'i yon tan mthong ba'i dad pa dang / mos pa spangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gong du mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yid skrag pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon ma mthong ba dang / de la yod pa'i yon tan mthong ba'i dad pa dang / mos pa spangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gong du mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because of that fear, he would not see the benefits of nirvƒÅ·πáa, and he would abandon the faith and the aspiration that see the virtues in it. And that bodhisattva would not complete the accumulations for nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba las @23a * //üîΩshas cher gnas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba las @23a * // shas cher gnas par gyur na ni /
translated: If a bodhisattva were to strive for nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: myur ba nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur ba nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he would quickly attain nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'das na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'das na sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were to quickly attain nirvana, he would not bring about the maturation of the qualities of a buddha and of sentient beings.

original: de la 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su ma shes te /
analyzed: de la 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su ma shes te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva who does not understand samsara as it truly isüîΩand who wanders in samsara with an afflicted mind,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor ba gang yin pa dang / 'khor ba la yid skyo ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor ba gang yin pa dang / 'khor ba la yid skyo ste /
translated: who becomes weary of samsaraüîΩand who quickly attains nirvana,

original: myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas yid skrag ste /
analyzed: myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas yid skrag ste /
translated: who becomes frightened by nirvanaüîΩand who does not complete the accumulations,

original: de'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba la shas cher gnas te /
analyzed: de'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa don du gnyer ba la shas cher gnas te /
translated: and who, while striving for nirvana, remains mostly in that state

original: myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba la thabs mi mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba la thabs mi mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and quickly attains nirvana, should be known as a bodhisattva who is not skilled in attaining unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes te /
analyzed: 'khor ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes te /
translated: It is the knowledge of samsara as it is in reality.üîΩIt is the revolving in samsara with a mind that is not defiled.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor ba gang yin pa dang / 'khor ba la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis yid mi skyo ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis 'khor ba na 'khor ba gang yin pa dang / 'khor ba la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang gis yid mi skyo ste /
translated: It is the non-discouragement of mind by the aspects of impermanence, etc. in samsara.üîΩIt is the non-swift passing into Nirvana.

original: myur du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba gang yi pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas yid mi skrag ste /
analyzed: myur du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba gang yi pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pas yid mi skrag ste /
translated: It is the non-fear of Nirvana.üîΩIt is the completion of the accumulations.

original: de'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon mthong ste /
analyzed: de'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang / phan yon mthong ste /
translated: It is the vision of the virtues and benefits of Nirvana.üîΩIt is the non-excessive delight in Nirvana.

original: ha cang spro bar gyur cing myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs chen po yin no //
analyzed: ha cang spro bar gyur cing myur du mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par bya ba'i thabs chen po yin no //
translated: It is the great means for the attainment of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of the Bodhisattvas.

original: thabs de yang stong pa nyid kyi mchog la mos pa 'di la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: thabs de yang stong pa nyid kyi mchog la mos pa 'di la brten pa yin te /
translated: And that means is based on this conviction in the supremacy of emptiness.

original: de bas na stong pa nyid kyi mchog la mos par sgom pa /
analyzed: de bas na stong pa nyid kyi mchog la mos par sgom pa /
translated: Therefore, the cultivation of the supreme emptiness is the cultivation of the supreme of all aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i slob pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The path of the bodhisattva is included in the path of learning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i thabs chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i thabs chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the great means for attaining the gnosis of the tathagatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes ring du zhugs pa des chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rtogs pas dngos po tsam mam /üîΩde bzhin nyid tsam du 'dzin pa ma gtogs par chos gang yang @23b rung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ni chos bdag med pa'i ye shes ring du zhugs pa des chos thams cad kyi brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rtogs pas dngos po tsam mam / de bzhin nyid tsam du 'dzin pa ma gtogs par chos gang yang @23b rung ste /
translated: The bodhisattva, by means of that gnosis of the selflessness of dharmas that has gone far, realizes the inexpressible nature of all dharmas just as it is.

original: ji lta bur yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do //üîΩ'on kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni dngos po tsam mo //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang rnam par rtog par mi byed do // 'on kyang 'di snyam du 'di ni dngos po tsam mo //
translated: Except for apprehending mere things or mere thusness, he does not conceive of any dharma whatsoever in any way.

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid tsam mo snyam du yang de mi sems la /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid tsam mo snyam du yang de mi sems la /
translated: However, he does not think, ‚ÄúThis is mere things‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis is mere thusness.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' de don ni spyod par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de don ni spyod par byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva practices the meaning.

original: don gyi dam pa la spyod na /
analyzed: don gyi dam pa la spyod na /
translated: When he practices the ultimate meaning,

original: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid de dang mtshungs par mnyam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyis mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad de bzhin nyid de dang mtshungs par mnyam par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes rab kyis mthong ste /
translated: He sees with wisdom that all phenomena are the same in being the same as suchness.

original: thams cad la mnyam par lta zhing sems snyoms pas btang snyoms kyi mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad la mnyam par lta zhing sems snyoms pas btang snyoms kyi mchog thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He sees all things as equal and attains the highest equanimity.

original: de la brten na byang chub sems dpa' rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par bya ba la sbyor ba na /
analyzed: de la brten na byang chub sems dpa' rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas par bya ba la sbyor ba na /
translated: When he applies himself to becoming skilled in all the sciences,

original: yongs su ngal ba thams cad dang / sdug bsngal gyis thebs pa thams cad kyi sgyid lug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yongs su ngal ba thams cad dang / sdug bsngal gyis thebs pa thams cad kyi sgyid lug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: he does not become discouraged by any fatigue or any suffering.

original: lus ngal ba med pa dang sems ngal ba med pas de la mkhas pa myur du yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: lus ngal ba med pa dang sems ngal ba med pas de la mkhas pa myur du yang dag par sgrub par byed de /
translated: With a body that is not fatigued and a mind that is not fatigued, he quickly and correctly accomplishes that skill.

original: dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa chen po yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pa'i stobs bskyed pa chen po yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: He also attains a great increase in the power of memory.

original: mkhas par gyur pa des kyang khengs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mkhas par gyur pa des kyang khengs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: He does not become arrogant because of that skill.

original: gzhan dag la yang slob dpon gyi dpe  mkhyud mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang slob dpon gyi dpe  mkhyud mi byed do //
translated: He does not withhold the teacher‚Äôs instructions from others.

original: mkhas par bya ba thams cad la yang sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mkhas par bya ba thams cad la yang sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: He does not become discouraged in any of the activities of the wise.

original: spro ba dang ldan te /
analyzed: spro ba dang ldan te /
translated: He is full of joy.

original: 'jug pa yang thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is unimpeded in his activities.

original: go cha'i sbyor ba yang brtan par 'gyur te /üîΩji lta ji ltar 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe /
analyzed: go cha'i sbyor ba yang brtan par 'gyur te / ji lta ji ltar 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe /
translated: He is firm in his armor.üîΩThe more he experiences the variety of suffering while transmigrating in cyclic existence,

original: sdug bsngal ba'i khyad par rnyed pa de lta de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub spro ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i khyad par rnyed pa de lta de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub spro ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the more he generates enthusiasm for unsurpassed, complete, and true enlightenment.

original: ji lta ji ltar lus kyi khyad par thob par gyur pa de lta de ltar sems can rnams la shin tu nga rgyal med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar lus kyi khyad par thob par gyur pa de lta de ltar sems can rnams la shin tu nga rgyal med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The more he attains a special body, the more he becomes free of pride toward sentient beings.

original: ji lta ji ltar shes pa'i khyad par thob pa de lta de ltar gzhan la klan ka tshor ba dang / rtsod pa dang / smra ba mang ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / tshul 'khrul pa kun tu spyod pa rnams yongs su shes par byas shing yongs su shes par byas nas /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar shes pa'i khyad par thob pa de lta de ltar gzhan la klan ka tshor ba dang / rtsod pa dang / smra ba mang ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / tshul 'khrul pa kun tu spyod pa rnams yongs su shes par byas shing yongs su shes par byas nas /
translated: The more one attains the excellence of knowledge, the more one is aware of the faults of others, the more one engages in debate and argument, the more one is afflicted by the root and secondary afflictions, and the more one engages in conduct that is contrary to discipline.

original: shas cher sems kyis lhag par btang snyoms su byed de /
analyzed: shas cher sems kyis lhag par btang snyoms su byed de /
translated: However, having understood this, one should mostly cultivate equanimity with regard to these things.

original: ji lta ji ltar yon tan dag gis skye ba de lta de ltar dge ba mi spyoms par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar yon tan dag gis skye ba de lta de ltar dge ba mi spyoms par 'gyur zhing /
translated: The more one attains excellence in virtue, the less one will boast about it.

original: gzhan las shes kyi khe dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti mi tshol te /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' ye shes de la brten pa la ni de lta bu 'di dag dang mthun pa'i phan yon mang po byang chub kyi @24a * //
analyzed: gzhan las shes kyi khe dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti mi tshol te / byang chub sems dpa' ye shes de la brten pa la ni de lta bu 'di dag dang mthun pa'i phan yon mang po byang chub kyi @24a * //
translated: One will not seek gain, honor, or praise from others.

original: phyogs dang / byang chub dang mthun pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang / byang chub dang mthun pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For the bodhisattva who relies on this wisdom, many benefits such as these arise, which are conducive to the factors of awakening and to awakening.

original: de bas na gang la la dag byang chub thob par gyur pa dang / gang la la dag thob par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag thob pa de dag thams cad ni ye shes de nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: de bas na gang la la dag byang chub thob par gyur pa dang / gang la la dag thob par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag thob pa de dag thams cad ni ye shes de nyid la brten nas /
translated: Therefore, all those who have attained Awakening, all those who will attain it, and all those who are attaining it, do so in dependence on that very knowledge,

original: dma' ba dang / khyad par can gzhan las ma yin no //
analyzed: dma' ba dang / khyad par can gzhan las ma yin no //
translated: and not on any other, whether inferior or superior.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spros pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar spros pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs shing /
translated: The bodhisattva who has thus entered the way of non-conceptuality

original: de ltar pan yon mang po dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar pan yon mang po dang ldan pa ni /
translated: and who possesses these many benefits

original: bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gzhan dag kyang theg pa gsum gyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gzhan dag kyang theg pa gsum gyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: has set out in order to ripen the qualities of a Buddha in himself, and in order to ripen the qualities of the Dharma of the three vehicles in others.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: He has set out in this way:

original: longs spyod rnams dang / lus la yang sred pa med la /
analyzed: longs spyod rnams dang / lus la yang sred pa med la /
translated: He has no craving for possessions or for his own body,

original: sems can rnams la longs spyod dang / lus yongs su gtong ba'i phyir yang sred pa med par slob bo //
analyzed: sems can rnams la longs spyod dang / lus yongs su gtong ba'i phyir yang sred pa med par slob bo //
translated: but he trains in being free from craving in order to give away to sentient beings both possessions and his own body.

original: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir lus dang ngag bsdams shing ;
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don gyi phyir lus dang ngag bsdams shing ;
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, they restrain their bodies and speech.

original: shin tu bsdams pa yang yin la /
analyzed: shin tu bsdams pa yang yin la /
translated: They are also well restrained,

original: rang bzhin gyis sdig pa la mi dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis bzang zhing dge ba'i phyir sdom pa la yang slob pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdig pa la mi dga' ba dang / rang bzhin gyis bzang zhing dge ba'i phyir sdom pa la yang slob pa'o //
translated: and they train in restraint because they naturally dislike evil and naturally delight in good.

original: gzhan la gnod pa dang / log par sgrub pa byung ba thams cad la yang bzod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa dang / log par sgrub pa byung ba thams cad la yang bzod pa yin la /
translated: They are patient with all the harms and offenses of others.

original: khro ba chung bar bya ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi bya ba'i phyir bzod pa la yang slob bo //
analyzed: khro ba chung bar bya ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa mi bya ba'i phyir bzod pa la yang slob bo //
translated: They train in patience in order to have little anger and to not harm others.

original: sems can rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba dang / phan gdags pa sgrub pa dang / bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nyid rgyu yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rig pa'i gnas thams cad la yang brtson pa'am mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba dang / phan gdags pa sgrub pa dang / bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid nyid rgyu yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rig pa'i gnas thams cad la yang brtson pa'am mkhas pa yin no //
translated: They are diligent or skilled in all the sciences in order to dispel the doubts of sentient beings, to accomplish the aims they seek, and to take up the causes of omniscience themselves.

original: sems nang na gnas shing sems shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sems nang na gnas shing sems shin tu mnyam par gzhag pa yang yin la /
translated: They keep their minds within and are very well concentrated.

original: sems gnas par bya ba dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi yongs su dag par bya ba dang / mngon par shes pa lngas rnam par rtse bas sems can gyi bya bsgrub pa dang / mkhas par bya ba thams cad la mngon par brtson pa las byung ba'i ngal ba bsal ba'i phyir yang slob bo //
analyzed: sems gnas par bya ba dang / tshangs pa'i gnas pa bzhi yongs su dag par bya ba dang / mngon par shes pa lngas rnam par rtse bas sems can gyi bya bsgrub pa dang / mkhas par bya ba thams cad la mngon par brtson pa las byung ba'i ngal ba bsal ba'i phyir yang slob bo //
translated: He also trains in order to clear away the fatigue that comes from being dedicated to all the activities of the wise, such as making the mind rest, purifying the four noble abodes, and accomplishing the welfare of beings through the five superknowledges.

original: mdzangs shing de kho na mchog shes pa yang yin la /üîΩphyi ma la bdag nyid theg pa chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdzangs shing de kho na mchog shes pa yang yin la / phyi ma la bdag nyid theg pa chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He is wise and knows the highest reality.

original: de kho na mchog shes pa la yang slob bo //
analyzed: de kho na mchog shes pa la yang slob bo //
translated: He also trains in knowing the highest reality in order to attain nirvana by means of the Great Vehicle in the future.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag pa'i sbyor ba byed @24b byed pa de ni sems can yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni mchod pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byed par nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar yang dag pa'i sbyor ba byed @24b byed pa de ni sems can yon tan dang ldan pa rnams la ni mchod pa dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti byed par nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices in this way is always ready to honor, respect, and serve those beings who have good qualities.

original: sems can skyon can rnams la ni /
analyzed: sems can skyon can rnams la ni /
translated: He is also ready to serve those beings who have faults.

original: mchog tu snying rje'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems kyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu snying rje'i sems dang / snying brtse ba'i sems kyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is filled with the highest compassion and a mind of loving kindness.

original: ci nus ci lcogs su de dag gi skyon bstsal ba'i phyir yang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: ci nus ci lcogs su de dag gi skyon bstsal ba'i phyir yang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: He is also engaged in removing their faults to the best of his ability.

original: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la ni byams pa'i sems kyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la ni byams pa'i sems kyis nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is filled with a mind of loving kindness toward sentient beings who do harm.

original: gnod pa byed pa de dag gi rang gi bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i nyes pas 'khon gyi sems su gyur pa spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa de dag gi rang gi bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i nyes pas 'khon gyi sems su gyur pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: He is free of any hostile thoughts toward those who do harm, due to their own intentions and actions.

original: g-yo dang sgyu med par ci nus ci lcogs su phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar sgrub po //üîΩsems can pha 'dogs pa rnams la ni byas pa gzo bas lan du phan gdags pa de dang mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu med par ci nus ci lcogs su phan pa dang / bde ba nye bar sgrub po // sems can pha 'dogs pa rnams la ni byas pa gzo bas lan du phan gdags pa de dang mnyam pa'am /
translated: He is free of deceit and pretense, and he accomplishes their benefit and happiness to the best of his ability.üîΩHe is filled with gratitude toward sentient beings who help him.

original: lhag par nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag par nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: He is engaged in repaying their kindness to the best of his ability.

original: de dag gi chos dang mthun pa'i bsam pa yang ci nus ci lcogs su yongs su rdzogs par byed do ;
analyzed: de dag gi chos dang mthun pa'i bsam pa yang ci nus ci lcogs su yongs su rdzogs par byed do ;
translated: He also fulfills their intentions that are in accord with the Dharma to the best of his ability.

original: ; mthu med na yang ma bcol bar don du bya ba de dang de dag la gus par rtsol ba ston par byed de /
analyzed: ; mthu med na yang ma bcol bar don du bya ba de dang de dag la gus par rtsol ba ston par byed de /
translated: Even if they are not able to do so, they show respect for those activities and strive to do them.

original: lan 'ga' byas pa tsam gyis mi gtong zhing ci nas bdag gis ma nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lan 'ga' byas pa tsam gyis mi gtong zhing ci nas bdag gis ma nus pa yin gyi /
translated: They do not give up just because they have done something once.üîΩThey make it clear that they are not unwilling to do it, but are simply unable to.

original: byed mi 'dod pa ni ma yin no snyam du des shes par byed de de lta bu dang mthun pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' spros pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs shing de kho na mchog shes pa la brten pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yinüîΩpar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byed mi 'dod pa ni ma yin no snyam du des shes par byed de de lta bu dang mthun pa de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' spros pa med pa'i tshul la zhugs shing de kho na mchog shes pa la brten pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Such are the correct applications of the bodhisattvas who have entered the way of the absence of conceptual proliferation and who rely on the knowledge of the supreme reality.

original: de la rigs pa gang gis chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la rigs pa gang gis chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: By what reasoning should one understand that all phenomena are inexpressible?

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The designation of the intrinsic identity of phenomena is as follows:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba'am /üîΩtshor ba zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba'am / tshor ba zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúform,‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúfeeling,‚Äù

original: 'du shes zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'du shes zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúconception,‚Äù

original: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: ‚Äúconditioning,‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness‚Äù up to

original: snga ma bzhin du tha na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa de ni btags pa tsam du zad par rig par bya ste ;
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du tha na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa de ni btags pa tsam du zad par rig par bya ste ;
translated: ‚Äúnirvana‚Äù are mere designations.

original: ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: They are not real entities,

original: de las ma gtogs pa dang de las gud na yang dag gi spyod yul dang ngag gi yul med do //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa dang de las gud na yang dag gi spyod yul dang ngag gi yul med do //
translated: and apart from them, there is no object of the path of purification, no object of speech.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar brjod pa de bzhin du yod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar brjod pa de bzhin du yod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the reality of all phenomena is not as it is described.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin no //üîΩde de ltar yod pa @25a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin no // de de ltar yod pa @25a * //
translated: But it is not that they do not exist at all.

original: yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not that they exist in that way.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa yang ma yin na /
translated: It is not that they do not exist at all.

original: ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: How do they exist?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags pa'i legs par ma zin pa spangs pa dang / yang dag pa la skur ba btab pa'i legs par ma zin pa spangs pa yod do ;
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags pa'i legs par ma zin pa spangs pa dang / yang dag pa la skur ba btab pa'i legs par ma zin pa spangs pa yod do ;
translated: They exist without the reification of what does not exist by intrinsic nature and without the deprecation of what does exist.

original: / chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kho na'i spyod yul ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kho na'i spyod yul ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The ultimate reality of all phenomena should be understood as not being the domain of non-conceptual wisdom alone.

original: gal te chos gang dag dang / dngos po gang la ji ltar brjod pa 'jug pa bzhin du chos de dag dang dngos po de de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos gang dag dang / dngos po gang la ji ltar brjod pa 'jug pa bzhin du chos de dag dang dngos po de de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: If the things and entities that are engaged by the expressions were the nature of those things and entities,

original: de ltar na chos gcig pu dang / dngos po gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa sna tshogs mang por 'gyur bar rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar na chos gcig pu dang / dngos po gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid rnam pa sna tshogs mang por 'gyur bar rigs so //
translated: then it would be reasonable for the nature of a single thing and a single entity to be various and multiple.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar chos gcig pu dang / dngos po gcig pu la mang po dag gis rnam pa sna tshogs mang por brjod cing 'dogs te nye bar 'dogs par byed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gcig pu dang / dngos po gcig pu la mang po dag gis rnam pa sna tshogs mang por brjod cing 'dogs te nye bar 'dogs par byed la /
translated: Because many people express, designate, and impute a single thing and a single entity in various ways.

original: 'dogs pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag pas 'dogs pa'i tshig gang yang rung ba gcig cig chos de dang dngos po de la de'i bdag nyid dang de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i tshig rnam pa sna tshogs mang po dag pas 'dogs pa'i tshig gang yang rung ba gcig cig chos de dang dngos po de la de'i bdag nyid dang de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Since there are many different terms, any one term is the identity of that phenomenon and the nature of its entity.

original: 'dogs pa'i tshig lhag ma gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i tshig lhag ma gzhan dag ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i nges pa ci yang mi dmigs te /
translated: But there is no certainty that the remaining terms are not.

original: de bas na 'dogs pa'i tshig thams cad ni mtha' dag gam /
analyzed: de bas na 'dogs pa'i tshig thams cad ni mtha' dag gam /
translated: Therefore, all terms in their entirety or

original: kha cig kyang rung ste /üîΩchos thams cad dang dngos po thams cad kyi de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa yang med la /
analyzed: kha cig kyang rung ste / chos thams cad dang dngos po thams cad kyi de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur pa yang med la /
translated: some of them

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba yang med do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba yang med do //
translated: are neither the identity of all phenomena and all things nor their nature.

original: gzhan yang gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos sngar ji skad bstan pa rnams 'dogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i chos sngar ji skad bstan pa rnams 'dogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid yin du zin na /
translated: Moreover, if form and so on are the entity of terms as previously explained,

original: de lta na je dngos po sngar byung la /
analyzed: de lta na je dngos po sngar byung la /
translated: then things would arise earlierüîΩand

original: phyis de la dga' mgur 'dogs pa'i tshig nye bar 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: phyis de la dga' mgur 'dogs pa'i tshig nye bar 'dogs na ni /
translated: If later on, the term is applied to it,

original: 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar 'dogs pa'i snga rol 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar ma btags pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar 'dogs pa'i snga rol 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar ma btags pa'i tshe /
translated: then before the term is applied,

original: chos de dang dngos po de ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos de dang dngos po de ngo bo nyid med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: that phenomenon and that entity would be just essenceless.

original: ngo bo nyid med par gyur na yang dngos po med pa la ni 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar gdags su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par gyur na yang dngos po med pa la ni 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar gdags su mi rung ngo //
translated: And if they were essenceless, it would not be tenable for them to be designated by terms.

original: 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar 'dogs pa med na yang /
analyzed: 'dogs pa'i tshig gis nye bar 'dogs pa med na yang /
translated: And if they were not designated by terms,

original: chos dang dngos por 'dogs pa'i tshig gis ngo bo nyid du yod par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chos dang dngos por 'dogs pa'i tshig gis ngo bo nyid du yod par mi rung ngo //
translated: it would not be tenable for them to exist essentially as phenomena and entities.

original: gal te @25b 'dogs pa'i tshig nye bar 'dogs pa'i snga rol nas /
analyzed: gal te @25b 'dogs pa'i tshig nye bar 'dogs pa'i snga rol nas /
translated: If, prior to the application of the term,

original: gzugs de gzugs kyi bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzugs de gzugs kyi bdag nyid yin te /
translated: that form were the nature of form,

original: phyis kyang gzugs kyi bdag nyid la gdags pa'i tshig gis bsdus pa'i gzugs su nye bar 'dogs par byed na yang /
analyzed: phyis kyang gzugs kyi bdag nyid la gdags pa'i tshig gis bsdus pa'i gzugs su nye bar 'dogs par byed na yang /
translated: then later on, the term would designate it as form.

original: de lta na ni gzugs zhes 'dogs pa'i tshig nye bar 'dogs pa de med bzhin du yang gzugs zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i chos dang / gzugs zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po de la gzugs kyi blo 'jug par 'gyur pa'i rigs na mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzugs zhes 'dogs pa'i tshig nye bar 'dogs pa de med bzhin du yang gzugs zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i chos dang / gzugs zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po de la gzugs kyi blo 'jug par 'gyur pa'i rigs na mi 'jug ste /
translated: If that were so, then even without the application of the term ‚Äúform,‚Äù the cognition of form would occur with regard to a phenomenon that is called ‚Äúform‚Äù and a thing that is called ‚Äúform,‚Äù but it does not occur.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di dang / rigs pa 'dis chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs 'di dang / rigs pa 'dis chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by this reasoning and this argument, one should understand that all phenomena are inexpressible by nature.

original: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gzugs la ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Just as with form, so it is with feeling, etc.,

original: tha na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du ji skad bstan pa'i chos rnams la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha na mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du ji skad bstan pa'i chos rnams la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: up to the final nirvana.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la 'dogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / 'dogs pa'i tshig gi mtshan ma'i gzhi 'dogs pa'i tshig gi mtshan ma'i rten du gyur pa /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams la gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la 'dogs pa'i tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags nas mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa dang / 'dogs pa'i tshig gi mtshan ma'i gzhi 'dogs pa'i tshig gi mtshan ma'i rten du gyur pa /
translated: The two extremes are: (1) the reification of the intrinsic identity of the entities of phenomena such as form, etc., by superimposing the intrinsic identity of the entities of phenomena such as form, etc., upon the designations of terms, where such do not exist; and (2) the deprecation of the ultimate existence of the inexpressible self-entity of things, which is the basis of the signs of designations, the support of the signs of designations, by saying that it does not exist at all.

original: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis don dam par yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la thams cad kyi thams cad du med do zhes skur pa 'debs shing chud gzon par byed pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis ni chos 'dul ba 'di las rab tu nyams paüîΩyin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid kyis don dam par yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la thams cad kyi thams cad du med do zhes skur pa 'debs shing chud gzon par byed pa gang yin pa 'di gnyis ni chos 'dul ba 'di las rab tu nyams pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These two should be known as the two great faults that are the extremes of reification and deprecation, which are the two great downfalls from this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni thog ma nyid du dpyad cing bsal bar byas la /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la sgro 'dogs pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni thog ma nyid du dpyad cing bsal bar byas la /
translated: The faults of reification should be analyzed and cleared away from the very beginning.

original: bkrol zhing bstan zin te nyes pa de dag gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags pas chos 'dul ba 'di las rab tu nyams pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bkrol zhing bstan zin te nyes pa de dag gis gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa la sgro btags pas chos 'dul ba 'di las rab tu nyams pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Having been explained and unraveled, it should be understood that those who deprecate things such as form, and who superimpose existence on what is nonexistent, fall away from this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po tsam la yang skur ba 'debs shing ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po tsam la yang skur ba 'debs shing ;
translated: They deprecate the mere existence of things such as form,

original: thams cad chud gzon pa de dag chos 'dul ba 'di las ji ltar rab tu nyams par 'gur ba de ltar bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad chud gzon pa de dag chos 'dul ba 'di las ji ltar rab tu nyams par 'gur ba de ltar bshad par bya ste /
translated: and they destroy everything. It should be explained how they fall away from this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po tsam la skur ba 'debs pa la ni de kho na yang med pa la 'dogs pa yang med de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi dngos po tsam la skur ba 'debs pa la ni de kho na yang med pa la 'dogs pa yang med de /
translated: Those who deprecate the mere existence of things such as form do not even impute nonexistence to reality.

original: de gnyi ga yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang mi rigs so //
translated: Both of those are unreasonable.

original: @26a * // 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: @26a * // 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams yod na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams yod na /
translated: if the aggregates such as form exist,

analyzed: chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched dang / 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol dang / nyi ma dang /

analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /

analyzed: tshig dang thos pa med na yang brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid de shes par mi nus so //

original: de bas na thos pa dang shes par bya ba'i phyir brjod par yang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa dang shes par bya ba'i phyir brjod par yang sbyor bar byed do //

analyzed: de bzhin nyid de de ltar yongs su ma @28b shes pas /

original: gzhi de las byis pa rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa dngos po gsum skyed pa dang / sems can dang / snod kyi 'jig rten thams cad sgrub pa rnam pa brgyad 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: conceptualization of an essence, conceptualization of distinctions, conceptualization of a whole, conceptualization of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù conceptualization of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

analyzed: sdug par rnam par rtog pa dang / mi sdug par rnam par rtog pa dang / de gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //

translated: The two concepts, the aspect of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the aspect of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù are the root of all views other than the view of the transitory collection, and they are the root of all pride other than the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù which is the root of pride.

translated: The basis of conceptual proliferation is the thing that is proliferated. The view, the pride of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù and the three: desire, hatred, and ignorance, are the three bases that are the cause of the arising of the world.

analyzed: @29b 'byung ba log pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa de ni bdag go snyam pa dang / bdag gi snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the discursive thought of the notion of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the notion of ‚Äúmine‚Äù which arises in regard to a thing that is favorable to one‚Äôs own view.

original: sdug par rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug par rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the discursive thought of what is agreeable?

original: mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is a discursive thought which has as its object a beautiful and pleasing thing.

original: mi sdug par rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi sdug par rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a discursive thought of the ugly?

original: mi mdzes pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩsdug pa dang mi sdug pa gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mdzes pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o // sdug pa dang mi sdug pa gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang zhe na /
translated: It is a discursive thought which has as its object an ugly and unpleasing thing.üîΩWhat is a discursive thought which is the opposite of both the beautiful and the ugly?

original: mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba de gnyis la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba de gnyis la ma gtogs pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is a discursive thought which has as its object a thing which is neither beautiful nor ugly, neither pleasing nor unpleasing.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, it is twofold:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i rten rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i rten rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: discursive thought and the basis of discursive thought, the thing which is the object of discursive thought.

original: de gnyi ga yang thog ma med pa dang / gcig gi rgyu las gcig byung ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang thog ma med pa dang / gcig gi rgyu las gcig byung ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Both of them should be understood as having no beginning and as being produced by the cause of each one.

original: rnam par rtog pa snga ma ni da ltar byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa snga ma ni da ltar byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The former conceptualization is the cause for the occurrence of the objective mental support of the present conceptualization.

original: da ltar byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po byung ba ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa'i dngos po byung ba ni /
translated: The occurrence of the objective mental support of the present conceptualization

original: da ltar byung ba de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: is the cause for the occurrence of the conceptualization that has that as its mental support.

original: de la da ltar gyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi rnam par rtog pa yongs su ma shes pa ni /
translated: The non-understanding of the present conceptualization

original: phyi ma la de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: is the cause for the occurrence of its objective mental support in the future.

original: de byung na de la gnas pa de la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de byung na de la gnas pa de la brten pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When that occurs, the conceptualization that is based on that and that has that as its mental support will certainly occur.

original: rnam par rtog pa de ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that conceptualization to be understood?

original: yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnam pa bzhis 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnam pa bzhis 'gyur te /
translated: It is through the four investigations and the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the way things really are.

original: yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four investigations?

original: ming yongs su tshol ba dang / dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang / ngo bo nyid du btags pa yongs su tshol ba dang / bye brag tu btags pa yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: ming yongs su tshol ba dang / dngos po yongs su tshol ba dang / ngo bo nyid du btags pa yongs su tshol ba dang / bye brag tu btags pa yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: The investigation of names, the investigation of things, the investigation of the nature of the designation of an entity, and the investigation of the nature of the designation of a distinguishing attribute.

original: de la ming yongs su tshol ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang ming la ming tsam du lta ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ming yongs su tshol ba ni byang chub sems dpa' gang ming la ming tsam du lta ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The investigation of names is the bodhisattva's view that a name is merely a name.

original: de bzhin du dngos po la dngos po tsam du lta ba ni /üîΩdngos po yongs su tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po la dngos po tsam du lta ba ni / dngos po yongs su tshol ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the investigation of things is the view that a thing is merely a thing.

original: ngo bo nyid du btags pa la ngo bo nyid du btags pa tsam du lta pa ni ngo bo nyid du btags pa yongs su tshol ba'o //üîΩbye brag tu @30a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du btags pa la ngo bo nyid du btags pa tsam du lta pa ni ngo bo nyid du btags pa yongs su tshol ba'o // bye brag tu @30a * //
translated: The investigation of the nature of the designation of an entity is the view that the nature of the designation of an entity is merely the nature of the designation of an entity.

original: btags pa la bye brag tu btags pa tsam du lta ba ni bye brag tu btags pa yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: btags pa la bye brag tu btags pa tsam du lta ba ni bye brag tu btags pa yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: The investigation of the nature of the designation of a distinguishing attribute is the view that the nature of the designation of a distinguishing attribute is merely the nature of the designation of a distinguishing attribute.

original: des ming dang dngos po'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / 'brel par yang mthong la /
analyzed: des ming dang dngos po'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dang / 'brel par yang mthong la /
translated: By means of these, one sees the difference in the characteristics of names and things, and their connection.

original: ming dang dngos po 'brel pa la brten pa ngo bo nyid du btags pa dang bye brag tu btags pa yang khong du chud do //
analyzed: ming dang dngos po 'brel pa la brten pa ngo bo nyid du btags pa dang bye brag tu btags pa yang khong du chud do //
translated: One should understand that the designation of an essence and the designation of a specific property rely on the connection between a name and an object.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa bzhi po de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the way things really are?

original: ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / dngos po tshol bar gyur pa dang / ngo bo nyid du btags pa tshol bar gyur pa dang / bye brag tu btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang / dngos po tshol bar gyur pa dang / ngo bo nyid du btags pa tshol bar gyur pa dang / bye brag tu btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the way things really are that is the investigation of names, the thorough knowledge of the way things really are that is the investigation of objects, the thorough knowledge of the way things really are that is the investigation of the designation of an essence, and the thorough knowledge of the way things really are that is the investigation of the designation of a specific property.

original: ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of the way things really are that is the investigation of names?

original: byang chub sems dpa' des ming la ming tsam du yongs su btsal nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' des ming la ming tsam du yongs su btsal nas /
translated: When a bodhisattva investigates names as mere names,

original: ming de la 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes te /
analyzed: ming de la 'di ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes te /
translated: he thoroughly knows that name in accordance with reality.

original: 'di ltar ming 'di ni 'di lta bu'i don du dngos po la rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming 'di ni 'di lta bu'i don du dngos po la rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Thus, this name is established in this way in regard to this object.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi don dang / lta ba'i don dang / nye bar 'dogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi don dang / lta ba'i don dang / nye bar 'dogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: Thus, in regard to the object of the formative forces, the object of view, and the object of designation.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs par ming du btags pa'i dngos po la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming rnam par mi 'jog na ni /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs par ming du btags pa'i dngos po la gzugs zhes bya ba'i ming rnam par mi 'jog na ni /
translated: If the name form were not established in regard to the entity designated as form,

original: sus kyang dngos po de la gzugs zhes bya bar de ltar shes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sus kyang dngos po de la gzugs zhes bya bar de ltar shes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: no one would know that entity as form.

original: mi shes na ni sgro 'dogs shing mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi shes na ni sgro 'dogs shing mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not known, there would be no superimposition and no adherence.

original: mngon par zhen pa med na brjod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med na brjod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no adherence, there would be no verbal proliferation.

original: gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa de ni ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa de ni ming tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who knows this as it really is has thorough knowledge of the investigation of names as it really is.

original: dngos po tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is thorough knowledge of the investigation of entities as they really are?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas dngos po la dngos po tsam du yongs su btsal nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpas dngos po la dngos po tsam du yongs su btsal nas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, having thoroughly investigated the thing as just a thing,

original: gzugs la sogs par ming btags pa'i dngos po de brjod pa thams cad dang ma 'dres shing brjod du med par mthong ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par ming btags pa'i dngos po de brjod pa thams cad dang ma 'dres shing brjod du med par mthong ste /
translated: sees that thing designated as form, etc., as unmixed with all verbal expressions and as inexpressible.

original: 'di ni dngos po tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second thorough knowledge of the way things are, which is the thorough investigation of things.

original: ngo bo nyid du btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of the way things are, which is the thorough investigation of the designation of an intrinsic nature?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzugs @30b la sogs par ming btags pa'i dngos po la ngo bo nyid du btags pa tsam du yongs su btsal nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' gzugs @30b la sogs par ming btags pa'i dngos po la ngo bo nyid du btags pa tsam du yongs su btsal nas /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, having thoroughly investigated the thing designated as form, etc., as just a designation of an intrinsic nature,

original: ngo bo nyid du btags pa des de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po la de'i ngo bo nyid du snang bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud cing rab tu shes te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du btags pa des de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i dngos po la de'i ngo bo nyid du snang bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud cing rab tu shes te /
translated: thoroughly understands and knows that the thing which is not of that intrinsic nature appears as if it were, because of the designation of an intrinsic nature.

original: des de'i ngo bo nyid du sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bur mthong ste /
analyzed: des de'i ngo bo nyid du sprul pa dang / gzugs brnyan dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / chu zla dang / rmi lam dang / sgyu ma lta bur mthong ste /
translated: He sees it as an emanation, a reflection, an echo, an optical illusion, the moon in water, a dream, and an illusion.

original: der snang ba ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin par mthong na de ni shin tu zab pa'i don spyod yul du gyur pa ngo bo nyid du btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: der snang ba ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin par mthong na de ni shin tu zab pa'i don spyod yul du gyur pa ngo bo nyid du btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gsum pa'o //
translated: When he sees that what appears as that is not of the nature of that, then that is the third thorough knowledge of reality, which is the thorough knowledge of reality that is the search for the designation of essence, which is the object of the most profound meaning.

original: bye brag tu btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag tu btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of reality that is the search for the designation of a specific thing?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' bye brag tu btags pa la btags pa tsam du btsal nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' bye brag tu btags pa la btags pa tsam du btsal nas /
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva, having searched for the designation of a specific thing as a mere designation,

original: gzugs la sogs par ming btags pa'i dngos po de la bye brag tu btags pa rnams la gnyis su med pa'i don du mthong la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs par ming btags pa'i dngos po de la bye brag tu btags pa rnams la gnyis su med pa'i don du mthong la /
translated: sees the designations of specific things as the meaning of non-duality in that thing designated as form and so on.

original: dngos po de yang yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po de yang yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: And that thing does not exist.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent,

original: brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis yongs su grub pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not established as the nature of expression.

original: yod pa ma yin la brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin la brjod du med pa'i bdag nyid du rnam par gnas pa'i phyir med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because it exists as the nature of the inexpressible.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa'i bden pas ni /
translated: In the same way, the ultimate truth

original: gzugs can ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin la /
translated: is not material,üîΩbut it is not immaterial,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pas ni /üîΩde la gzugs su nye bar 'dogs pas gzugs can ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pas ni / de la gzugs su nye bar 'dogs pas gzugs can ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: because materiality is imputed to it by conventional truth.

original: dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs par bye brag tu btags pa'i rnam grangs thams cad la yang tshul du 'dis de ltar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa ji lta ba de bzhin du bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa la sogs par bye brag tu btags pa'i rnam grangs thams cad la yang tshul du 'dis de ltar rig par bya ste /
translated: Just as existent things, nonexistent things, material things, and immaterial things are, in the same way, all the categories of things that are designated as having particular qualities, such as being visible or invisible, should be understood in this way.

original: de ltar gang gis bye brag tu btags pa ste gnyis su med pa'i don du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa 'di ni bye brag tu btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba zhin du yongs su shes pa
analyzed: de ltar gang gis bye brag tu btags pa ste gnyis su med pa'i don du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa 'di ni bye brag tu btags pa tshol bar gyur pa yang dag pa ji lta ba zhin du yongs su shes pa
translated: called the correct thorough understanding of the way things really are.üîΩThe eight kinds of false conceptions of sojourners, which are the basis for the production of the three bases, and which bring about the establishment of the world, do not occur

original: zhes bya'o // de la byes pa rnams kyi log par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po gzhi gsum skyed pa 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnam pa bzhi po de med @31a * //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la byes pa rnams kyi log par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po gzhi gsum skyed pa 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnam pa bzhi po de med @31a * //
translated: and do not continue to exist when there is the correct thorough understanding of the way things really are, which is the investigation of the designation of particularities.

original: cing ; mi gnas na 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩlog pa'i rnam par rtog pa de las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cing ; mi gnas na 'byung bar 'gyur ro // log pa'i rnam par rtog pa de las ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that non-occurrence, affliction does not arise.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las ni 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From affliction, there is no wandering in cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba na 'khor ba las ni 'khor ba'i rjes su song ba skye ba dang / rga ba dang// na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba na 'khor ba las ni 'khor ba'i rjes su song ba skye ba dang / rga ba dang// na ba dang / 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In cyclic existence, the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on, arises for one who has gone along with cyclic existence.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnam pa bzhi po la brten nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa rnam pa bzhi po la brten nas /
translated: When the bodhisattva, on the basis of the four kinds of thorough knowledge of the way things really are,

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po de yongs su shes par gyur pa na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa brgyad po de yongs su shes par gyur pa na /
translated: thoroughly knows those eight kinds of conceptualization,

original: tshe 'di nyid la de yongs su shes par gyur pas phyi ma la de'i rten dang de'i dmigs pa spros par gtogs pa'i dngos po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la de yongs su shes par gyur pas phyi ma la de'i rten dang de'i dmigs pa spros par gtogs pa'i dngos po 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, in this very life, through thoroughly knowing them, in the future the basis of those conceptualizations and the things that are the objects of those conceptualizations, which belong to the realm of conceptual proliferation, will not arise.

original: de ma skyes shing ma byung bas de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang phyi ma la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma skyes shing ma byung bas de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang phyi ma la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they do not arise, the conceptualizations that have them as objects will not arise in the future.

original: de ltar na dngos po dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa de'i 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni spros pa thams cad 'gog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po dang bcas pa'i rnam par rtog pa de'i 'gog pa gang yin pa de ni spros pa thams cad 'gog pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the cessation of that conceptual thought that has entities should be known as the cessation of all elaborations.

original: spros pa 'gog pa de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa 'gog pa de lta bu ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That cessation of elaborations should be known as the bodhisattva‚Äôs MahƒÅyƒÅna nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: tshe 'di nyid la de kho na'i don gyi mchog spyod yul ba'i ye shes de rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' des thams cad la dbang thob pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la de kho na'i don gyi mchog spyod yul ba'i ye shes de rnam par dag pas byang chub sems dpa' des thams cad la dbang thob pa rnyed par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of that pure wisdom whose domain is the supreme meaning of thatness in this very lifetime, that bodhisattva attains mastery over all.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩsprul pa sna tshogs la yang sprul pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / sprul pa sna tshogs la yang sprul pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis so //
translated: This is to say,üîΩover the various emanations by means of the emanation miracle.

analyzed: skad cig bar chad med pa'i tshul gyis go rims gang gis rgyun ma chad par byas par rgyun chags pa yang yang dag par rjes su dgongs so //
translated: He also knows the continuity of the stream of consciousness, which is uninterrupted by a moment of interruption, by whatever order it is not interrupted.

translated: The knowledge of his past abodes is unobstructed in the following ways: he knows whatever he wishes to know, he knows it exactly as it is, and he knows as much as he wishes to know.

translated: By knowing the former abodes, the buddhas generate faith, respect and weariness in sentient beings.üîΩ

translated: By means of the knowledge of recollecting former abodes, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, manifest various kinds of former lives of the Bodhisattvas, which are the supreme and marvelous conduct, in order to generate faith, devotion, and weariness in sentient beings with regard to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sngon gyi tshul dang ldan pa'i de lta bu byung ba dag kyang ston to //
analyzed: sngon gyi tshul dang ldan pa'i de lta bu byung ba dag kyang ston to //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: sngon gyi mthar rtogs pa'i rtag par smra ba rnams dang / kha cig rtag par 'dzin pa'i sems can rtag par lta ba rnams kyi rtag par lta ba yang sel bar mdzad do //
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar rtogs pa'i rtag par smra ba rnams dang / kha cig rtag par 'dzin pa'i sems can rtag par lta ba rnams kyi rtag par lta ba yang sel bar mdzad do //
translated: they dispel the eternalistic views of those who propound eternalism at the beginning, and of those sentient beings who grasp at permanence and hold eternalistic views.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba mkhyen pa gang zhe na /üîΩ'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lha'i rna ba mkhyen pa gang zhe na / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: What is the knowledge of the divine ear of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas?

original: byang chub sems dpas lha'i rna bas lha dang mi'i sgra dang / 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams dang / sgra chen po rnams dang / sgra chung du rnams dang / gsal ba rnams dang / mi gsal ba rnams dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lha'i rna bas lha dang mi'i sgra dang / 'phags pa rnams dang / 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams dang / sgra chen po rnams dang / sgra chung du rnams dang / gsal ba rnams dang / mi gsal ba rnams dang /
translated: Here the Tathagata or the bodhisattva, by means of the divine ear, hears the sounds of the gods and men, the sounds of the noble ones and the non-noble ones, the great sounds and the small sounds, the clear sounds and the unclear sounds,

original: sprul pa rnams dang / sprul pa ma yin pa rnams dang / rgyang ring po dang / drung na 'dug pa rnams thos pa yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa rnams dang / sprul pa ma yin pa rnams dang / rgyang ring po dang / drung na 'dug pa rnams thos pa yin te /
translated: the sounds of the emanations and the non-emanations, the sounds from afar and the sounds nearby.

original: de la lha rnams kyi sgra ni gal te yan chad du 'jug par mi mdzad na /
analyzed: de la lha rnams kyi sgra ni gal te yan chad du 'jug par mi mdzad na /
translated: There, the sounds of the gods, if the Tathagata does not wish to engage in them,

analyzed: gong du 'og min gyi gnas man chad du sems can skyes pa rnams kyi'o //

original: ji ste 'jug pa mdzad na ni gyen du de las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi yang gsan to //
analyzed: ji ste 'jug pa mdzad na ni gyen du de las 'das pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gyi yang gsan to //
translated: But if he wishes to engage in them, he also hears those beyond that in other world systems.

analyzed: de la mi rnams kyi sgra ni thad kar gling bzhi pa thams cad du sems can skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The sound of humans is the sound of all sentient beings born in the four continents.

original: de la sgra 'phags pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sgra dang / de las gzhan pa'i sems can rnams kyis de dag thos nas rjes su sgrogs par byed de /

translated: The sound of the noble ones is the sound of the Buddhas, the Hearers of the Buddhas, the Bodhisattvas, the Solitary Realizers, and other sentient beings who hear those and proclaim them.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dge ba yang dag par blang ba dang / mi dge ba spang ba las brtsams nas yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par len du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par dga' bar byed pa rnams kyi gang dag yin pa'o //

translated: It is the sound of those who, beginning with taking up virtue and abandoning non-virtue, teach correctly, cause to take it up correctly, praise correctly, and delight correctly.

original: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis lung nod pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa dang / lags par bskul ba dang / dran par byed pa dang / 'doms pa dang / rjes su ston pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis lung nod pa dang / kha ton byed pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa dang / lags par bskul ba dang / dran par byed pa dang / 'doms pa dang / rjes su ston pa yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, it is the same for the wholesome thought that is not defiled, when one receives the teaching, when one recites, when one determines, when one exhorts, when one remembers, when one instructs, when one teaches.

original: gzhan yang legs par smras @37b pa dang ; legs par brjod pa dang / don dang ldan pa gzhan gang ci yang rung ba de dag ni sgra 'phags pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang legs par smras @37b pa dang ; legs par brjod pa dang / don dang ldan pa gzhan gang ci yang rung ba de dag ni sgra 'phags pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, whatever is well-spoken, well-said, and meaningful is the sound of the noble ones.

original: sgra 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams ni sems can rnams kyi brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa'i sgra gang yin pa rnams dang / 'og tu ngan song du skyes pa rnams dang / gong du lha'i nang du skyes pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sgra 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams ni sems can rnams kyi brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa'i sgra gang yin pa rnams dang / 'og tu ngan song du skyes pa rnams dang / gong du lha'i nang du skyes pa rnams dang /
translated: The sound of the non-noble ones is the sound of sentient beings' lying, slander, harsh speech, and idle chatter, as well as the sounds of those born in the lower realms below, those born among the gods above,

original: thad kar mi'i nang du skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: thad kar mi'i nang du skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: and those born among humans on the same level.

original: de la sgra chen po rnams ni sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i sgra rnams sam /
analyzed: de la sgra chen po rnams ni sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i sgra rnams sam /
translated: The loud sounds are the sounds of a great multitude of beings,

original: gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gnod par gyur nas /
analyzed: gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gnod par gyur nas /
translated: or the sounds of those who are afflicted by various kinds of harm,

original: nyam thag pa'i skad kyis ngu zhing /üîΩku co 'don pa rnams kyi'am /üîΩ'brug sgra grag pa'am /
analyzed: nyam thag pa'i skad kyis ngu zhing / ku co 'don pa rnams kyi'am / 'brug sgra grag pa'am /
translated: crying out in distress,üîΩor the sounds of those who are wailing.üîΩOr they are the sounds of thunder,

original: dung dang / rnga bo che dang / rnga pa ta ha'i sgra rnams yin no //
analyzed: dung dang / rnga bo che dang / rnga pa ta ha'i sgra rnams yin no //

original: sgra gsal ba rnams ni gang dag gis don go ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra gsal ba rnams ni gang dag gis don go ba yin no //
