original: sgra mi gsal ba rnams ni gang dag gis don go bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sgra mi gsal ba rnams ni gang dag gis don go bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The unclear sounds are those that do not convey meaning.

original: 'di lta ste 'gro lding ba'i gsang sngags rnams sam /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'gro lding ba'i gsang sngags rnams sam /
translated: For example, the sounds of the secret mantras of the DƒÅrdas,

analyzed: rlung dang / nags tshal dang / ne tso dang / re skegs dang / khu byug dang / shang shang te'u la sogs pa rnams kyi sgra yin no //
translated: or the sounds of the wind, forests, parrots, cuckoos, and partridges.

original: de la sgra sprul pa rnams ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'dus byas pa gang yin pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la sgra sprul pa rnams ni rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa sems la dbang thob pa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'dus byas pa gang yin pa rnams so //
translated: The sounds of emanations are those produced by the supernormal creations of those who have obtained mastery of mind through the superknowledges.

original: rgyang ring po'i sgra rnams ni grong gi gnas sam /
analyzed: rgyang ring po'i sgra rnams ni grong gi gnas sam /
translated: The sounds from afar are those that occur in a monastery or a town,

original: gtsug lag khang gang ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gang ni de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: or in a place where the Tathagata or a Bodhisattva is residing.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs pa der sgra byung ba gang yin pa de dag ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bzhugs pa der sgra byung ba gang yin pa de dag ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa dag rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: The sounds that occur elsewhere, in innumerable and incalculable world systems, are the sounds that occur in the world.

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba mkhyen pa gang zhe na /

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa 'am /
translated: Here the Tathagata or the Bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpas lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams 'chi 'pho'i tshe dang / shi 'phos pa na yang gzigs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can rnams 'chi 'pho'i tshe dang / shi 'phos pa na yang gzigs te /

translated: He sees and knows the various activities of the body, whether virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral, that arise from the ripening of the faculties due to the cause of birth and aging in the past, present, and future, whether beautiful or ugly, good or bad.

original: 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin du snang ba yang gzigs shing mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnams dang / de bzhin du snang ba yang gzigs shing mkhyen to //

analyzed: 'jug pa mi mdzad na ni 'og tu mnar med pa la thug pa yan chad gong du 'og min gyi gnas la thug pa man chad gzigs so //
translated: he sees from below to the Avƒ´ci hell and from above to the Akani·π£·π≠ha realm.

original: ji ste ched du gzigs na ni de las 'das pa'i 'og tu steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa thams cad kyang gzigs te /
analyzed: ji ste ched du gzigs na ni de las 'das pa'i 'og tu steng dang thad kar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa dag na gzugs yod pa thams cad kyang gzigs te /
translated: If he wishes to see, he sees all the forms that exist in the innumerable, unlimited world systems above, below, and across, beyond the range of the divine eye.

original: cher na sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang de dag na de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor sna tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i nang na chos ston cing bzhugs pa de dang de dag kyang gzigs so //üîΩde la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: cher na sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang de dag na de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor sna tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i nang na chos ston cing bzhugs pa de dang de dag kyang gzigs so // de la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: He sees the Tathagatas in their various buddha-fields, dwelling in the midst of the great circles of their assemblies and teaching the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpas lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams kyi las kyi spyod pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dag gzigs nas ci rigs ci 'os par de dag la nan tan mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lha'i mig gis phyogs bcu'i sems can rnams kyi las kyi spyod pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dag gzigs nas ci rigs ci 'os par de dag la nan tan mdzad do //
translated: The Tathagata or the Bodhisattva, by means of the divine eye, sees the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions of beings in the ten directions, and he teaches them accordingly.

original: lha'i rna bas kyang ngag gi spyod pa dag dge ba dang / mi dge ba dag gsan nas sems can de dag la ci rigs ci 'os par nan tan mdzad do //
analyzed: lha'i rna bas kyang ngag gi spyod pa dag dge ba dang / mi dge ba dag gsan nas sems can de dag la ci rigs ci 'os par nan tan mdzad do //
translated: By means of the divine ear, he hears the virtuous and nonvirtuous speech of beings, and he teaches them accordingly.

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba 'dis phrin las mdzad do //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni lha'i mig dang / lha'i rna ba 'dis phrin las mdzad do //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattvas and the TathƒÅgatas carry out their activities by means of the divine eye and the divine ear.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems kyi rnam grangs mkhyen pa gang yin zhe na /üîΩ'di la byang chub sems dpa'am /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems kyi rnam grangs mkhyen pa gang yin zhe na / 'di la byang chub sems dpa'am /
translated: What is the knowledge of the variety of minds of others possessed by the Buddhas and the bodhisattvas?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa dag na sems can 'khod pa gzhan dag gi sems nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang 'brel par bcas shing bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa dang /üîΩnyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin zhing bag la nyal ba med pa yang mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med grangs med pa dag na sems can 'khod pa gzhan dag gi sems nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang 'brel par bcas shing bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang 'brel pa ma yin zhing bag la nyal ba med pa yang mkhyen to //
translated: Here the bodhisattva or the TathƒÅgata knows the mind of another which is free from the entanglement of the defilements, and which is associated with the defilements and their traces,üîΩand the mind which is not associated with the defilements and their traces.

original: smon lam log par btab pa'i sems 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smon lam log par btab pa'i sems 'di lta ste /
translated: He knows the mind which is wrongly resolved, namely,

original: mu stegs can gyi sems dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i bsam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i sems gang yang rung ba yang mkhyen to //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi sems dang / zang zing dang bcas pa'i bsam pa can gyi nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i sems gang yang rung ba yang mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the minds of the tƒ´rthikas, and also the minds of those who are not afflicted, but who have a mind that is full of worldly concerns.

original: de las bzlog pa smon lam @38b legs par btab pa'i sems kyang mkhyen to //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa smon lam @38b legs par btab pa'i sems kyang mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the mind that is the opposite of that, the mind that is well-disposed.

original: smon pa'i sems 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smon pa'i sems 'di lta ste /
translated: The mind that is well-disposed is as follows:

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i sems can tha na ri dvags dang bya yan chad thams cad kyi sems kyang mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i sems can tha na ri dvags dang bya yan chad thams cad kyi sems kyang mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the minds of all beings born in the desire realm, even those of animals and birds.

original: bar ma'i sems 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bar ma'i sems 'di lta ste /
translated: The middling mind is as follows:

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi yang mkhyen to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi yang mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the minds of all beings born in the form realm.

original: gya nom pa'i sems can 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gya nom pa'i sems can 'di lta ste /
translated: The excellent mind is as follows:

original: gzugs med par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi yang mkhyen to //
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa'i sems can thams cad kyi yang mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the minds of all beings born in the formless realm.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyang mkhyen to //
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyang mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the minds that are associated with pleasure, associated with pain, and associated with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: pha rol gyi sems mkhyen pa gcig gis sems can gcig gang gi sems gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu dang / ci 'dra ba dang / ji snyed pa nye bar gnas pa de yang cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to //üîΩpha rol gyi sems mkhyen pa gcig kho nas sems can mang po gang dag gi sems gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu dang / ci 'dra pa dang / ji snyed nye bar gnas pa de yang cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems mkhyen pa gcig gis sems can gcig gang gi sems gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu dang / ci 'dra ba dang / ji snyed pa nye bar gnas pa de yang cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to // pha rol gyi sems mkhyen pa gcig kho nas sems can mang po gang dag gi sems gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu dang / ci 'dra pa dang / ji snyed nye bar gnas pa de yang cig car yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen to //
translated: One knowledge of others‚Äô minds knows the minds of all sentient beings, what they are, how they are, what they are like, and how many there are, all at once, just as it is.üîΩOne knowledge of others‚Äô minds knows the minds of many sentient beings, what they are, how they are, what they are like, and how many there are, all at once, just as it is.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa de yang sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / khams dang / spyod pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa de yang sems can rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang / khams dang / spyod pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa dang /
translated: The higher perceptions of buddhas and bodhisattvas also include knowledge of the faculties of sentient beings, knowledge of their superior and inferior faculties, knowledge of their various aspirations, knowledge of their various elements and conduct, and knowledge of their various kinds of maturity.

original: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam sna tshogs dag tu ci rigs par yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam sna tshogs dag tu ci rigs par yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is the correct application to the various paths leading to nirvana.

original: de ni de'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as its function.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa gang zhe na /üîΩ'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa gang zhe na / 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: What is the knowledge of the extinction of the outflows of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas?

original: byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa thob pa zag pa zad pa bdag gis sam gzhan dag gis thob pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa thob pa zag pa zad pa bdag gis sam gzhan dag gis thob pa'am /
translated: Here the Tathagata or the Bodhisattva knows as it is that the extinction of the outflows is attained by oneself or by others,

original: ma thob pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: ma thob pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: whether or not it is attained,

original: bdag dang gzhan dag gi zag pa zad pa 'thob pa'i thabs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag gi zag pa zad pa 'thob pa'i thabs kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and he knows as it is the means of attaining the extinction of the outflows for oneself and for others.

original: thabs ji lta ba bzhin du thabs ma yin pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: thabs ji lta ba bzhin du thabs ma yin pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it is what is a means and what is not a means.

original: gzhan dag gi zag pa zad pa thob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal yar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //üîΩmngon pa'i nga rgyal med @39a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi zag pa zad pa thob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal yar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // mngon pa'i nga rgyal med @39a * //
translated: He also knows the pride of others in attaining the destruction of the defilements, just as it is.

original: pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the absence of pride, just as it is.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag thams cad ni mkhyen kyang zag pa zad pa yang bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du mi mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag thams cad ni mkhyen kyang zag pa zad pa yang bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du mi mdzad do //
translated: The Bodhisattva knows all of this, but does not himself realize the destruction of the defilements.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po zag pa rnams dang lhan cig tu mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po zag pa rnams dang lhan cig tu mi 'dor ro //
translated: Therefore, the Bodhisattva does not abandon the conditioned things which are associated with the defilements.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de la yang spyod la kun nas nyon mongs pa can du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po de la yang spyod la kun nas nyon mongs pa can du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: He also experiences the conditioned things which are associated with the defilements, but he is not defiled.

original: de ni de'i mthu thams cad kyi nang na ches mthu che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni de'i mthu thams cad kyi nang na ches mthu che ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be known as the greatest power of all his powers.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag nyid kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bdag nyid kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur la /
translated: By means of the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants, the Buddhas and bodhisattvas do not become defiled themselves,

original: gzhan dag la yang ston cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal yang sel bar mdzad pa 'di ni de'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang ston cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal yang sel bar mdzad pa 'di ni de'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and they teach others to overcome their pride. This should be understood as the action of that knowledge.

original: de la chos kyi mthu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos kyi mthu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the power of the Dharma?

original: sbyin pa'i mthu dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi mthu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i mthu dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi mthu'o //
translated: It is the power of generosity, morality, tolerance, effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag gi mthu de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag gi mthu de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: The power of these Dharmas, generosity, etc., should be understood as fourfold:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba dang / tshogs yongs su smin par byed pa dang / bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang / phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: abandoning the resistant tendency, maturing the collection, benefiting oneself and others, and producing results in the future.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa sbyin pa na sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna yang spong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa sbyin pa na sbyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ser sna yang spong ngo //
translated: When the bodhisattva gives a gift, he also abandons the stinginess that is the resistance to giving.

original: de'i sbyin pa de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa yang yin la bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de'i sbyin pa de bdag nyid kyi byang chub kyi tshogs su gyur pa yang yin la bsdu ba'i dngos po sbyin pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: That gift of his becomes a collection for his own enlightenment, and by the gift as a means of gathering, he brings sentient beings to maturity.

original: sbyin pa'i snga rol du yang yid dga' la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i snga rol du yang yid dga' la /
translated: Before giving, he is happy.

original: sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dang bar byed cing byin pa'i 'og tu yang 'gyod pa med de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dang bar byed cing byin pa'i 'og tu yang 'gyod pa med de /
translated: While giving, he is joyful. After giving, he has no regrets.

original: dus gsum du rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / gzhan dag bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / na ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: dus gsum du rab tu dga' ba'i sems kyis bdag nyid la phan 'dogs pa dang / gzhan dag bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / na ba dang / 'dod pas phongs pa dang / 'jigs pa'i sdug bsngal sel bas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa dang /
translated: In the three times, with a mind of great joy, he benefits himself, and he benefits others by removing the suffering of hunger, thirst, cold, heat, sickness, lack of necessities, and fear.

original: pha rol tu yang gang dang gang du skyes par phyug pa dang / longs spyod che ba dang / btsan 'gying che ba dang / g-yog 'khor mang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: pha rol tu yang gang dang gang du skyes par phyug pa dang / longs spyod che ba dang / btsan 'gying che ba dang / g-yog 'khor mang bar 'gyur la /
translated: Also, in future lives, wherever he is born, he will be wealthy, have great resources, be powerful, and have many attendants.

original: sbyin pa la yang mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la yang mos par 'gyur te /
translated: And he will be devoted to generosity.

original: de ltar na rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyin pa'i mthu yin te /üîΩ'di las gang na yang @39b med do //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni sbyin pa'i mthu yin te / 'di las gang na yang @39b med do //
translated: Thus, these four are the powers of generosity.üîΩThere is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang mad do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang mad do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa na tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyang spong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i tshul khrims yang dag par len pa na tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyang spong ngo //
translated: When the bodhisattva takes up the morality of restraint of body and speech, he also abandons immorality, which is the adversary of morality.

original: de'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de byang chub kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba yang yin la ;
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa de byang chub kyi tshogs su 'gyur ba yang yin la ;
translated: And that morality which he has taken up becomes a cause of enlightenment.

original: don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos pos kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos pos kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: And he brings beings to maturity by the means of attracting them with the gift of the Teaching.

original: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi rkyen gyis 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa spong ba na bdag nyid la phan 'dogs te /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i tshul khrims kyi rkyen gyis 'jigs pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa spong ba na bdag nyid la phan 'dogs te /
translated: By the condition of morality, one abandons fear, shamelessness, and enmity, and benefits oneself.

original: bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bde bar gnyid kyis log cing bde bar sad par 'gyur la /
translated: One sleeps happily and wakes up happily.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni 'gyod pa med cing mchog tu dga' ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang ldan pa la ni 'gyod pa med cing mchog tu dga' ba nas /
translated: Similarly, one who has morality has no regrets and is supremely joyful,

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin pa'i bar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin pa'i bar du 'gyur te /
translated: up to the concentration of the mind.

original: de ltar bdag nyid la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ltar bdag nyid la phan 'dogs so //
translated: Thus one benefits oneself.

original: sems can thams cad la yang rnam pa thams cad kyis rnam par tho mi 'tshams pas mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa byed de ;
analyzed: sems can thams cad la yang rnam pa thams cad kyis rnam par tho mi 'tshams pas mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa byed de ;
translated: And one gives the gift of fearlessness to all sentient beings, not harming them in any way,

original: de ltar gzhan la phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la phan 'dogs so //
translated: thus benefiting others.

original: lus zhig nas kyang gzhi des bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: lus zhig nas kyang gzhi des bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: And after the breakup of the body, that basis causes one to be born among the gods in a happy, heavenly realm.

original: tshul khrims la yang mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la yang mos par 'gyur te /
translated: And one becomes devoted to morality.

original: de ltar na rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni tshul khrims kyi mthu yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag ni tshul khrims kyi mthu yin te /
translated: Thus, these four are the powers of morality.

original: 'di las gong na yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med do //
translated: There is nothing higher than this.

original: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa yang med do //
translated: There is nothing greater than this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa dang ldan pa ni bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi bzod pa yang spong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa dang ldan pa ni bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi bzod pa yang spong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with patience abandons impatience, which is the adversary of patience.

original: de'i bzod pa de byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de'i bzod pa de byang chub kyi phyogs su gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: His patience becomes a factor of enlightenment.

original: don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: don mthun pas kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: And he brings beings to full maturity by means of his generosity.

original: bdag dang gzhan yang 'jigs pa chen po las yongs su skyob par byed pas na /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan yang 'jigs pa chen po las yongs su skyob par byed pas na /
translated: He benefits both himself and others by protecting them from the great fear.

original: bzod pa des bdag dang gzhan la yang phan 'dogs so //
analyzed: bzod pa des bdag dang gzhan la yang phan 'dogs so //
translated: By that patience, he benefits both himself and others.

original: gzhi des byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma la 'khon pa mang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhi des byang chub sems dpa' phyi ma la 'khon pa mang bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: On the basis of that, the bodhisattva does not become angry in the future,

original: 'byed pa mi mang la sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba mang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byed pa mi mang la sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba mang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: nor does he become divisive, nor does he become unhappy or sorrowful.

original: tshe 'di nyid la yang 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la yang 'gyod pa med par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: And at the time of death, he or she will die without regret.

original: lus zhig nas kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: de'i rtsva dang lo ma bting ba de yang phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa yin te /
translated: The grass and leaves he has spread out are also arranged in one place.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dag bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzims mal mi 'khrugs pa dang / de'i chos gos lus las rlung gis mi bskyod pa dang / seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dag bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gzims mal mi 'khrugs pa dang / de'i chos gos lus las rlung gis mi bskyod pa dang / seng ge'i stabs su gshegs pa dang / khyu mchog gi stabs su gshegs pa dang /
translated: He walks with the gait of a bull.

original: thog mar zhabs g-yas pa 'degs la /üîΩde'i 'og tu zhabs g-yon pa de'i phyi bzhin gtong ba dang / de gshegs pa nas phyogs mthon po ni dma' bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: thog mar zhabs g-yas pa 'degs la / de'i 'og tu zhabs g-yon pa de'i phyi bzhin gtong ba dang / de gshegs pa nas phyogs mthon po ni dma' bar 'gyur la /
translated: He raises his right foot first.üîΩThen he raises his left foot after that.

original: dma' ba ni mthon por 'gyur te /
analyzed: dma' ba ni mthon por 'gyur te /
translated: When he walks, the high ground becomes low and the low ground becomes high.üîΩThe ground becomes as level as the palm of the hand.üîΩThere are no stones, pebbles, or gravel.üîΩWhen he enters the town, he does so with a mind that is inclined towards solitude.

original: lag mthil ltar mnyam par gyur pa dang / rdo dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo med pa dang ; dben pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyis grong du 'gro ba dang / gshegs pa'i tshe yang sgo dma' ba rnams mthon por 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: lag mthil ltar mnyam par gyur pa dang / rdo dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo med pa dang ; dben pa la gzhol ba'i sems kyis grong du 'gro ba dang / gshegs pa'i tshe yang sgo dma' ba rnams mthon por 'gyur ba dang /
translated: When he walks, the low doors become high.

original: zhal zas gsol ba na 'bras chan 'brum bu gcig kyang legs par ma bcas par mi gsol ba dang / zhal kham phyi ma gsol ba tsam na lhag ma mi lus pa @42a * //
analyzed: zhal zas gsol ba na 'bras chan 'brum bu gcig kyang legs par ma bcas par mi gsol ba dang / zhal kham phyi ma gsol ba tsam na lhag ma mi lus pa @42a * //
translated: When he eats the last morsel, he does not leave any food remaining.

original: dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa dang gnas pas bsdus pa'i mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dang ; de lta bu dang mthun pa rnams ni 'phags pa'i spyod pa dang gnas pas bsdus pa'i mthu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These and other such powers should be understood as the power of the noble conduct and way of life.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe yang sa chen po g-yo ba dang / skar mda' ltung ba dang / phyogs me 'bar ba lta bu dang / bar snang las lha'i rnga sgra dag sgrogs te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe yang sa chen po g-yo ba dang / skar mda' ltung ba dang / phyogs me 'bar ba lta bu dang / bar snang las lha'i rnga sgra dag sgrogs te /
translated: When he passes into final nirvana, the great earth quakes, meteors fall, fires blaze in all directions, and the divine drum sounds in the sky.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu kho na yin gyi /
translated: This is the power of the TathƒÅgatas that is innate.

original: mngon par shes pas mngon par 'du byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pas mngon par 'du byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not created by the superknowledges.

original: de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the innate power of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / thun mong ma yin pa ni gang /
translated: What is the power of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas that is not common to the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas?

original: thun mong ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the power that is common to them?

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The uncommon power should be known as threefold:

original: cha phra ba dang / rnam pa dang / khams so //üîΩ'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'am byang chub sems dpa' ni mthu'i thabs dpag tu med /
analyzed: cha phra ba dang / rnam pa dang / khams so // 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa'am byang chub sems dpa' ni mthu'i thabs dpag tu med /
translated: subtle, manifold, and elemental.

original: grangs med pas ji ltar sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams kyi don mdzad pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: grangs med pas ji ltar sems can dpag tu med grangs med pa rnams kyi don mdzad pa de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: Here, the Tathagata or the Bodhisattva, by means of his immeasurable and innumerable methods of power, accomplishes the welfare of immeasurable and innumerable beings.

original: de lta bu ni cha phra ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni cha phra ba'o //
translated: This is the subtle aspect of power.

original: mngon par shes pa'i mthu dang / chos kyi mthu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i mthu dang / chos kyi mthu dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i mthu rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The power of superknowledge, the power of Dharma, and the power of birth are endowed with all aspects.

original: de lta bu ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the manifold aspect of power.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad de'i mthu'i yul yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad de'i mthu'i yul yin te /
translated: The entire world of sentient beings is the domain of their power.

original: de lta bu ni khams so //
analyzed: de lta bu ni khams so //
translated: Such is the domain of the powers.

original: nyan thos kyi mngon par shes pa'i yul ni stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams sems can gyi khams dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi mngon par shes pa'i yul ni stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams sems can gyi khams dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The domain of the superknowledges of the disciples is the world system of a billion worlds together with the sentient beings therein.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa'i yul ni stong gsum pa thams cad kho na'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par shes pa'i yul ni stong gsum pa thams cad kho na'o //
translated: The domain of the superknowledges of the solitary sages is the entire triple-thousand world systems.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag gcig pu 'dul ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni bdag gcig pu 'dul ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin gyi /
translated: Because they are engaged in the training of only themselves,

original: sems can thams cad kyi phyir ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi phyir ma yin te /
translated: not for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de bas na de dag gi mthu'i yul ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig pur zad do //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi mthu'i yul ni 'jig rten gyi khams gcig pur zad do //
translated: Therefore, the domain of their power is only one world system.

original: rnam pa 'di dag la ma gtogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu de las gzhan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di dag la ma gtogs pa sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mthu de las gzhan pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang thun mong ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Apart from these aspects, the powers of the Buddhas and bodhisattvas should be understood as not being shared in common with the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de'i phyir de ltar nyan thos dang / @42b rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / mngon par shes pa mnyam pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar nyan thos dang / @42b rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / mngon par shes pa mnyam pa ma yin na /
translated: Thus, if the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas are not equal in their supernormal knowledge to the Buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: lha dang mi dang / mu stegs can so so'i skye bo thams cad dang lta mtshungs re skan /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / mu stegs can so so'i skye bo thams cad dang lta mtshungs re skan /
translated: how much less so are the gods, humans, and all the tirthikas, ordinary beings!

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan par gtogs pa'i cho 'phrul gyi mthu gang yin pa de yang mngon par shes pa'i mthu rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i mthu rnams su ci rigs par 'dus pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan par gtogs pa'i cho 'phrul gyi mthu gang yin pa de yang mngon par shes pa'i mthu rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i mngon par shes pa'i mthu rnams su ci rigs par 'dus pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: The power of the miracles of the bodhisattvas, which are included in the miracles of expression and instruction, should be understood as being included in the powers of the superknowledges of the sphere of the miraculous, the knowledge of the diversity of minds, and the knowledge of the extinction of the outflows, as is appropriate.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las mthu'i le'u ste lnga pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las mthu'i le'u ste lnga pa'o / // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: This concludes the fifth chapter of the Bodhisattvabhumi, called the chapter on power.

original: de la yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete maturation?

original: yongs su smin pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, complete maturation should be understood as having six aspects.

original: ngo bo nyid dang yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs dang / yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag dang / yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the nature of complete maturation, the person who is being brought to complete maturation, the classification of complete maturation, the means of bringing to complete maturation, the person who brings to complete maturation, and the characteristics of the person who is brought to complete maturation.

original: de la yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: The nature of complete maturation is as follows:

original: dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon yod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon yod na /
translated: When the seed of the wholesome dharmas exists,

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la kun tu bsten pa'i rgyus nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa'i lus dang sems las su rung ba dang / nyams bde ba yang dag pa'i sbyor ba mthar phyin pa de la gnas na ston pa dang phrad kyang rung /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la kun tu bsten pa'i rgyus nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba rnam par dag pa dang mthun pa'i lus dang sems las su rung ba dang / nyams bde ba yang dag pa'i sbyor ba mthar phyin pa de la gnas na ston pa dang phrad kyang rung /
translated: through the cause of constant practice of the wholesome dharmas, the body and mind become fit for the elimination of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, and one attains the bliss of meditative concentration.

original: ston pa dang ma phrad kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ston pa dang ma phrad kyang rung ste /
translated: If one abides in that, then whether or not one meets a teacher,

original: de'i mod la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'am /
analyzed: de'i mod la nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang ba'am /
translated: immediately one eliminates the afflictive obstructionsüîΩand attains the result of a ≈õrƒÅvaka or pratyekabuddha.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba mngon sum du bya ba'i skal pa dang ldan zhing mthu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba mngon sum du bya ba'i skal pa dang ldan zhing mthu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is endowed with the good fortune and the power to eliminate the obscurations to omniscience.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rma ni gang gi tshe brtol la rag par mthar thug par gyur pa na /
analyzed: rma ni gang gi tshe brtol la rag par mthar thug par gyur pa na /
translated: When a wound has reached the point of being ready to be opened,

original: de'i mod la brtol ba'i 'os yin te /
analyzed: de'i mod la brtol ba'i 'os yin te /
translated: it is then ready to be opened.

original: de ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúmaturation.‚ÄùüîΩWhen a clay vessel, such as a pot, a bowl, or a dish, has reached the point of being ready for use,

original: bum pa dang / rdze'u dang / kham phor la sogs pa kham pa'i snod ni gang gi tshe spyad la rag par sbyor ba mthar thug par gyur pa na de'i mod la yongs su spyad pa'i 'os yin te /
analyzed: bum pa dang / rdze'u dang / kham phor la sogs pa kham pa'i snod ni gang gi tshe spyad la rag par sbyor ba mthar thug par gyur pa na de'i mod la yongs su spyad pa'i 'os yin te /
translated: it is then ready to be used.

original: de'i tshe tshos pa zhes bya'o //üîΩshing thog aa mra'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshos pa zhes bya'o // shing thog aa mra'am /
translated: This is called ‚Äúbaking.‚Äù

original: pa na sa la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe yongs su longs spyod la rag par mthar thug par gyur pa na /
analyzed: pa na sa la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe yongs su longs spyod la rag par mthar thug par gyur pa na /
translated: When a fruit, such as a mango or a breadfruit, has reached the point of being ready to be enjoyed,

original: de'i mod la yongs su longs spyod par @43a * //üîΩ'os pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mod la yongs su longs spyod par @43a * // 'os pa yin te /
translated: it is then ready to be enjoyed.

original: de'i tshe yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe yongs su smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúmaturation.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams la kun tu bsten pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa'i mthar thug pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba'i chos rnams la kun tu bsten pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i sbyor ba gang yin pa'i mthar thug pa na /
translated: Similarly, by the cause of constantly relying on virtuous qualities, when one reaches the culmination of correct practice,

original: de'i mod la rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i mod la rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: at that very moment, one becomes completely pure.

original: de ni yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni yongs su smin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: This is the nature of complete ripening.

original: de la yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag rnams ni sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag rnams ni sgrub pa dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Those to be fully ripened are, in brief, of four types, according to the difference of their practice and result.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis nyan thos kyi rigs ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis nyan thos kyi rigs ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la /
translated: Bodhisattvas and the Lord Buddhas bring the ≈õhrƒÅvaka type to full maturity in the ≈õhrƒÅvaka vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la /
translated: the pratyekabuddha type in the pratyekabuddha vehicle,üîΩand the buddha type in the Great Vehicle.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs ni theg pa chen po la yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang / gang zag rigs med pa yang bde 'gror 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su smin par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs ni theg pa chen po la yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang / gang zag rigs med pa yang bde 'gror 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir yongs su smin par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: They also bring those of no specific type to full maturity so that they will go to the happy realms.

original: gang zag rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni gzhi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag tu yongs su smin par bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa bzhi po de dag ni gzhi rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag tu yongs su smin par bya ba yin no ;
translated: These four types of persons are to be matured in these four bases.

original: / de ltar na yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag las yongs su smin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / de ltar na yongs su smin par bya ba'i gang zag las yongs su smin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the person to be matured should be understood in terms of the act of maturation.

original: de la yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin pa'i rnam pa'i dbye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the classification of the aspects of maturation?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
translated: In brief, it is sixfold:

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa dang ; yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa dang ; yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'o //
translated: maturation of the faculties, maturation of the wholesome roots, maturation of knowledge, and lesser, middling, and greater maturation.

original: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa ni tshe dang mdog dang / rigs dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig btsun pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa dang / skyes pa nyid dang / spro ba chen po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po yongs su smin pa ni tshe dang mdog dang / rigs dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa dang / tshig btsun pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa dang / skyes pa nyid dang / spro ba chen po gang yin pa ste /
translated: Maturation of the faculties is the perfection of life, color, family, power, and word-worship, as well as great fame, manhood, and great enthusiasm.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i lus de la brten nas brtul ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa'i lus de la brten nas brtul ba dang / rjes su sbyor ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur te /
translated: On the basis of that body which is the perfect result of evolution, he becomes capable of effort and application.

original: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la yang dag par bsgrub par brtson par bya ba rnams la yid yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas thams cad la yang dag par bsgrub par brtson par bya ba rnams la yid yongs su skyo bar mi 'gyur ba yang yin no //
translated: And he does not become discouraged about the effort to achieve all the branches of knowledge.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the full maturation of the wholesome roots?

original: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung ba de la gnas na de rang bzhin gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung ba de la gnas na de rang bzhin gyis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing /
translated: When he is established in the absence of the afflictions by nature, his mind does not engage in evil, unwholesome dharmas by nature.

original: sgrib pa chung ba dang / rtog pa nyung ba dang / drang zhing mthun par 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa chung ba dang / rtog pa nyung ba dang / drang zhing mthun par 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: He has few obscurations, few thoughts, and is straightforward and honest.

original: shes pa yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa yongs su smin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the full maturation of knowledge?

original: dran pa dang ldan pa dang / @43b yid gzhungs pa dang / legs par gsungs pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun tu shes par bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba dang / rab tu rtogs par bya bar nus pa lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pa dang / @43b yid gzhungs pa dang / legs par gsungs pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don kun tu shes par bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba dang / gzung bar bya ba dang / rab tu rtogs par bya bar nus pa lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: which is capable of understanding, accepting, retaining, and penetrating the meaning of the teachings that have been well spoken or badly spoken.

original: shes rab de la brten na thams cad nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las sems gtan du rnam par grol bar byed pa'i skal ba dang ldan zhing nus pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab de la brten na thams cad nas nyon mongs pa thams cad las sems gtan du rnam par grol bar byed pa'i skal ba dang ldan zhing nus pa yin no //
translated: By relying on this wisdom, he is endowed with the good fortune and the ability to liberate his mind completely and forever from all the defilements.

original: de la dbang po yongs su smin pas ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dbang po yongs su smin pas ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Among these, the maturity of the faculties liberates from the obscurations of retribution.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pas ni las kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pas ni las kyi sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The maturity of the wholesome roots liberates from the obscurations of action.

original: shes pa yongs su smin pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa yongs su smin pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the full maturation of knowledge, one is liberated from the obscurations of the mental afflictions.

original: yongs su smin pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: What is weak full maturation?

original: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su smin pa chung ngur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis yongs su smin pa chung ngur 'gyur te /
translated: It is weak for two reasons:

original: dbang po dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa'i rgyu la yun ring po nas ma goms pa dang / rgyu yongs su ma brtas pa dang / chung ngu la goms pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa'i rgyu la yun ring po nas ma goms pa dang / rgyu yongs su ma brtas pa dang / chung ngu la goms pa'o //
translated: one has not long cultivated the causes of the full maturation of the faculties, the roots of virtue, and knowledge; the causes have not increased; and one has cultivated what is weak.

original: yongs su smin pa 'bring ni rgyu de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig med la /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa 'bring ni rgyu de gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig med la /
translated: Medium full maturation is when one of these two causes is absent,

original: gang yang rung ba zhig yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: but the other is present.

original: yongs su smin pa chen po ni rgyu de gnyis ka yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa chen po ni rgyu de gnyis ka yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Great full maturation is when both of these causes are present.

original: de la yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the means of full maturation?

original: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun du rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of twenty-seven kinds:

original: khams brtas pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa dang / dga' bar 'dzin pa dang / dang po 'jug pa dang / dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par dag pa thag ring ba dang /
analyzed: khams brtas pa dang / da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa dang / dga' bar 'dzin pa dang / dang po 'jug pa dang / dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par dag pa thag ring ba dang /
translated: the development of the elements, the provision of present conditions, the initial engagement, the non-initial engagement, the distant purification,

original: rnam par dag pa thag nye ba dang / sbyor ba dang / bsam pa dang / zang zing nye bar sgrub pa dang / chos nye bar sgrub pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa dang / chos ston pa dang / gsang ste chos brjod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa thag nye ba dang / sbyor ba dang / bsam pa dang / zang zing nye bar sgrub pa dang / chos nye bar sgrub pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa dang / chos ston pa dang / gsang ste chos brjod pa dang /
translated: the near purification, application, intention, the provision of material things, the provision of the Dharma, the attraction through miracles, the teaching of the Dharma, the secret expression of the Dharma,

original: rnam par phye ste chos brjod pa dang / sbyor ba chung ngu dang / sbyor ba 'bring dang / sbyor ba chen po dang / thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa dang / sdud pa dang / tshar gcod pa dang bdag nyid kyis byed pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste chos brjod pa dang / sbyor ba chung ngu dang / sbyor ba 'bring dang / sbyor ba chen po dang / thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa dang / sdud pa dang / tshar gcod pa dang bdag nyid kyis byed pa dang /
translated: the open expression of the Dharma, the small application, the medium application, the great application, hearing, reflection, meditation, gathering, subduing, doing oneself,

original: gzhan la bcol ba dang / de gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: gzhan la bcol ba dang / de gnyi ga'o //
translated: enjoining others, and both.

original: de la khams brtas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la khams brtas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the development of the elements?

original: rang bzhin gyis dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon phun sum tshogs pa la @44a * //üîΩbrten nas / sngon dge ba'i chos la goms pa las dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon rnams phyir zhing phyir zhing rab tu brtas la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon phun sum tshogs pa la @44a * // brten nas / sngon dge ba'i chos la goms pa las dge ba'i chos kyi sa bon rnams phyir zhing phyir zhing rab tu brtas la /
translated: The growth of the constituent element is the growth of the seeds of wholesome dharmas which are naturally present, through the repeated cultivation of wholesome dharmas in the past.üîΩThe growth of the constituent element is the growth of the seeds of wholesome dharmas which are naturally present, through the repeated cultivation of wholesome dharmas in the past.

original: phul du brtas pa skye zhing gnas pa 'di ni khams brtas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phul du brtas pa skye zhing gnas pa 'di ni khams brtas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The growth of the seeds of wholesome dharmas which are naturally present, through the repeated cultivation of wholesome dharmas in the past, is called the growth of the constituent element.

original: de la da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar bsgrub pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of present conditions?

original: tshe 'di nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston la /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston la /
translated: It is the teaching of the Dharma without error in this very life,

original: de la yang phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang phyin ci ma log par 'dzin pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa'o //
translated: and the correct understanding of it, and the practice of the Dharma in conformity with it.

original: de la khams brtas pa ni sngon gyi rgyus da ltar gyi yongs su smin pa 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la khams brtas pa ni sngon gyi rgyus da ltar gyi yongs su smin pa 'grub pa yin no //
translated: The growth of the constituent element is the establishment of the present maturity through a past cause.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar sgrub pa ni rgyu yang da ltar gyi nyid yin la ;
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen nye bar sgrub pa ni rgyu yang da ltar gyi nyid yin la ;
translated: The establishment of present conditions is the cause of the present itself.

original: yongs su smin pa yang da ltar gyi nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa yang da ltar gyi nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the state of complete maturation is the present state.

original: 'jug pa gang zhe na /üîΩdad pa thob pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'jug pa gang zhe na / dad pa thob pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: What is engagement?

original: khyim na gnas na nyes par spyod pa las dben pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par len pa dang / khyim na gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyim na gnas na nyes par spyod pa las dben pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par len pa dang / khyim na gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: It is the taking up of the rules of training in the avoidance of evil conduct, on the part of one who has attained faith, while he is still a layman;

original: rab tu byung na 'dod pa las dben pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par len pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung na 'dod pa las dben pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par len pa yin no //
translated: and it is the taking up of the rules of training in the avoidance of sense-desire, on the part of one who has gone forth from the home life.

original: dga' bar 'dzin pa gang zhe na /üîΩsdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'i lam dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' spangs pa bde ba'i lam la brten na /
analyzed: dga' bar 'dzin pa gang zhe na / sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'i lam dang / 'dod pa'i bde ba dang / bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' spangs pa bde ba'i lam la brten na /
translated: What is the state of delight?

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba bstan pa la mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba bstan pa la mngon par dga' ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the delight in the teaching of the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, on the part of one who has recourse to the path which leads to the cessation of all suffering, and to the path of happiness which avoids the extremes of indulgence in pleasure and mortification of the body.

original: de la dang por 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dang por 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the first engagement?

original: thog ma kho nar skyo bar bya ba'i chos rnams la yid byung ba la brten nas /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar skyo bar bya ba'i chos rnams la yid byung ba la brten nas /
translated: It is the taking up of the rules of training in the avoidance of evil conduct, on the part of one who has attained faith, while he is still a layman.

original: rigs pas don bsgrub pa'i phan yon yang khong du chud nas /
analyzed: rigs pas don bsgrub pa'i phan yon yang khong du chud nas /
translated: The benefit of establishing the meaning through reasoning is also understood.

original: 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni dang po 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni dang po 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is engaged is called ‚Äúinitial engagement.‚Äù

original: dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dang po 'jug pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is not initial engagement?

original: gang zag zhugs zin pa yongs su smin par bya ba la rag las par gyur pa /
analyzed: gang zag zhugs zin pa yongs su smin par bya ba la rag las par gyur pa /
translated: It is that which is dependent on the person who has already entered and is dependent on the ripening of that person.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi btang snyoms mi mdzad par gyur pa la brten cing bkrol ba'i gnas rnams yang dang yang du gsal bar byed pa la yang brten nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi btang snyoms mi mdzad par gyur pa la brten cing bkrol ba'i gnas rnams yang dang yang du gsal bar byed pa la yang brten nas /
translated: It is that which is dependent on the bodhisattvas and the buddhas not abandoning that person, and it is dependent on the person clarifying again and again the points that have been explained.

original: phyir zhing yongs su smin par gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir zhing yongs su smin par gyur pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is that which is dependent on the person ripening again and again.

original: de la rnam par dag pa thag ring ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa thag ring ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is distant purification?

original: le lo'am rkyen dang mi ldan pa la brten nas dus yun ring po 'gyangs pa tshe rabs brjes pa'am /
analyzed: le lo'am rkyen dang mi ldan pa la brten nas dus yun ring po 'gyangs pa tshe rabs brjes pa'am /
translated: It is that which is dependent on laziness or the lack of conditions, and it is that which is dependent on the passage of a long time, the passage of many lifetimes, or the passage of many eons.

original: bskal pa brjes @44b pa mang po zhig gi rnam par dag pa 'gyur ba'i skal pa can du 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa brjes @44b pa mang po zhig gi rnam par dag pa 'gyur ba'i skal pa can du 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the purification of many eons, and it is the good fortune of transformation.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par dag pa thag nye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par dag pa thag nye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the proximity of purification.

original: de la sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is practice?

original: rang gi don thob par bya ba la 'dun pa drag po la yang brten /
analyzed: rang gi don thob par bya ba la 'dun pa drag po la yang brten /
translated: It is the protection of the bases of training through constant and respectful practice, based on a strong aspiration to attain one's own goal,

original: phyi ma la yang log par ltung ba'i 'jigs pa la brten te /
analyzed: phyi ma la yang log par ltung ba'i 'jigs pa la brten te /
translated: based on the fear of falling into a bad destiny in the next life,

original: tshe 'di nyid la gzhan pa la mi snyan par grags pa'i 'jigs pa la yang brten nas /üîΩbslab pa'i gzhi dag la rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed par bsrungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la gzhan pa la mi snyan par grags pa'i 'jigs pa la yang brten nas / bslab pa'i gzhi dag la rtag tu byed pa dang / gus par byed par bsrungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and based on the fear of a bad reputation in this life.

original: de la bsam pa gang zhe na /üîΩchos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩchos rnams la yang dag par rtog pa'i bzod pa la yang brten cing /
analyzed: de la bsam pa gang zhe na / chos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs par bya ba'i phyir / chos rnams la yang dag par rtog pa'i bzod pa la yang brten cing /
translated: What is attitude?

original: yon tan srid pa la yang brten nas /
analyzed: yon tan srid pa la yang brten nas /
translated: It is the acceptance of the correct understanding of the teachings, based on the fear of being carried away from this Dharma and Vinaya,üîΩand based on the fear of the faults of samsara.

original: gzhan dag gi thob pa la yid ches zhing /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi thob pa la yid ches zhing /
translated: It is to have confidence in the attainments of others.

original: dkon mchog gsum dang bdag gi don thob par bya ba la dad pa mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum dang bdag gi don thob par bya ba la dad pa mi g-yo ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is to have unshakable faith in the Three Jewels and in the attainment of one's own goal.

original: zang zing nye bar sgrub pa gang zhe na /üîΩzas dang / skom la sogs pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa rnams la /üîΩzas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / mthun pa'i zas dang skom la sogs pa med pa rnams la yang /
analyzed: zang zing nye bar sgrub pa gang zhe na / zas dang / skom la sogs pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa rnams la / zas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / mthun pa'i zas dang skom la sogs pa med pa rnams la yang /
translated: What is providing material necessities?üîΩ It is to provide food, drink, etc.üîΩto those who have nothing at all, and to provide suitable food, drink, etc.

original: mthun pa'i zas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i zas dang skom la sogs pa nye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: to those who have unsuitable food, drink, etc.

original: de la chos nye bar sgrub pa gang zhe na /üîΩlung 'bogs pas sam /
analyzed: de la chos nye bar sgrub pa gang zhe na / lung 'bogs pas sam /
translated: What is providing the gift of Dharma?üîΩ It is to give the Dharma by means of oral instruction

original: don yang dag par 'grel pas chos rnams sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: don yang dag par 'grel pas chos rnams sbyin par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and by means of the correct explanation of its meaning.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is attracting by psychic power?

original: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pas sems can 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul mthong ngam /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pas sems can 'di dag ni rdzu 'phrul mthong ngam /
translated: It is to attract beings by means of one's psychic power,

original: thos na bstan pa la bsam pa dag pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: thos na bstan pa la bsam pa dag pa thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: When they hear it, they will attain a pure attitude toward the teaching and

original: yang dag par sbyor bar 'gyur ro snyam ste /üîΩsems can rnams kyi bsam pa dag pa'am /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor bar 'gyur ro snyam ste / sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dag pa'am /
translated: will apply themselves correctly.üîΩThus, with compassion for sentient beings,

original: sbyor ba dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba dag pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: whether their attitude is pure or their application is pure,

original: sems can rnams la snying brtse bas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam par ston te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying brtse bas rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam par ston te /
translated: he displays the miracle of psychic power.

original: de dag kyang cho 'phrul des  'dun par byas pa'i yid kyis bsam pa dag pa thob pa'am /
analyzed: de dag kyang cho 'phrul des  'dun par byas pa'i yid kyis bsam pa dag pa thob pa'am /
translated: And those who are inspired by that miracle will attain a pure attitude

original: yang dag par sbyor bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyor bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: and will apply themselves correctly.

original: de la chos ston pa gang zhe na /üîΩbdag nyid kyis rang gi don 'thob par mi nus pa la yang dag par sgrub pa'i grogs su gyur pa'i dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / rus pa @45a * //
analyzed: de la chos ston pa gang zhe na / bdag nyid kyis rang gi don 'thob par mi nus pa la yang dag par sgrub pa'i grogs su gyur pa'i dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / rus pa @45a * //
translated: What is teaching the Dharma?

original: la yang myur du mngon par shes par 'gyur ba dang / mthun pa'i dam pa'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: la yang myur du mngon par shes par 'gyur ba dang / mthun pa'i dam pa'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: It is teaching the Dharma to those who are not able to attain their own goal by themselves, in order to help them accomplish it, and it is teaching the Dharma in a way that is appropriate, that is not contrary to reality, and that is timely.

original: de la gsang ste chos brjod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gsang ste chos brjod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is secret teaching of the Dharma?

original: sems can byis pa shes rab can rnams la /
analyzed: sems can byis pa shes rab can rnams la /
translated: to the simple, to the childish,

original: shin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i chos bcabs te /
analyzed: shin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i chos bcabs te /
translated: is the teaching of the Dharma which is clear, easy to understand,

original: gsal zhing 'jug par sla la /üîΩthabs sla bas 'jug pa'i chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsal zhing 'jug par sla la / thabs sla bas 'jug pa'i chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: and which is entered by easy means.üîΩ2. The teaching of the Dharma which is analyzed

original: rnam par phye ste chos brjod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste chos brjod pa gang zhe na /
translated: is the teaching of the Dharma which elucidates the very extensive and profound subjects

original: sems can shes rab rgya che zhing sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i tshul la legs par zhugs pa rnams la /üîΩshin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i gnas rnam par 'grel pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can shes rab rgya che zhing sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i tshul la legs par zhugs pa rnams la / shin tu rgya che zhing zab pa'i gnas rnam par 'grel pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: to those who have a vast understanding and who have entered well into the way of the teaching of the Buddha.

original: de la sbyor ba chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: 3. What is little application?

original: rtag tu sbyor ba med pa dang / gus par sbyor ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba med pa dang / gus par sbyor ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of constant application and the absence of respectful application.

original: de la sbyor ba 'bring gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba 'bring gang zhe na /
translated: 4. What is medium application?

original: rtag tu sbyor ba med pa dang / gus par sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba 'di gnyis las gang yang rung ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba med pa dang / gus par sbyor ba med pa'i sbyor ba 'di gnyis las gang yang rung ba med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of either one of these two applications, the absence of constant application and the absence of respectful application.

original: de la sbyor ba chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba chen po gang zhe na /
translated: 5. What is great application?

original: sbyor ba de gnyis ka dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba de gnyis ka dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is the application of both of these.

original: rtag tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / gus pas sbyor ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor ba dang ldan pa dang / gus pas sbyor ba dang ldan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the application of constant practice and the application of respectful practice.

original: de la thob pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thob pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is acquisition?

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la mos pas mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / kha ton byed pa la mngon par brtson pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la mos pas mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnams len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / kha ton byed pa la mngon par brtson pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the acquisition of the Dharma of the Sutras, etc., by means of faith in the teaching of the Buddha, and it is the effort to retain and recite it.

original: de la sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is reflection?

original: rab tu dben par chos nges par sems pa la mngon par dga' bas don la mngon par rtog pa dang / kun tu dpyod pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben par chos nges par sems pa la mngon par dga' bas don la mngon par rtog pa dang / kun tu dpyod pa dang / gtan la 'bebs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the joy of reflecting on the Dharma in solitude, and it is the investigation, examination and decision concerning the meaning.

original: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is cultivation?

original: zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu rnams yang dag par rtogs pa sngon du btang bas zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / btang snyoms la goms par byed par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu rnams yang dag par rtogs pa sngon du btang bas zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / btang snyoms la goms par byed par dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the joy of cultivating calm, insight and equanimity, having previously understood their causes.

original: de la sdud pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sdud pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is inclusion?

original: yang dag par zang zing med pa'i sems kyis slob dpon dang / mkhan po'i tshul du rten sbyin par byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur rnam sna tshogs kyang byed de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag par zang zing med pa'i sems kyis slob dpon dang / mkhan po'i tshul du rten sbyin par byed pa dang / bsnyen bkur rnam sna tshogs kyang byed de / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the giving of support with a pure, disinterested mind, in the manner of a teacher or a preceptor, and the rendering of various kinds of service.üîΩWhat are the various kinds of service?

original: nad pa la rim gros bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos dang mthun par gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman gyis bsnyen bkur byed pa dag /
analyzed: nad pa la rim gros bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos dang mthun par gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman gyis bsnyen bkur byed pa dag /
translated: They are: service through nursing the sick, and service through providing robes, alms-food, bedding, seat and medicine for the sick in conformity with the Dharma;

original: mya ngan dang 'gyod pa bsal bas @45b bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa bsal bas bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni bsnyen bkur rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan dang 'gyod pa bsal bas @45b bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa bsal bas bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni bsnyen bkur rnam pa sna tshogs byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: service through dispelling sorrow and regret; service through dispelling the defilements; and other similar kinds of service.

original: tshar gcod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshar gcod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the act of suppression?

original: bdag la yod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kun tu bsrungs nas /
analyzed: bdag la yod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams kun tu bsrungs nas /
translated: It is the protection of oneself against the defilements which have arisen.

original: nyes pa chung ngu byed pa la ni 'khrul pa gleng bar byed /
analyzed: nyes pa chung ngu byed pa la ni 'khrul pa gleng bar byed /
translated: When they commit a minor fault, they are reprimanded.

original: nyes pa 'bring byed pa la ni spro bar byed /
analyzed: nyes pa 'bring byed pa la ni spro bar byed /
translated: When they commit a moderate fault, they are scolded.

original: nyes pa chen po byed pa la ni skod  par byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa chen po byed pa la ni skod  par byed de /
translated: When they commit a grave fault, they are expelled.

original: de la gleng pa gang yin pa dang / spyo ba gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid dang / de las gzhan pa dag la yang phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la gleng pa gang yin pa dang / spyo ba gang yin pa de ni de dag nyid dang / de las gzhan pa dag la yang phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The reprimand and scolding are for the benefit and well-being of those who are reprimanded and scolded, and also for the benefit and well-being of others.

original: slar dgug pa'i phyir bskrad pa gang yin pa de yang de dag nyid dang / gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar dgug pa'i phyir bskrad pa gang yin pa de yang de dag nyid dang / gzhan dag la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The expulsion for the purpose of reconciliation is for the benefit and well-being of those who are expelled and also for the benefit and well-being of others.

original: slar mi dgug par bskrad pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan dag kho na la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gzhan dag gis nyes par byas pa'i gzhis bskrad pa de ;
analyzed: slar mi dgug par bskrad pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan dag kho na la phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba yin te / 'di ltar gzhan dag gis nyes par byas pa'i gzhis bskrad pa de ;
translated: The expulsion that is not for the purpose of reconciliation is for the benefit and well-being of others alone.

original: gzhan dag la mthong nas nyes pa mi bya bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag la mthong nas nyes pa mi bya bar sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because others, seeing that one who has committed a fault has been expelled,üîΩwill think, ‚ÄúWe must not commit such a fault.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na bdag nyid kyis yongs su smin par byed ce na /üîΩmi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag nyid kyis yongs su smin par byed ce na / mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
translated: How does he bring them to full maturity?

original: dge ba'i gnas su bzhag pa'i phyir mthun pa'i chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su bzhag pa'i phyir mthun pa'i chos kyang ston to //
translated: He teaches them the Dharma in accordance with what is appropriate, in order to lift them out of the unwholesome states and establish them in the wholesome states.

original: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pa yang yin te /üîΩrang gi tshig dang mthun par rjes su zhugs pa ni chos kyi rang nyid rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs nas /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de bzhin du byed pa yang yin te / rang gi tshig dang mthun par rjes su zhugs pa ni chos kyi rang nyid rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs nas /
translated: He acts in accordance with what he teaches,üîΩfor he practices what he preaches.üîΩHaving established himself in the Dharma,

original: de dang mthun par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de dang mthun par 'jug pa ste /
translated: he practices in accordance with the Dharma.

original: ji nas gzhan dag 'di skad du khyod bdag nyid kyang da dung mi dge ba'i gnas nas ma langs shing /
analyzed: ji nas gzhan dag 'di skad du khyod bdag nyid kyang da dung mi dge ba'i gnas nas ma langs shing /
translated: How is this? Others might say, ‚ÄúYou yourself have not risen from the unwholesome states

original: dge ba'i gnas la yang gnas par ma gyur na /
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas la yang gnas par ma gyur na /
translated: and have not yet been established in the wholesome states.

original: ci'i phyir khyod kyis gzhan dag de la yang dag par len du 'jug cing bskul ba dang / dran par byed par sems /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khyod kyis gzhan dag de la yang dag par len du 'jug cing bskul ba dang / dran par byed par sems /
translated: Why do you want to cause others to take up and practice that?‚Äù

original: khyod bdag nyid kyang da dung gzhan dag gis bskul ba dang / dran par bya ba dang / yang dag par len du gzhug dgos so zhes zer bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin no //
