analyzed: khyod bdag nyid kyang da dung gzhan dag gis bskul ba dang / dran par bya ba dang / yang dag par len du gzhug dgos so zhes zer bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba yin no //
translated: You should not say, ‚ÄúI myself must still be urged, reminded, and encouraged by others.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na gzhan dag la bcol ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzhan dag la bcol ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are entrusted to others?

original: sems can rnams gang la shas cher dga' zhing gus pa yod par gyur la /
analyzed: sems can rnams gang la shas cher dga' zhing gus pa yod par gyur la /
translated: They are entrusted to those beings who have a great deal of faith and respect,

original: de yang chos bstan pa'i thabs shes shing legs par bslab par gyur pa de la bcol zhing yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byed du 'jug pa @46a * //
analyzed: de yang chos bstan pa'i thabs shes shing legs par bslab par gyur pa de la bcol zhing yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byed du 'jug pa @46a * //
translated: and who know the method of teaching the Dharma and are well trained.

original: yin no // gnyi gas bya ba ni de gnyis 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: yin no // gnyi gas bya ba ni de gnyis 'dus pa ste /
translated: The activity of both is when they are combined,

original: bdag kyang byed cing gzhan dag la yang bcol nas yongs su smin par byed pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag kyang byed cing gzhan dag la yang bcol nas yongs su smin par byed pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: and it should be understood that they bring beings to maturity by doing it themselves and by entrusting it to others.

original: de ltar na yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs kyi tshul rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun po 'dis yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug po dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs kyi tshul rnam pa nyi shu rtsa bdun po 'dis yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug po dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang /
translated: Thus, by these seventeen aspects of the means of bringing about complete maturation, the six kinds of complete maturation, namely, complete maturation of the faculties, complete maturation of the wholesome roots,

original: shes pa yongs su smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po de phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa yongs su smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po de phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: complete maturation of knowledge, and complete maturation that is small, middling, and great, are perfected.

original: de la yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yongs su smin par byed pa'i gang zag rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the persons who bring about complete maturation?

original: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' sa drug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa drug po dag sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na byang chub sems dpa' sa drug la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa drug po dag sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: In brief, the bodhisattvas who abide in the six levels bring about the complete maturation of sentient beings.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa dang / spyod pa la 'jug pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la zhugs pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage of action through devoted interest is one who practices with devoted interest. The bodhisattva who is on the stage of pure universal responsibility is one who has pure universal responsibility.

original: nges pa'i sal gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges par gyur pa dang / nges pa'i spyod pa drug pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges pa'i spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa dang / mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i sal gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges par gyur pa dang / nges pa'i spyod pa drug pa'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nges pa'i spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa dang / mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stage of certain conduct is one who has attained certainty. The bodhisattva who is on the stage of certain conduct is one who has entered the stage of certain conduct. The bodhisattva who is on the stage of ultimate arrival is one who has attained the ultimate.

original: de la rigs med par gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi bde 'gror 'gro ba'i yongs su smin pa ni yang dang yang du phyir ldog cing yang dang yang du bya dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rigs med par gnas pa'i gang zag rnams kyi bde 'gror 'gro ba'i yongs su smin pa ni yang dang yang du phyir ldog cing yang dang yang du bya dgos pa yin no //
translated: The spiritual maturity that leads to happy rebirth for those persons who are not of the spiritual lineage is reversible, and must be accomplished again and again.

original: rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi yongs su smin pa ni phyir mi ldog cing yang dang yang du bya mi dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi yongs su smin pa ni phyir mi ldog cing yang dang yang du bya mi dgos pa yin no //
translated: The full maturity of those who are established in the spiritual lineage is irreversible and does not require repeated practice.

original: de la yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid mtshan ma dang rtags gang gis sems can rnams kyi yongs su smin pa'i bye brag gcod cing nye bar mtshon par byed pa ni smin pa'i mtshan nyid de brjod do //
analyzed: de la yongs su smin pa'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid mtshan ma dang rtags gang gis sems can rnams kyi yongs su smin pa'i bye brag gcod cing nye bar mtshon par byed pa ni smin pa'i mtshan nyid de brjod do //
translated: The characteristics of the person who is fully matured are the signs and the indications by which the specific types of maturity of sentient beings are discerned and revealed.

original: mdor bsdu na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: In brief, there are two types of maturity, distinguished according to cause and result.

original: rgyur gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyur gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gnyis te /
translated: The characteristics that pertain to the cause are also twofold:

original: bsam pa dang las kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang las kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: they are distinguished according to attitude and activity.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics?

original: @46b nyan thos ni sngon dge ba la goms pas gang gi tshe smin pa chung ngu la gnas par gyur pa de ni 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba yin te /
analyzed: @46b nyan thos ni sngon dge ba la goms pas gang gi tshe smin pa chung ngu la gnas par gyur pa de ni 'dun pa chung ba dang / sbyor ba chung ba yin te /
translated: The sravaka who is established in the lesser stage of maturity has a lesser aspiration and a lesser application because he has previously cultivated virtue to a lesser degree.

original: ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang mi thob cing tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la tshe de nyid la dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang mi thob cing tshe 'di nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thob bo //
translated: He does not go to the lower realms, but he does not attain the fruit of the religious life in that very life, nor does he attain nirvana in that very life.

original: gang gi tshe smin pa 'bring la gnas par gyur pa de ni 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe smin pa 'bring la gnas par gyur pa de ni 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring yin te /
translated: When he is situated in middling evolutionary maturity, he has middling aspiration and middling application.

original: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe de nyid la yang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe de nyid la yang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: He does not go to the lower realms, and he attains the fruit of the religious life in that very life.

original: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But he does not attain nirvana in that very life.

original: yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa 'di ni 'dun pa che ba dang / sbyor ba che ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa 'di ni 'dun pa che ba dang / sbyor ba che ba yin te /
translated: When he is situated in great evolutionary maturity, he has great aspiration and great application.

original: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe 'di nyid la yang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la tshe 'di nyid la yang dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: He does not go to the lower realms, and he attains the fruit of the religious life in that very life.

original: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And he attains nirvana in that very life.

original: rang sangs rgyas ni nyan thos ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas ni nyan thos ji lta ba de kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The Pratyekabuddha is to be understood just as the Sravaka.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni nyan thos rnams dang / lam gyi rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos rnams dang / lam gyi rang bzhin mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Sravakas and the Pratyekabuddhas are similar in their path.

original: nyan thos rnams las rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams las rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between the Sravakas and the Pratyekabuddhas is this:

original: srid pa tha ma la lus tha ma thob par 'gyur ba ni slob dpon med par sngon goms pa'i dbang gis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams bsgoms nas /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma la lus tha ma thob par 'gyur ba ni slob dpon med par sngon goms pa'i dbang gis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun po rnams bsgoms nas /
translated: In their last existence, having obtained their last body, without a teacher, by the power of their former practice, they cultivate the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment and

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid mngon sum du byed de /
translated: they realize the state of Arhatship, having abandoned all the defilements.

original: de lta bas na rang sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rang sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called Pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni yongs su smin pa chung ngu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa ni yongs su smin pa chung ngu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva who is on the stage of action in faith is to be known as having small faculties.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa ni smin pa 'bring po yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa ni smin pa 'bring po yin no //
translated: The one who has a pure superior attitude is of middling faculties.

original: nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur pa ni smin pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: nges pa dang mthar thug par gyur pa ni smin pa chen po yin no //
translated: The great maturity is the one that is certain and final.

original: de la smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dun pa chung ngu dang / sbyor ba chung ngu yin te /
analyzed: de la smin pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dun pa chung ngu dang / sbyor ba chung ngu yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the small maturity has small aspiration and small application.

original: ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang 'gro la /
translated: He goes to the miserable destinies.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa dang por gtogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: He is included in the first incalculable eon.

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa thams cad dang mi ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: He does not possess any of the virtues of the factors of enlightenment, whether they are the virtues of the path of cultivation, the virtues of the unshakable, or the virtues of the very pure.

original: smin pa 'bring gi byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring yin te /
analyzed: smin pa 'bring gi byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dun pa 'bring dang sbyor ba 'bring yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the middling maturity has middling aspiration and middling application.

original: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la /
translated: He does not go to the miserable destinies.

original: @47a * // bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis par gtogs te /
analyzed: @47a * // bskal pa grangs med pa gnyis par gtogs te /
translated: He is included in the second incalculable eon.

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba rnams dang mi ldan la shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams dang ni mi ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba rnams dang mi ldan la shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams dang ni mi ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is not endowed with the virtues of the factors of enlightenment that are purified, nor with those that are unshakable, nor with those that are extremely pure.

original: yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dun pa che ba dang sbyor ba che ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa chen po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dun pa che ba dang sbyor ba che ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the stage of great maturity has great aspiration and great application.

original: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la /
analyzed: ngan song rnams su yang mi 'gro la /
translated: He does not go to the unfortunate planes of existence.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum par gtogs te /
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa gsum par gtogs te /
translated: He is included among those who belong to the third incalculable eon.

original: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos byang chub kyi phyogs sbyangs pa dang / mi g-yo ba dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with the virtues of the factors of enlightenment that are purified, unshakable, and extremely pure.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis brling ba dang ; gsal ba dang 'bras bu shin tu che ba dang phan yon shin tu che ba'i phyir sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis brling ba dang ; gsal ba dang 'bras bu shin tu che ba dang phan yon shin tu che ba'i phyir sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called purified because they are naturally firm, clear, have a great result, and have a great benefit.

original: phyir mi ldog pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa dang / khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called unshakable because they are irreversible, unretrogressive, and progressive.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i nang na gong na med pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i nang na gong na med pa'i phyir shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúpurified‚Äù because it is unsurpassed among the bodhisattva stages.

original: de la zang zing las gyur pa'i yongs su smin pa gang yin pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byas pa las byung ba gang yin pa dang / gsang ste chos brjod pa las gyur pa gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba chung ngu las gyur pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de la zang zing las gyur pa'i yongs su smin pa gang yin pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyis 'dun par byas pa las byung ba gang yin pa dang / gsang ste chos brjod pa las gyur pa gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba chung ngu las gyur pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: Among these, the five kinds of incomplete ripening are the ripening that comes from material things, that which comes from being attracted by miracles, that which comes from secret Dharma teachings, that which comes from small application, and that which comes from mere hearing.

original: thos pa tsam las gyur pa'i yongs su smin pa gang yin pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos de dag yun ring por goms par byas kyang chung ngu kho na yin la yun thung ngur goms par byas pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: thos pa tsam las gyur pa'i yongs su smin pa gang yin pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnam pa lnga po 'di dag ni dge ba'i chos de dag yun ring por goms par byas kyang chung ngu kho na yin la yun thung ngur goms par byas pa lta ci smos /
translated: These five kinds of incomplete ripening are small even when the wholesome roots have been cultivated for a long time, not to speak of when they have been cultivated for a short time.

original: yongs su smin pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa thams cad ni yongs su smin pa rnam pa gsum gyi tshul du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa thams cad ni yongs su smin pa rnam pa gsum gyi tshul du rig par bya ste /
translated: All the other causes of ripening should be understood in terms of the three kinds of ripening.

original: chung du goms pas ni chung ngur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung du goms pas ni chung ngur 'gyur ro //
translated: By lesser cultivation, it is lesser.

original: 'bring du goms pas ni 'bring /
analyzed: 'bring du goms pas ni 'bring /
translated: By middling cultivation, it is middling.

original: cher goms pas ni yongs su smin pa che bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: cher goms pas ni yongs su smin pa che bar rig par bya'o //
translated: By greater cultivation, it is greater.

original: yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po de dag re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum gyi tshul du rig par bya ste /üîΩchung ngu la yang chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po la yang 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po dang / chen po la yang chen po'i chung ngu dang /
analyzed: yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang 'bring dang / chen po de dag re re la yang rnam pa gsum gsum gyi tshul du rig par bya ste / chung ngu la yang chung ngu'i chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring po la yang 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po dang / chen po la yang chen po'i chung ngu dang /
translated: Each of these lesser, middling, and greater maturations should be understood in terms of three modes.

original: chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chen po'o //
translated: The lesser has lesser of the lesser, lesser of the middling, and lesser of the greater. The middling has middling of the lesser, middling of the middling, and middling of the greater. The greater has greater of the lesser, greater of the middling, and greater of the greater.

original: de lta bu dang mthun par sangs @47b rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gong nas gong du rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis sems can rnams kyi yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshad med par mdzad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun par sangs @47b rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gong nas gong du rab tu dbye ba'i tshul gyis sems can rnams kyi yongs su smin pa'i rab tu dbye ba tshad med par mdzad par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that in accordance with such methods, the buddhas and bodhisattvas ripen sentient beings through immeasurable differentiations of ripening, by means of the method of ever higher distinctions.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i thabs de dag gis gzhan gsol ba 'debs pa ma gtogs pa'i bde ba gnyis la rgyud la dbang po yongs su smin pa nas nyes pa smin pa'i bar dang / smin pa chung ngu nas chen po'i bar gyis buddha'i chos rnams rgyu 'bras smin pa ni gang smin pa'i bdag ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i thabs de dag gis gzhan gsol ba 'debs pa ma gtogs pa'i bde ba gnyis la rgyud la dbang po yongs su smin pa nas nyes pa smin pa'i bar dang / smin pa chung ngu nas chen po'i bar gyis buddha'i chos rnams rgyu 'bras smin pa ni gang smin pa'i bdag ces bya ba dang /
translated: By means of those methods as they have been taught, except for the supplication of others, the ripening of the faculties in the continuum of the two kinds of bliss, from the ripening of faults to the small ripening and the great ripening, the ripening of the causes and effects of the qualities of a buddha is called the self that is ripened.

original: sems can gzhan rnams thams cad ces pa dang / gang zag gzhan rnams zhes pa gsum mo //
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams thams cad ces pa dang / gang zag gzhan rnams zhes pa gsum mo //
translated: The three are all sentient beings, other sentient beings, and other persons.

original: de bzhin du sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan yang dbang po la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gzhan dang gang zag gzhan yang dbang po la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: Similarly, other sentient beings and other persons are those who obtain the faculties and so on.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs su smin pa'i rgyu ji skad bstan pa 'di dag gi bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan rnams theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po yongs su smin pa dang /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' ni yongs su smin pa'i rgyu ji skad bstan pa 'di dag gi bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan rnams theg pa gsum gyis nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir dbang po yongs su smin pa dang /
translated: Here, bodhisattvas, in order to ripen their own qualities of buddhahood and in order to ripen other sentient beings and other individuals through the three vehicles, correctly accomplish the ripening of their faculties,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dang / shes pa yongs su smin pa dang / yongs su smin pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po yang dag par sgrub par byed do //
translated: the ripening of their roots of virtue, the ripening of their knowledge, and the lesser, middling, and great forms of ripening.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las yongs su smin pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi'i rnal 'byor gyi gnas las yongs su smin pa'i le'u ste drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes the chapter on ripening, the sixth in the section on yogas that is part of The Treatise on the Stages of the Path to Enlightenment.

original: // / de la byang chub gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / de la byang chub gang zhe na /
translated: What is enlightenment?

original: mdor bsdu na spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis la ni byang chub ces bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis la ni byang chub ces bya ste /
translated: In brief, enlightenment is said to be twofold: the twofold abandonment and the twofold knowledge.

original: de la spangs pa rnam pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //üîΩye shes rnam pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas dri ma med cing nyon mongs pa thams cad dang rjes su 'brel pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med cing sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la spangs pa rnam pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o // ye shes rnam pa gnyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs nas dri ma med cing nyon mongs pa thams cad dang rjes su 'brel pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med cing sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes gang yin pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of abandonment are the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions and the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience.üîΩThe two kinds of exalted wisdom are the exalted wisdom that, having abandoned the afflictive obstructions, is stainless and not associated with any afflictions and the exalted wisdom that, having abandoned the obstructions to omniscience, is unobstructed and unimpeded with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa ni bla @48a * //üîΩna med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / chags pa med pa'i ye shes dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yang dag par bcom pa dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa ni bla @48a * //üîΩna med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: Another enumeration is that unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is the perfect exalted wisdom, the exalted wisdom of omniscience, the exalted wisdom free from attachment, the exalted wisdom that has completely conquered all the habitual tendencies of the afflictions, and the exalted wisdom that has completely abandoned all nonafflictive ignorance.

original: de la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du gtan spangs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad rnam pa thams cad du gtan spangs pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that is the complete and permanent abandonment of all the afflictions together with their traces is called ‚Äúpurity.‚Äù

original: khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du mkhyen pa thogs pa med par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad dang / dus thams cad du mkhyen pa thogs pa med par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The unobstructed engagement of knowledge with respect to all constituents, all things, all aspects, and all times is called ‚Äúomniscience.‚Äù
